1.content:
Space, as Captain Kirk might put it, "the Final Frontier".

Or in regards to today's traffic in the Saxxonian Galaxy, it may as well have been just a huge parking lot.

In the three dimensions of travel, one can either go forwards, backwards, upwards or downwards. Maybe even diagonally if you've got one of those new Mustangs. But according to the Driver's Manual of the Galaxy(ies), initiating a criss-cross maneuver in a non-maneuvering zone was a penalty of 5000 credits, money that Meitnerium didn't quite care to cough up.

"Great Faith!" she shouted at the Volkswagen in front, who had stopped prematurely with plenty more room to scoot forward into the lane. On the fender, the words "student" and "driver" did little to ease the hotheaded girl's rage. She slammed both hands down on her Porschette's horn in fury and started beating on the steering wheel. Finally she could get moving! Her slender foot pumped a little fuel into the modest sports vehicle before having to immediately stomp on the break pedal again.

The young metalean fumed; she had been dealing with this bozo for thirty minutes now! It was obvious that it was his first time driving, but he could have picked a better place to start out than the inter-frickin'-stellar highway! Had there been room to get out on the highway, or breathable air, this joker would be getting the beating of a lifetime! Fortunately for him, there wasn't. And she wouldn't. Meitnerium of the Metalement Galaxy would just have to be patient; which wasn't one of her strong suits.

She roared from behind the sound-proofed glass of her car, making the most disturbing and animalistic faces as she voiced her disapproval of the kid ahead of her. She could see the driver, a teenaged boy of Willixian descent, check his rearview mirror meekly; his face twisted in horror at the deranged madwoman and her frightening expressions. He mouthed his apologies and allowed her to pass him vertically, lowering his own vehicle slightly so that she may pass without skimming the hood of her car on the lane of traffic overhead.

"Well thank Faith!" Meitnerium spat as she shot the kid a proverbial bird. Her lead foot syndrome flaring up again as she sped past the other drivers with blatant disregard for traffic laws. Checking her mirrors to see if she had an out, the young driver quickly turned onto the road to Steez Technical School. Thanks to that little jerkface wanna-be driver, she was going to be late to first period.

Not long after, Meitnerium's target was within sight. She turned up the shields, pumped the gas, and turned on the AC in preparation for entering the atmosphere. There was the traditional gravitational speedbump which she had grown accustomed to, then like any good driver does, she turned down the gravity to neutral so as not to stress the tires before speeding down the ramp to Steez Tech. As a planet solely dedicated to education and whatnot, it was relatively small in circumference with a large building pillaring from the ground. But all that meant was a five minute drive to the surface and about a thirty minute elevator ride to reach her first period.

The young student groaned as she rolled onto the parking lot, keeping her foot on the breaks as she slowed in velocity. "Man, that fat bitch is gonna kill me." Meitnerian cursed under her breath as she searched the expansive lot for a space to park, "What is, this my fifth time being late?"

With some luck, she managed to find a decent space about ten minutes walking distance from the entrance, it was beter than nothing. So, bidding adieu to her fuzzy dice and zebra-print seat covers, Meitnerium grabbed her things, opened the door, and started hoofing it through the parking lot.

With her tan cardigan, jeans, and flats, Meitnerium looked every bit the "college girl" role one might expect. She held her purse in the crevice of her elbow, which held her cosmetology nook and thusly allowed her to touch up her makeup with her free hands as she trekked towards class. Yep, every bit the college student. Everything except the fact that her skin was the softest shade of green and the antennae that bobbed from the top of her head.

It wasn't a bad thing. A lot of species out there had stranger colors to their skin -orange, red, blurple- and her whole family, better yet, her whole species had green pigmintation to their skin. The only real problem there was for a metalean was finding clothes that went well with their particular shade of the color. But fortunately, she had been blessed with long, ivory hair and deep amber eyes to accentuate her beauty and thus opening up her options in clothing. She was also graced with small antennae, an almost universal attraction in her species save for a few perverts with weird fetishes. They dangled and bobbed cutely from their stalks rooted in her soft white locks, squishy to the touch yet with a hint of firmness; leading to a universally agreed hottie.

So yeah, everything was cool.

11.content:
As she stumbled into the building, the familiar scent of old books flooded her schnoz unwarranted. It always made her want to sneeze. She said her customary hellos to the office officials up front as she was prescribed a late pass under the excuse of "car troubles". "Goodbye student number 155367!" said the automated voice. They always seemed so artificially cheery, it creeped her and a lot of other students out. Probably because they were robots, yeah that was probably it.

Nearly sprinting down the hallways to spare herself an even more harsh tongue lashing than before, Meitnerium came to a stop at the elevator and pressed the 'up' button. Rummaging through her purse, finding and checking her phone for the time, Meitnerium grew impatient. "Come on, come on..." she mumbled. Suddenly the metallic seals let out a soft 'ding' before they opened, revealing a set of glass doors that slid open, and she entered the compartment. Turning to the wall's touchscreen, she held down the 'SHIFT' button and pressed the 1, 2, 7, and 'ENTER' keys.

Slowly but surely, the antiquated elevator started moving upwards towards the one-hundred-and-twenty-seventh floor. "These things are so slow." the young snow-haired student said to herself as she tapped her foot impatiently. It was understandable that they were slow, having such a long vertical trek ahead of them. And sure, the dangers of matter transporters were obvious. But the many other colleges she visited, and subsequently rejected from, at least had escalated elevators that cut the high time of travel in a third...

And boy would that third of a timeslot have been appreciated. Lo and behold, nearly twenty minutes after actually entering the elevator, Meitnerium finally reached her destination. It certainly didn't help that the damndable thing stopped at least seven times so that other students could get on. But rather than bitch about it, Meitnerium would settle for finally getting to her Cosmetology class. It wasn't her best subject, but it always provided a nice cushion should her other career ideas not pull through.

She took a deep breath. No doubt that oversized sow Mrs. Henderson would have something to say about her recent spell of tardies, but she could handle it. Who was she to judge, surely she had trouble getting places on time too with that ginormous body of hers. Meitnerium snorted at the prospect of her teacher having a life, "Poor fat cow can barely waddle around class, let alone go to the club."

"Ahem."

A sultry voice came from behind her. One that she recognized as, without a doubt, Mrs. Henderson. The green pigmented lass turned slowly to face the behemoth of her nightmares, standing three feet away (assuming that her belly counted, it would be a mere half-a-foot) with her chubby arms folded over her stomach. Behind her glasses, a patented glare of malice aimed directly at Meitnerium shone with a distinctly wicked intent. "Miss Perioda." she said in a husky voice, her multiply chinned face frowning deeply, "I don't have time for you today."

Like a good majority of women that hailed from the Saxxonian Galaxy, Mrs. Henderson was a woman of amplitude in all three of her axis. She was inexplicably tall, standing at well over 2 meters vertically and a good meter and thensome in depth. Horizontally she was the average woman, if not a little wider in the shoulders than most, overall giving her a very intimidating appearance and explained why all fat jokes were conducted in her absence. "Why even bother having your Daddy pay for college if you aren't going to attend classes?"

"Oh come on Mrs. Henderson!" Meitnerium pleaded, "Just one more chance, it's only my fifth tardy!"

"This month."

"Please!!"

"No, you're late. Go talk to the dean."

"But I'm only..." Meitnerium peered inside the door's window and checked the clock on the wall. "Five, ten, fifteen... fifty-five minutes?" she counted aloud, "That's pretty damn late!"

"So you see my point."

***

"Stupid, lousy, whale'uva professor." Meitnerium cursed her absent teacher with fervor as she await the arrival of the dean in his office. This was after she had calmed down some, the words were both indescribable and unpronounceable before she had taken a few deep breaths on the long elevator ride up.

"It's not my fault people can't drive!"

"I was only a little late!"

"It's not like I haven't been late before!"

"She should really start expecting things like this!"

"I can't be held accountable for her inexperienced attitude with my style of college attendance!"

And with that, she huffed and crossed her arms over her green bosom and started to pout; her eyebrows furrowed, tongue in cheek, and bottom lip bitten down on. She heard a loud clapping from behind her. "Bravo, Ms. Perioda." the elderly dean said from the entrance, "I think that last one was my favorite, mind if we put it on a poster for College Humor?" he chuckled as his elderly Willixian body shuffled towards his desk.

"Perhaps if you were as prepared as you are clever, you'd be able to get to class on time." Meitnerium rolled her eyes, she had gotten used to this kind of treatment from the faculty around here. Always "if you just did [this]" or "If only you'd [that]", it was really starting to bug her. "Hahaha, yeah." she said curtly, "Look, I know why I'm in here, so can I just go back to class?" she leaned forward slightly, "I mean, if you keep me here, aren't I just missing more class than before."

The smile on the dean's face faded at her impertinence, his cheery demeanor replaced with a disapproving scowl. "It would be wise for you to hold your tongue, Ms. Perioda." he said sharply, "It'd be a shame for those pretty antennae of yours to get ripped off in a futilistic struggle with an old man." she gulped, somewhat intimidated by his sudden threat. While no means a 'scary' man, it would serve to reason that he could do a lot of damage given the element of surprise.

"Now, about your attendance record." he said once cooled off a bit, "It seems that in the last month you've arrived late to class at least 5 times."

She slumped her shoulders, growing a little uneasy in her defense. "Yeah, I have, but today wasn't my fault, I was caught in traffic!"

"I'm aware. That was my nephew, delivering my heart medication."

"Oh."
11.title: The Inexplicably Long Introduction... Continues...

Or maybe Los Angeles, a famous town with its own history of UFO sightings...
Those are too expected, she's gonna land...
111.content:
"TRANSFER!!" Meitnerium roared, once again behind the wheel of her Porschette and in a state of intense fury. At the suggestion of the Dean himself, Meitnerium was to be no longer considered a student of Steez Technical School and was to be relocated to a college somewhere in the Transylvania Galaxy. Otherwise known as the freak show parade. She had heard the stories, crazy orgies and incest carrying their influence to other planets...

Meitnerium roared even louder as she thought of all the hard work she had put into her studies (none) and how much she had paid to go to Steez (little to nothing) and put it all into perspective (negatively). "Ugh!" she groaned, "I hate, HATE, everyone at that stupid, STUPID college!" she wailed, now beating on her steering wheel once more as she cruised down interstellar highway 56,400. "And I'm going to have to live in that awful, smelly, rank DISGUSTING place with all of those raunchy, sex-crazed freaks from Transvestite!"

However, Fate would soon deliver her salvation from the yucky slums of the most perverted galaxy in the universe. In the form of a natural disaster, no less. Just as she roared and wailed about her misfortunes, a mass of fiery rock loomed over the unusually deserted highway...

"I cannot STAND trannies!" she spat, finishing up her little tantrum for the afternoon. "I need to binge." she sighed, reaching into her pocket and pulling out two food tablets and swallowing them. "Ah, that's better." she sighed contentedly when she noticed an obscenely large amount of light coming from behind her. "Ugh, that better not be a cop." she said, checking the rearview mirror. To her shock, a meteor was speeding behind her. Instinctively, she let her lead foot do the talking for her. It wasn't that she was afraid of dying; even admittedly wussy models like her Porschette had been equipped for the high-pressure of space and meteor impact. It was more like "Dad said I can't get into another wreck or he'll take my license!"

Of course, this shortsightedness was simply due to the fact that she had grown up with meteor insulation her entire life and her species as a whole was rather durable, she never expected what was to come...

As the meteor struck the rear of her Porschette, instead of simply tipping her out of the way and back onto the highway, it instead pushed the car offlight-road and into the vast expanse of the universe. She attempted to turn, but the meteor was going far too fast, it wound up propelling her for hours and eventually into uncharted territory!

The metalean checked her UPS, it read 'Milky Way', she was out in the boonies! The aliens out here were hicks! Complete and total rednecks with no cool, well, ANYTHING! At the very least, she was sure to find someone out here who knew how to get this rock out of her fender. If it ever stopped, which it didn't. It seemed dead-set on reaching a tiny blue marble off in the distance.

"Ohcrapohcrapohcrap!" she shouted, trying desperately to find a light-ramp on the diagram displayed on her navigational system. But alas, there was nothing to be found! No light-ramp, no directory, no one could help her! "Planetary Collision is NOT covered by my insurance!" Meitnerium shouted as she plummeted further and further down towards the ever-growing blue speck in her windshield. She tried turning, she tried giving it gas, she even tried the breaks, but to no avail. She was going to hit that planet. She was going to hit... Earth.

((Now, in no small part due to the word limit instituted on Writing.com, you will be given three choices as to where Meitnerium lands on this big, blue marble of ours. land either in the midwestern town of Roswell New Mexico or . Here she will be discovered and taken in by an unsuspecting member of the locale... so yeah, have fun with that :P))

1111.content:
Down, down, the green girl’s ship fell, careening with a white hot speed and right for…

***


“But mooooommmmm!” One, Katrina Cardassian moaned. The only child of one of the wealthiest families on Earth then proceeded to kick the panda leather back seat of the family sports car. “I hate school! Please please, please! Just let me drop out!”

“You shut your little whore mouth!” scolded her mother making the effort to finally turn around and stare daggers into her daughters face. “You’ve mooched off the both of us for far too long, and you’re father and I-“

“Dadddyyyy! Tell mom she’s crazy.” Katrina unrelentingly moaned.

“Honey...” began the family patriarch.

“Don’t say a single word Gerald or you can say goodbye to even thinking about se-”

“Fine, if you don’t I’ll just have to tell everyone at school about all the money laundering you two do.” Said a self-satisfied Katrina, crossing her arms and construing her face into her patented full on pout, the look of shock on her mother’s face was proof that she’d finally put a dent into her mother’s frigid façade. “Yeah, I know. I’m not, like, stupid.”

“…You don’t have the balls.” Grunted Kristine Cardassian, fists clenched for emphasis before launching into a tirade of screeching matches with her daughter.

Gerald Cardassian sighed. He never asked for this. He wished he was off on a “business trip” with his other billionaire embezzler buddies, hunting some sort of rare breed of animal in the Serengeti to extinction, before finding some native women and…
Suddenly there was an awfully bright ball of light in his eyes, he reached for his $300 pair of custom sunglasses but wait…The sun was behind them and if that was the case then…then…Whatever it was…it was hurtling towards them at an alarmingly fast rate, in fact it would…

“Oh thank god.” Gerald said, the last words uttered by anyone in the Cardassian bloodline.

***


Meitty gave a few heavy coughs after the explosive impact. Her airbags had inflated correctly, but other than that it looks like most of her father’s SUV she was driving was totaled. Meitty was glad she’d survived the crash, but knew she was as good as dead as soon as her father saw what she’d done. She grimaced as she dusted a bit of soot off of her tattered clothes and stepped onto Earth taking a few moments to adjust herself to her surroundings.

She looked about her…Trees as far as her eyes could see, and even worse no antenna attuned technology as far as her own feelers could detect…Other than her one big BOOM when she landed here, the wreckage of her car was instant, smokeless, and…whatever it had hit had been vaporized to dust instantly some sort of metallic thing, or whatever. She wondered what dreary planet she’d unfortunately found herself on here in the boonies of the 'Milky Way'. She hoped it wasn’t Moltor, with its infinite volcanoes, sure it had natural hot-springs but right now her hair and complexion would not be able to deal with that kind of humidity right now. Hopefully it was Dokar, or at least nearby, she’d never been, but given the tall green hunks she’d seen transfer in from the planet…being stranded for a few days alone wouldn’t be so bad…

She begrudgingly took a few steps up and over a nearby hillside, finding the gravity and air here not entirely unpleasant. Whence she crested the hillside she saw a small city’s worth of buildings in a variety of sizes, from a distance she could even glimpse the outlines of some sort of lifeforms…. Wait a minute the way these buildings were laid out, oh no…no, no, no, no, NO! Ugh, this would be so Meitty’s luck right now, that in all infinitesimal planets in the whole fricken’ faithin’ universe she’d transferred from her own academy and crashed right outside another in one single trip.

Well, at least it would be over soon. Sure, she’d have to dial up Daddy, and then there would be shouting, and he’d have the “I told you so” tone in his voice, but at least she’d be off this rundown rock quickly.

Just make her way down the hill and…
1111.title: Interstellar Transfer Student

choices: Alice Carylye A thin freshman girl who’s as uneasy about this academy as Meitty.
Hannah Hammond A Senior beauty who seems friendly..very friendly..too friendly..
Someone else? Perhaps a student more sizable in stature? Or maybe it's empty?
11111.content:
That was weird…”Buttercombe Academy….” Read several signs outside in a text that was like a slightly stylized version of her home planet’s language. Maybe this was a far distant Metalean colony planet left to be mostly forgotten out here in the middle of nowhere?

Pleased with this information, but still unsure exactly where to go Meitty took in her surroundings now that she was outside one of the major buildings. The life forms here were also startling similar to Meitty’s own Metalean race in appearance but yet they were all so…so…different! Not a single green complexion to be seen here, but pink skin, and brown and more, all paired with such different hair styles colors and makeup, though with a majority wrapped in bright garish yellow uniforms. Meitty felt a tiny twinge to maybe transfer and take her cosmetology degree studying here, if maybe after some further investigating…Wait a second…were all of them female?…No males in sight! Ugh! Could this day get any worse?

Meitty, so caught up in her examination of Earth’s existence ran in to a thick padded wall, or at least it felt like padding, it was actually a person! Standing before her, about a head taller than her, was a dark haired, woman, whose round face complete with thick rimmed rectangular glasses bore the look, not of anger, but one of concern. Said head, sat atop a frame that made her a near twin to her (now ex-) teacher Mrs. Henderson. At least this one had the decency to dress somewhat adequately, though it’s yellow uniform still clung to her side rolls and did little to mask her hulking breasts that pushed perkily upwards against the fabric.

“Oof…Oh, hello there…. Everything okay? Are you lost?” asked the life-form in front of her. Meitty was taken aback for a second time not just in the large size the creatures seemed to come in but that this planet’s language was so remarkably similar to her own, I mean the text was one thing but this was downright fascinating!

“Uhh…Just a little confused is all…” said Meitty after finally remembering it was her turn to speak.

“Newbie huh? Not a problem” said the fat fem in front of her giving her an assuring (but unwanted) pat on the back. “My name’s Ronnie, I’m a head assistant here at Buttercombe Academy. I’d be happy to show you around. Let me just check this clipboard here for where you’re headed…What’s your name?”

“Meitnerium Perioda.” Said Meitty, sensing a glimmer of hope in that this whole ordeal was going to be over with soon.

“O..kay…I’m going to just call you Meitty is that okay? Well, now let’s see…M….M…M…” the large girl looked at the clipboard she was carrying furiously fat fingering through papers.

“Actually I'm not a studen-...Look, can I just make a call real quick?” asked Meitty wondering why she was going to have to go through this whole process.

“What?”

“Can I just, like, phone home… or whatever?” asked with an arch of her eyebrow.

“Well…” trailed off for a bit usually not one to let ANYONE hold her phone, but after noting the ruff looking state this poor girl was in, her matronly instincts won out. “Sure…here.”

Meitty tried her dad’s number same as always; 269-8745-553-554-226-4447-777-889. No answer. She tried her mother’s…Still nothing! Her dad’s work, all of her friends! All met with a voice explaining that her call could not be completed as dialed. This stupid backwoods blue ball probably didn’t get coverage out here. Well, nothing left to do here but sit and wait for her dad to get the emergency crash signal her SUV sent out…that is if that didn’t get total toasted in the crash along with the rest of her vehicle.

“So Meitty…Eh, where were you from again?” Asked Ronnie as she took her phone back, all while trying (and failing) not to gawk at the incredibly long area code that accompanied each phone call.

“Metalement, duh. ” Said Meitty in a flat tone, as if her own white locks which currently covered her twin antennae, plus green skin weren’t enough to give it away, they were even speaking Metalement!

“Hmmm…” Ronnie sighed miserably; she assumed this was some remote city in Europe which didn’t much help in this situation. A bead of sweat formed on her brow as she could sense this was one of the VERY FEW times she was going to need help from someone higher up than her own R.A position, plus with more students checking in by the minute she was falling behind.

The best thing would be to make sure this Meitty girl stayed calm and felt at home here. “Well…I’m sure your parents have the Academy’s number, they’ll probably call to check on you as soon as they can. Just so you know I’ll put a notice into the attendance office right away… For now though, how about I put you in a temporary room with someone, till things get things officially sorted out? Is that okay?”

“I guess…” said Meitty with a roll of her eyes wanting nothing more than for this to be over as soon as possible.

“All right.” She gave a small nod before double checking her clip-board, then nodding once more before speaking again. “Well, I’ve got a spare room on my floor for now so just follow me!” Ronnie turned about and began slowly walking down a hallway, at the same time she dialed up a number on her phone. “Hi, so I’ve got a lost student here…yeah I tired but I think she’s from Europe...”

Meitty tuned out, walking the halls following the enormous life-form in front of her. This was so annoying…but on the other hand certainly already a million times better than her assigned school of Transvesttie. Maybe she could convince daddy to do some away studies out here…In fact if she made the right moves she might be able to…. Wait, there was something else peculiar about this school; Same Yellow uniforms? That sort of thing wasn’t out of the ordinary. In fact the Pastafarianism place down a ways from her old school did that. An all-female school? Again, not preferable, but not unheard off, as Meitty’s friend Vortia had almost been assigned to one given her constant breaking of curfew. No, the weird thing was that out of all the organisms here, Meitty seemed to be the only interplanetary attendee, not even a single feline from the Amenhotep Quadrant and those things were practically on every planet! No way…Was she…Was she on an undiscovered planet! If that were the case…maybe she’d better keep the fact that she was an alien here under wraps for a while…I mean they seemed pretty friendly so far, if a little weird, but who knew what could happen...Meitty casually brushed her hair making sure it now fully covered the two antennae on her head and tuned back into whatever this Ronnie person was saying.

“-And if you need a spare uniform there’s should be a set in either one each of the closets.” Said Ronnie sounding a bit out of breath from the speech she’d been giving and the walk. “Well, here’s your room. And like I said I’m going to make sure you get a hold of your parents one way or another. For now though just relax here want you to feel at home. Oh! It, looks like your room-mate has already checked in. Excellent! I just know you two are going to get along great!” said Ronnie, the last few lines coming off as a per-programmed routine.

“….Great….” muttered Meitty in a sarcastic echo of hollow excitement.

“I’ll be back soon to give you an update as soon as possible Meitty. Just stay calm. Everything’s going to be fine.” Ronnie said talking down to the foreign girl as if she was a five year old, and with that Ronnie turned about, and headed off.

Well if this was where she was going to be crashing (metaphorically and literally) for the next few hours might as well get it over with. Whomever her roommate was Meitty was sure of two things; she’d have to find out a lot more about this planet she now found herself on AND be extremely careful NOT to reveal that she wasn’t exactly from around here.

“Oh, are you my new roommate?” asked the voice from behind the door it belonged to a student named...
11111.title: R.A Ronnie Arranges A Room For Misplaced Meitty

choices: Eventually Meitty gets this whole "bathing" thing down. It's relaxing!
Hannah busts in and sees her antennae. Oh Faith, her cover's blown!
"Umm... Hannah? Do you think you could come in here...?"
111112.content:
"Oh, are you my new roommate?"

Now this, this was the type of life form that Meitnerium was used to seeing. No more of the dumpy, huge ones lumbering around the backwater campus that she'd marooned herself on. This girl had flair! She was a little shorter than Meitty, but not by much, with long brown hair and pretty blue eyes. With her tight waist and her full assets, she looked like the kind of girl that Meitnerium was used to hanging out with. Maybe being stuck on this gawdawful mud ball wouldn't be so bad?

Poor thing didn't have any antennae though. Some people were into that, she supposed...

"Uh... yeah?" Meitnerium answered in half, "I mean, for the time being anyway."

"Right? At least until they tell you you're in the wrong room" the life form behind the door laughed, "C'mon in."

The girl retreated further into the dorm, leaving the doorway wide open. Shrugging her shoulders, Meitnerium followed suit.

Her temporary domocile couldn't have been temporary enough. If the rest of the campus hadn't been any indication, the decor of where they expected her to stay was decidedly lacking. Everything was... grounded. Like on legs. Nothing was hovering, which meant that if she wanted to ever rearrange this sty, she'd have to (ugh!) drag everything on the floor. There was this sad little screen and two hard looking couches. To her right, there was this big white box and containers against the wall. What the hell even were those things? What could possibly go in them?

But she tried, at least she thought she was trying, to be polite. These primitive folks hadn't given her any reason to call Protectorate of Sentient Species yet (not that she could without any bars). The fact that they had houses and rooms and big buildings where they all sat inside with moderately functioning air conditioning was a silver lining in itself, she guessed. Whenever she pictured Primitives, Meitnerium always thought of, like... cave people. Unga bunga. That noise.

"So I'm Hannah." the primitive said with a smile as the door clicked behind them, "And, uh, if you don't mind me saying so... you're looking kinda rough. What exactly happened?"

Friggin' Faith, what was the right answer? As in, the answer that didn't make her seem like she was an alien. If she was going to do this, she might as well do it right!

"Oh, uh... just a little... crash?" Meitnerium guessed, "Yeah, there was some... uh... vehicular impact up the road. I had to walk up here."

"Like... a car crash?" Hannah repeated, furrowing her brows at what was, apparently, a less than sterling example of primitive speak

"Yes. Car crash. Totally." the green girl leapt onto that, "Like, I just barely got here."

"Damn girl, that's rough." Hannah frowned, "But hey, props to you for your motivation. You walk off a car crash to come to prep school? I don't think anyone else in this academy would have done that. Was there anyone with you? Are they okay?"

"Oh, no, I was by myself." Meitnerium dismissed, "I was just driving along when I got pulled in by orbit. Like, I tried pulling up, y'know, but it just didn't work. I mean, when outside of holos does that work, amiright?"

Judging by the blank stare on Hannah's face, Meitnerium wasn't doing as good a job at blending in as she originally intended. Thankfully the primitive laughed, taking what she'd said as some kind of joke. She just smiled and nodded, relieving the suddenly very conscious Meitnerium.

Ugh, why was it so hard to bring herself down to these primitives' level?!

"Riiiight..." Hannah said with a strained smile, "Well, the bathroom's right over there if you want to go freshen up a little. I mean, you know, you're gonna have to change into your uniform anyway right? Plus the whole... car crash victim you've got going on there.... uh..."

"Meitnerium." Friggin' Faith. Did that sound Primitive enough? Did she really need to worry about sounding primitive when her skin was green? "Meitnerium Perioda."

"Ooookay, um... Meitty..." Hannah seemed to have trouble pronouncing her name (it's a very common name!) "Well, uh, I think we're about the same size. If you want, you can go take a bath. Put on my spare uniform. Get out of those..."

Meitnerium looked down, fully realizing just how much of her glorious green bod was on display.

"Well, I'd call them clothes but..." Hannah laughed a little, "They're more like rags now."

***


With a flick of this sad little physical switch in the wall, the so-called bathroom was alight. Everything was a soft yellow and white; also this room was way bigger than it should have been.

The toilet, Meitnerium recognized. That's where you, uh... did your business.

But the size of that sanitation station! It was huge! It took up, like, half the room! On Metalement (and most civilized parts of the universe!) all it was was like this little faucet built into the wall! You'd stand under it, input your demand, and poof! You were clean!

But here there was this curtain and this weird basin. And like, a hole in the floor. Why would these primitives need a curtain? There was already a door.

Faith. Guess that's why they were called primitives. Always reinventing the wheel instead of proper sanitation stations.

So Meitnerium stripped down, exposing her lithe green form fully to the otherwise empty room. Woof, she did look rough. The mirror in the bathroom showed her just how bruised and beaten she'd gotten in that wreck. Her clothes were tattered, yeah, but she didn't realize just how dirty she'd gotten. Her muscles were sore and achey.

All the more reason to get in a nice, relaxing sanitation.

"Clean, please." Meitnerium commanded, standing underneath the showerhead.

...

This was going to be a long day, wasn't it?
111112.title: Hannah Hammond, Prim and Preppy Primitive

choices: Hannah plops down beside her, "Hey, wanna order some grub? You gotta be hungry."
Meitty sees this cute little basket, "Oh, that's my welcome basket! Wanna try?"
There's a knock at the door, "Hey, it's Ronnie! Open up!"
1111123.content:
As much as she hated to admit it, Meitnerium wasn't exactly the brightest girl. She did cosmotology, not anthropology. So Faith forbid that she not be able to decipher the greater intricacies of this primitive planet's bathing system. She stood there for about two minutes before finally breaking down and calling for help. She may have just met the girl, but if she didn't want to spent her (hopefully brief) time on this mud ball stinking up the joint, she was going to have to get some help...

"Umm... Hannah?!" she hollered, her cheeks a dark green with embarassment, "Do you think you could come in here?!"

Not long after, the doorknob rattled and turned as Hannah entered the underdeveloped bathroom.

"Sure thing, Meitty, what's--?"

And when she came to see the figure standing in front of her, completely naked and standing in the bathroom in a probably unintentionally provocative pose, Hannah's ivory cheeks burned bright red! She instantly recoiled and retreated behind the door. Honestly, the people on this planet. They were so concerned with privacy! Curtains on their sanitation stations, now freaking out when a houseguest (roommate? Blech.) was naked? For a bunch of primitives, Meitnerium couldn't help but think that they were awfully prudish!

"The thing." Meitnerium pointed at the station, "How do you... how do you work the thing?"

Hannah crept back in slowly, peeking out from behind the door ever so quietly as she was beckoned to come inside. She was still beet red and obviously flustered by Meitnerium's lack of clothing.

"Um... you're..."

"I know! But I can't... Ugh!" Meitnerium gave a petulant stamp of her foot, which sent her perky green breasts bouncing, "How do you work this thing?!"

It was super embarassing to say that she couldn't figure out this ridiculously simple tech. But no one in her family had seen knobs on thei sanitation stations since... since... Faith, museums. It wasn't her fault that society had left her ill-equipped to deal with life on other planets! It was just... It was just how things were done, okay?!

But, perhaps seeing that Meitnerium was somehow out of her element, Hannah's guard lowered even further.

"Oh wow... you must have hit your head or something..." Hannah said, still clearly flustered with Meitnerium's nudity, "I mean, okay! If you need help, I'll be more than happy to show you how its done..."

***


"Ahh~"

Meitnerium sunk down into the water. This was so... relaxing! The water was warm and it felt so good against her bumps and bruises. The bubbles that had sprung from Hannah's strange mixture she'd squirted into the water before her; delightful! They smelled so good! And all the stuff that Hannah had shown her--all different variations of "soap" that went different places. Although it wasn't tasty, Meitnerium sure could have cared less. While it didn't match all the different ways that a truly modern sanitation station could have made her smell, she certainly wasn't complaining about smelling like Lavender.

Whatever the Faith a lavender was.

"That's right, girl. You just sink your pretty, uh, blonde (?) head into those suds." Hannah said with a smile as she ran a washcloth up Meitnerium's arm, "Let Hannah take care of it."

This girl. This girl though. This primitive girl was everything that Meitnerium had ever needed in her entire life and more. Maybe when her daddy picked her up, she could talk Hannah into coming with her and just... doing nice shit for her like this all the time. Friggin' Faith this was amazing...

"So, Meitty, I gotta ask..." Hannah asked, "The uh... what's with the green?"

Meitnerium blinked dumbly.

"You know. The uh..." Hannah winced, hoping she hadn't offended her, "The fact that you're green."

"Oh!" Meitty was truly torn from her lofty, bubbly sanctuary for the first time since she'd really melted, "Uh... skin condition?"

"Okay, yeah, I don't think that's a thing, but okay." Hannah said cheerfully, "And, uh... the... things? The things on your head? Your doingies?"

Meitnerium's hands shot up to cover her antennae--when had those popped out?! She had hidden them safely underneath a headband for a reason! The last thing she needed was... oh, who cared. This felt amazing.

"I'm an alien." Meitnerium said with a facetious tone, "Don't tell anybody."

Hannah raised an eyebrow curiously, unable to hide a wry smile developing between her cheeks.

"Shhh..." Meitnerium purred as she sunk into the tub.

"Oh whatever Meitty." Hannah rolled her eyes, "C'mere so I can do your hair."

Meitnerium complied, warm water sloshing all around her as she shifted her position in the basin of the station. Hannah poured shampoo on her long white locks and started kneading it into her scalp. Meitnerium practically puddled right there as she felt Hannah's long fingernails scritch and scratch against her skin. Then she started tickling the shaft of her antennae...

"Ahh~" she sounded again, her chest heavy, "Stop it, Hannah, those are sensitive..."

"You're really commited to this alien thing, aren't you?" Hannah raised her eyebrows again, "Well, I'll try not to be too rough, green-skinned space babe..."

Meitnerium bit her bottom lip as Hannah kneaded and massaged the top of her head. She hadn't been touched like that in... wow, weeks. Not since she and Gallium Brown broke up. It was so relaxing, so soothing so... not soothing. Hannah sure had magic fingers alright.

"Alright, now dunk." Hannah ordered

On command, Meitnerium took her first use of primitive vernacular into action. She lowered her head into the water, held her breath, and got all the soap out of her hair. When she rose, she was suds free--and sopping wet. Her skin was shiny with water as she panted.

"Good girl." Hannah said with a smile, "Now why don't we get you a robe? I think I saw one in the closet..."

***


"How do I look?"

Meitnerium did a cute little spin, the robe fluttering in the breeze she created.

Apparently she was a fair bit taller than what was expected of these other primitives. The robe was pretty short on her. It only came down to cover her glorious green glutes! Her long legs were completely on display.

"Great." Hannah said with a thumbs up "Here, wrap your hair in this towel so you can go sit down on the couch."

Ooh! Accessorizing! Now Meitnerium was starting to feel at home!

The green girl did as she was told and wrapped her white locks up in the fluffy cream towel that Hannah provided her before (struggling with) turning the doorknob and entering the next room of her somehow less horrible domicile. She plopped herself down on the couch, kicked her feet up on the coffeetable, and folded her arms behind her back.

Maybe this wouldn't be quite so bad!
1111123.title: Bathrooms - How do they work?

choices: Nope looks like there’s no one else! Well that makes things a little easier!
Actually there is! The 350lb Mel Carylye, was just busy filling her face.
Someone is inside but it’s still someone else…
