Jersey Coast on RTV!” (Meitnerium sees human life isn't far from her own)
111322111211211221.content:
Left alone for a second in front of the television Meitnerium was about to experience a joy Earthlings had that Meitnerium didn’t: Commercials! Commercials everywhere! She wished she could write down everything she was seeing in these commercial commercials for things called fast food, candy bars, something called doughnuts, whatever pop was, it was all too much to take in. Wow! Food was even the main thing for human television! She was visibly drooling from all she saw; going into a state of semi-culture shock!

“We had just a little bit of leftovers from like four different boxes of this stuff, so I mixed them all together.” Tom explained as he returned from the kitchen this time with a much bigger bowl, and a much bigger serving of cereal. “At least it won’t go to waste the way right?” He smiled as he revealed his cunning plan.

After Tom plopped onto the couch beside her, she awoke from her daze as he handed her the bowl. The thoughts of the television shows here on Earth flew from her mind as she saw the larger bowl of sweet cereal. She supposed there would be time for the food she'd just seen later; there was food here to be eaten!

“I have so many questions” Tom began finally ready to inquire Meitey about her home life. And Meitnerium would be happy to oblige him with answers, as long as she could keep eating. (This spoonful she noticed some of the pieces of cereal were actually frosted human letters. How weird, but how delicious!)

“Okay...Well first of all what is it like-” Tom was unable to finish the question as the TV roared, now back to it's scheduled programming.

They both listened closely as an announcers voice began booming from the surround sound speakers. “And now back to..."

“Can we go out shopping? You do have malls around here right?”  She begs.
1113221112112112212.content:
"Jersey Coast…here on RTV! Reality television!" Interrupted a female voice from the TV’s speakers. Tom decided maybe the questions could wait a little while longer….

The show seemed to shock Meitnerium even more than the commercials did. She stared in disbelieve that humans could looks so different from the small glimpse she’d had of them. Taller ones, shorter ones, some that were wearing the most beautiful dresses she’d ever seen in her life, even better than most that were on her home planet! And look at that one! He’d give Gallium a run for his money in the sex appeal department. All this was out there and she’d never even known. Humans were definitely not as low brow as she had once believed them to be; no they were a lot more like Meitnerium than she ever could of guessed. And here she was stuck in the lousy country side, in the middle of nowhere, with a family who were plainer then plain. Well maybe not Tom. He at least seemed to be more “with it” than the rest of the family, but he was far from her idea of sexy…okay maybe he was just a little cute…

Meitnerium of course had many questions about what she was seeing and so began to ask them aloud. Tom began to explain some teen human culture to her. Going on to explain popularity, high school, bossiness, cliques, prom, bullying, and spoiled princess. Meitnerium began chiming in about her own life and they both found their races eerily echoed one another in their similarities.

“...so afterwards even if her father buys her the car if it’s not the right color she throws a fit.” Tom said as he was beginning to finish up an hour later. He had forgone seeing her as an illegal alien of ill intent, now as far as he was concerned she was just another regular teen, albeit a green one from outer space.

"Frickin faith that sounds wonderful!" Meitnerium said enthralled at the idea of her bossing her parents around and making sure she got everything she wanted, at getting new dresses every other day and cars and being the envy of all get friends. Oh and of course food food food, day in day out. This fantasy was only a few steps down from how she was actually treated at home, but the teen on television at the moment seemed to be twice as spoiled as she ever had been! Lucky!

“What, are you kiddin’ me?” Tom asked. “Naw, those people are fun to watch at how ridiculous they are but I wouldn’t get near anyone like that in real life.” he affirmed.

Meitnerium sighed at the dream crushing statement, it seemed to be true. She may have been her parent’s little princess on her home world, but here on Earth it looked like there was no way she would get to be bossy. Or was there…she wondered. Tom probably wouldn’t put up with her demands like her dad did (usually), but that didn’t mean there wasn’t another way to get what she wanted around here…

Looking up from the now empty bowl, Meitnerium was about to say something to Tom…...
1113221112112112212.title: The Situation /  What Meity Wants

...the afformentioned local mall. Clothes, hot guys, plus the food court!
11132211121121122122.content:
“Can we go out shopping? You do have malls around here right?”

Tom eyed his mysterious house guest up and down as his brain processed this sudden request. He leaned back slightly as Meitnerium folded her hands together and showed off all of her pearly whites in a pleading smile. In all honesty, he was always one for the mall scene every now and then; and as Meitnerium had already proved that, strangely enough, she was a lot like American teenagers it stood to reason that she would want to hang out there as well. "Please oh please oh please?" she begged eagerly, nary taking a breath as she eagerly awaited his response. What was he supposed to say? "No way, you can't leave the house or you'll get taken away by the government"? That'd be a terrible thing to point out! But then again he was a little anxious as to how his local mall would react to an actual alien taking a little shopping trip inside Hollister.

But again, she was stranded here with only a finite number of outfits before she ran out. Those pink pajamas were cute, but Meitnerium probably didn't have much more than a few outfits saved up at best. Maybe it would actually be good for her to go out and get some clothes so she could better survey the Eath's area! And besides, all they were doing was laying around watching TV and eating cereal; it's not like they'd really be missing anything...

"Okay, I guess its no big deal." Tom answered nonchalantly as he pulled himself from the couch, "We'll pick you up a couple of outfits and then head straight home, you got it?"

But of course, Meitnerium's attention had been lost at 'okay'. Since being a very young Metalean girl, fashion had always been a driving force in Meitnerium's life. When she was nine, a young Meitnerium once demanded an entire wardrobe change as a birthday wish because the new spokesperson for the line was "ugly". At age thirteen, she had run up a 7000 dollar credit bill at the clothing stores around the city- all of which her father was left to pay for. Of course now that she had grown older and wiser, those splurges had slowly tamed themselves as more important things came into the picture. But like any girl in the cosmos, Meitty needed to look her best.

"Yes!!" Meitnerium nearly squealed as she sprang from the couch and locked Tom in a thankful embrace. "Oh thanks so much Tom!" she said quickly, releasing herself and barging directly back into her room. From behind the door Tom could hear a muffled declaration- the best of which he could make out was "Getting" and "Ready"....

In short, being rather well-versed in Woman Speak, Tom deduced that he was in fact going to be there a while.
***

"Really?" Tom said in disbelief as his companion for the day emerged in nothing more than a pair of Steez Tech. yoga pants, a t-shirt and sunglasses. "It took you that long just to look like you rolled out of bed?"

Meitnerium scoffed, "Oh please, you should see me when I really get out of bed, I look nowhere near like this."

Tom rolled his eyes and jingled his keys anxiously. Meitnerium joined him in the doorway, where he had been standing for just shy of twenty minutes, and smiled playfully as she stepped out before him. He locked the door behind him and escorted the spoiled alien student to her chariot for the evening: a 1996 Sedan. And a real rustbucket at that. Meitnerium could barely contain herself, "Nice car." she giggled, "Nice to see someone who doesn't overcompensate." Tom shrugged slightly as he hopped into the driver's seat. "Yeah well, can't complain." he hid his true distaste for the un-swaggin' of his wagon behind an unperturbed face and simply shoved his keys into his ignition, "Oh what, so if it doesn't go the speed of light it's automatically a junker?" he joked, "Most kids on Earth would be begging for a car like mine." Of course Meitnerium didn't believe it; she wouldn't send this car to an orphanage on her planet.

"Whatever, so long as it gets us to the mall, it works for me." the alien said, figuratively lowering her nose low enough for her to climb into the front seat, "I'm still gonna duck down really low though, just so no one sees me in Earth's most Awesome Car." she said tauntingly. "Oh ha ha, you're really funny- you know that?" Tom jeered back, "Just wear...." from the passenger seat floorboard, Tom managed to rummage through his crap to find a Texas Longhorns ballcap and hand it to Meitnerium, "this in case somebody sees you."

Meitnerium laughed, "No way, why do I have to wear the hat?!" she swiped the cap from Tom's hands and playfully placed it atop his curly black hair, "You wear the hat, it's yours and it smells!" Tom couldn't help but catch her infectiously jaunty behavior and pulled the cap from his head, pulling it down over Meitnerium's eyes, "This is my lucky hat! It doesn't smell!" he quipped back with a giddy grin, "And besides, you're the green one here- plus you've got those antennae up there, you'll stick out like a sore thumb!"

"And a ballcap will fix that?" she said dryly, adjusting the sporty ensemble to better allow her vision. Checking her reflection in the passenger side mirror with a quick little pose, Meitty decided that she didn't look half bad! Like a little bit of a slob or an underachiever maybe; but hey, when on Earth! "Fine, but I'm only keeping it because it looks way better on me than it did you."

"Whatever."

"So, where're we going, anyway?" Meitnerium continued after a quick jab to Tom's arm, "Some kind of hoedown Earth mall where I can tip cows and hit on my cousin for fun?"

Tom finally started up his car and turned to pull out of his driveway, not even looking at Meitnerium while answering her question. "Wow, you're really off about the whole 'Earth' thing... well, mostly." he said after going a good distance in reverse, "We're headed somewhere that'll make even you look normal...
11132211121121122122.title: What a(n Alien) Girl Wants

choices: The mall’s food court. (He’d rather have her binge on food then clothes.)
A group of his friends, including Jerri (Who could also be at the food court)
111322111211211221222.content:
“I’m taking you to the mall.” Tom announced. “I’m sure you can get a better idea of what “real” Earthlings are like there.” Tom knew it would be risky taking her to the bigger, more crowded mall but he was pretty sure there were would be much more to see there than at the other smaller one. Tom had felt somewhat insulted by the hick remarks Meitnerium had made, not just as a Texan, but as an Earthling too. Well he’d show her…

“Now you promise to keep the whole “alien” thing a secret right?” He asked her, still a little giddy about what he was about to do. He was pretty confident the disguised alien beside him could blend in, heck, considering how some people looked at the mall it wouldn't be hard at all!

“Yes, yes, I understand,” Meitnerium answered with growing impatience. “Can’t be captured and all that…Honestly humans are like; one of the last races to have discovered aliens but if it means they won’t freak out I’ll try to stay hidden.” she bemoaned crossing her arms and pouting.

Soon enough they had entered the mall and as they passed through the gray automatic doors Meitnerium stopped on the spot. She brought her hands together and nearly squealed with delight. This… this was more like it; this was what she’d wanted! Her mind tried to take it all in as her heart fluttered in delight at the new min-world around her. Neon signs, racy outfits, cute boys, the whole place was just so alive! It was just like back home!

“Tain’t so Podunk any more ain’t we miss?” Tom said with an exaggerated twang and an air of pride about him. Meitnerium barely heard him; she’d picked a store to start with and dashed off towards it ready to go where few men have gone before: the women’s clothing department. Tom had to briskly walk to keep up with her, cautiously watching the cap Meitnerium was wearing as it began to bounce and bobble atop her head.

Finally they’d arrive at the first store, and Meitnerium hit the racks as if she were a regular. Tom saw as she began sliding through the clothes at a fervent pace as if in pursuit of something. Finally she paused and lifted her treasure into the air with delight; in her hands she now held a slinky black outfit. As he passed the other women present in the store Tom watched as Meitty pressed the dress to her figure judging it to fit perfectly. Then she returned it to the rack and went one size smaller (well knowing the tighter fit drove the guys wild.) She retreated to the back which she’d correctly assumed to be the dressing room and went to work, leaving Tom to wait for her outside red faced from more than just the short sprint.

Killing time, Tom checked the area searching for camera’s and surprisingly unlike in the long list of movies he’d seen there were no camera’s about, no CIA agent’s looking for him, and no one had paid Meitnerium any mind. So far so good, he supposed…The thoughts of was quickly dropped from his mind as quickly as his jaw did when he witnessed Meitnerium exit the dressing room.

Alone in the dressing room Tom saw that the black outfit had not just clung to Meitty’s form, it squeezed it tightly as if it’s life depended on it. Leaving little to the imagination but a lot to think about it abruptly ended to make way for Meitnerium's now slightly rounded stomach. Although she wouldn’t admit it, she had a hard time squeezing herself into the outfit, chalking it up to one of the few differences between the human culture and her own.

“Black goes so well with green, don’t you think so?” She asked seeing she was getting the desired effect from her test subject. Meitty decided to go in for the kill; she might have been a bit of an idiot when it came to school but if there was one thing she knew had to do it was shop, especially if someone else was footing the bill.

“Yeah, black and green are sort of evil looking but I think they look good on me, I should know, I did have a shirt almost exactly like this one… that was before the crash...” she trailed off on a sad note and added a sniff for effect. “So can I get it?” She asked immediately perking up

“W…what?” Tom mumbled shaking his head to re-focus. “Oh, sure, uh, how much?” he asked in the voice of a boy who’d obviously never been clothes shopping with a woman.

Meitnerium told him how much.

“Well…” he began now immediately having second thoughts about the stupid mall trip. But seeing how happy she was, and seeing this was probably a once in a life time thing to be buying clothes for an alien, he realized he could cough up the money. Most of the money in his account had been from his parent’s as an allowance, (a generous allowance at that) but maybe he could talk into his dad giving him a reimbursement for giving Meitty a good time… (The dress didn’t look to bad on her either he had to admit, can’t forget that.)

“Fine,” he finally said. “But this and two other things at the mall, and then we’re out of here. Got it?”

“Oh thank you, thank you!” Meitty said in a way that had been not only practiced but perfected from its repeated use on her parents.
But as the shopping continued three turned into four, and then five! Tom found himself unable to give an unsympathetic “No!” to Meitnerium’s ; “Please”’s or her “But it’s on sale”’s and her “Aww but its sooooo cute”’s.

Defeated, he trudged behind Meitnerium feet aching from standing while carrying all of her purchases in tow.

“Hey!” cried a passerby suddenly approaching Meitnerium from the other side of the walkway. Meiternium tried to ignore him but he continued closer. “Hey you!” he cried again louder and this time Tom and Meitnerium both stopped dead .Had her disguise had been seen through? Oh no, what would this guy do next, call the police?

Frozen and slightly behind Meitty, Tom could only watch in horror as the buff young man made his way towards Meitnerium. Suddenly the stranger raised two fingers abruptly and placed his hand to his forehead. It was a perfect mirror of Meitty’s antenna and she panicked at the gesture. Her antenna! Had she forgot to re-cover them, had she been seen? She moved her hands instinctively to cover them and found that thankfully she’d kept the hat on!

As the guy dressed from head to toe in burnt orange stomped closer, his mouth opened and his eyes narrowed on the cattle shape on top of Meitty’s head. Then he gave a great smile as he loudly shouted “All right Hook’em Horns!” at the sight of her hat, yelling with true college frat boy bravado. As soon as he appeared he’d disappeared back into a crowd of people, his job of raising school spirit complete.

Tom breathed a sigh of relief. That had been too close, and after that little scare he really needed a break. Fortunately he saw something ahead of them that might serve as a good distraction from the beating that both his wallet and feet were taking, it would be a risk but it was worth a shot to end this interstellar shopping spree.

It was…
111322111211211221222.title: Stop to shop and then stop some more

choices: Meitnerium drives Tom broke. She eats, eats, and EATS before they finally leave!
During the meal, Meitnerium's cap falls off onto Jerri's plate! Cover up time!
1113221112112112212222.content:
Ahead of them, a familiar face had caught Tom's attention as he trudged forward; having been burdened with carrying all of Meitnerium's bounty like some sort of pack mule. At first Tom simply planned on distracting Meitnerium long enough with the food court in order to catch a breather and maybe get a bite to eat, replenishing his diminished reservoir of energy in the process. But what he had discovered in the stead of his journey towards the food court proved to be much more entertaining than sitting down with his verdant skinned oppressor for the evening. For there, in the middlemost section of the tables laid out for people to chow down and right next to the pillar, was his good friend Jerri and two other girls, one of whom was a mutual acquaintance for the both of them. Meitnerium, who wouldn't have known to single this face out of the crowd on her own, was still happily keeping up her step ahead of Tom and eagerly eying the strange customs of Earth's social hangout center. One thing she half-recognized was the smell of cooking food; and that alone was enough to cross the right wires in her pretty little head. One thing she failed to recognize, however, was the smell of a foreign substance: oils, fats, grease, these things didn't seem to register with Meitnerium's deprived sense of smell and taste. All she knew was that there was something different being cooked out there, seemingly from all around her...

"Hey, lookit that!" a rather low pitched though unmistakably feminine tone sounded from the clamor of the mall crowd, "Tom, get'cher scrawny butt over here!"

Meitnerium looked over to see Tom, her Tom, follow the greeting willingly -even gladly- to the source; a short, rather skinny girl dressed modestly; almost like a boy! "Hey, Jer!" Tom greeted her warmly as he lugged the twin bags of swag beside him, resting them at his feet in order to give this pint-sized human loudspeaker a great big hug. "Oh man last night was great!" the curly headed Texan said with emphatic joy, "That movie was sick!" A little bewildered, Meitnerium quickly hopped over beside Tom in hopes of gaining a little insight towards his sudden departure. "Yeah, but the best part was at the gas station afterwords- those big trucker guys picking on you was the best!" Jerri giggled as she elbowed Tom in the side. "Hey, watch it now." Tom vaguely ventured, completely forgetting about the green skinned temptress standing beside him. "I'll be watching you hit the floor!" Jerri teased, flailing her arms around playfully, "that Automotive Tech's really buffed me up, Son!"

The two burst into laughter, unable to keep up this charade of false bravado any longer. It wasn't until after a full minute of laughter that Jerri (or Tom for that matter) acknowledged Meitnerium's presence in the slightest. The two girls still seated at the table, however, had long since noticed the green girl in yoga pants and a ball cap and had started questioning amongst themselves. Jerri was just a little bit above that. "Sorry, me and Tommy here go back." she apologized, taking the dainty green hand of an ignored bystander in this seemingly A-B conversation. "I'm Jerrianne Short; you can call me Jerri." she said welcomingly, "And, um, if you don't mind me asking... I mean, are you wearing something or what?" Meitnerium immediately understood the question; though she still seemed somewhat annoyed at the diminutive girl for so eagerly diverting Tom's time away from her own needs. "I'm Meitnerium Perioda; but everyone just calls me Meitty here." she feigned pleasantries, "And, uh... it's a skin condition; kinda embarrassing."

And that was that, the whole story was answered. Jerri just shook her head sympathetically, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to be rude." she said humbly, "But you're really pretty." Meitnerium couldn't help but like this girl just a little bit more now... even if it was just a little. "Thanks, you're really pretty too." she reciprocated the compliment, albeit halfheartedly, as she turned back to Tom. "Hey, you think we should get out of here or what?" she asked quietly enough for only Tom to comprehend, though loud enough to make it seem like it was about her "skin condition" being pointed out, "I really wanna try on some of these new outfits." Tom, who now had a reason to stay anchored to the Food Court, if only for a little while, turned back and whispered just as quietly, "Aw come on, just take a seat- I'll get you a burger and you get to meet Jerri." he murmered, "She's really cool, you'll see." Without much of a choice (Tom was driving after all) Meitnerium took a seat and pulled out an empty one for Tom to sit beside her. Jerri sat across from Tom, and the other two girls sat next to Jerri; the only character out of them important enough to be named. The next five minutes was a string of non-stop talking between the two old chums- who reminisced like they hadn't seen each other in years; it was understandable for Meitnerium and the other two girls to feel just a little bit left out.

With nothing better to do, Meitnerium simply sat there; bored out of her mind and cheek poutingly placed in hand. Her eyes traversed the now seemingly dull mall, watching the patrons meander about their tables aimlessly. She caught sight, however, of something completely foreign to her. The process was interesting; one heavyset mother of two with her younglings clamoring at her side placed an order, holding up two fingers to signify the number. From there, the teen behind the counter tapped the touchscreen -wait, Earthlings hadn't quite come that far yet, what was that word... keypad!- and grabbed a bag that had been delivered by the never-resting chefs in the back! Just like that! The mother handed her the currency and hobbled off with her meal! Meitnerium's eyes widened with wonder, her cheek raising from her hand, as the woman (now seated. Yes, Meitnerium was creeping on a housewife in the mall, give her a break) pulled out a full meal not only for herself, but one for each of her children as well! It was instant food! Food in it's Fastest sense!

"Meitty?" Tom nudged her in the green elbow, "You alright?"

"Oh... uh..." Meitnerium could only muster this weak response as she basked in the glory that was good ol' American Fast Food. "I'm actually a little... hungry, think we could all.... um... get something to eat?"

The two unnamed girls declined, actually having to get going rather soon. Tom was actually a little peckish after lugging around all of Meitnerium's crap all day, and Jerri had actually skipped breakfast; so a little something to eat wasn't too out of the question...
1113221112112112212222.title: Tom and Jerri... And Meitnerium...

choices: Tom decided it was time to go, hoping to avoid making a scene.
Jerri wants to buy the rest of Meitty's luch just to see how much she can eat
11132211121121122122221.content:
“Yeah, I could eat.” Jerri announced to the rest of the table.

“Pass,” stated one of Jerri’s two friends getting up “We’ve got to be going anyways. You three have fun though…” she added a little dryly as the duo left.

“Okay, see you two later” called Jerri cheerily waving goodbye to the two.

“Well then, what do you want Meitty?” asked Tom who was also set to eat.

Meitnerium was still far too stunned at how fast the food was being made around her to answer.

“How about McDonald’s?” Jerri said, choosing for the faltering foreigner.

“Sounds good to me” Tom agreed, and the trio got up and made for the golden arches.

Jerri and Tom gave their regular orders, but for Meitty Tom had something special in mind. He had a feeling he’d have plenty of time to talk with Jerri as he ordered the #1 special which included A Big Mac, large fries, and a large chocolate shake, believing the sizable combo ought to tide Meitty over for a while. In a few moments they were carrying their respective trays to their table, Meitty astounded at how fast food could be cooked compared to her dinner’s from before and near drooling the entire time. She paused as she sat down at the table savoring the moment right before she un-wrapped this gift of swiftly prepared scrumptiousness before her. Not far from her Tom and Jerri were chatting it up.

“So…she’s foreign?” asked Jerri leaning in closer towards Tom who nodded to the question. “Well that explains the name then... but, well how long is she staying with you?” Jerri whispered to Tom between bites of the fires the two were sharing. She had tuned her voice down slightly as to not offend the vixen visitor. She wouldn’t have needed to whisper anyways, Meitty was lost in a new world of fast food heaven oblivious to the world around her.

“Um well, we don’t know for sure…” Tom began, searching for an apropos answer.

“What?” Jerri said a little louder than she'd meant to.

“Frick’n faith it’s wonderful!” Meitty interrupted biting down into her burger. Wow! So this was a hamburger such simple complexity, a stacked tower of strange and colorful ingredients each adding together to the total flavor like pieces of a puzzle, the meat burst with flavor obviously the star of the show, but the condiments added to it stacked right on the other were like perfectly synched backup dancers. Mietty couldn’t get enough of the other parts of the meal either, the thick paste that tasted of the hoho's only in a cold liquid form. The sensation of salty that came with the fries and the wholesomeness that came with them if they were dipped in the strange red sauce called ketchup. Unnnf!

"So, that movie last night was something else! Did you want to maybe...see..."Tom tried to use Meitty’s intruding interjection to steer the conversation away from the alien, to no avail.

“She sure can eat!” Jeri said having lost track of their conversation and had now shifted most of her attention to the foreign fast food feedee.

“Well yeah…” Tom began. (Think! Think!) “...She’s from pretty far out-out and away. I don’t think they have fast-food where she comes from but she really likes it here…And I was saying earlier she might have to go back to her home country pretty soon, or it might be a while longer.” He said trying to cover all of the holes in the story he was fabricating. “Could be even as soon as tomorrow depending on what her family wants… “

“Well shoot! You better be showing her a good time while she's here then!" Jerri said firmly.

“Oh yeah! Of course!” agreed Tom, who was not feeling any better for lying to Jerri whom he NEVER lied to. “Why do you think I brought her to the mall? She’s been having a great time. Isn’t that right?” He turned his head and found Meitty was licking the last bits and pieces of ketchup and hamburger from her fingertips. He assumed the shake was completely gone too.

“You-you’re done?” Tom fruitlessly asked unbelieving that in minutes a good old American burger, and a large fries, and a large shake had been quickly finished off, he’d missed it she inhaled it so quickly. “Well then Meitty how about some dessert before we go?” Tom asked forming a rater devious idea, briskly he left the table before Meitnerium could question what a dessert was. Whatever it was she hoped it tasted as good as a burger!

“I wish I could eat like that” Jerri had suddenly said to Meitnerium who now had to hold her own.

“Why don’t you then?” Meitnerium asked, honestly puzzled on why she seemed to be better at this eating thing than they were, and she’d just discovered this stuff a few days ago!

“Ugh, I would but I’ve got to stay in shape for practice” she grumbled. The phrase "in shape" had flown over Meitty’s head and not wanting to insult this local she’d simply chosen to ignore the phrase all together.

“Anyways, Meitty, how did you end up here?” Jerri asked brightly, while studying the rather “unique” outfit Meitty had on. One item she was wearing in particular, a certain someones lucky longhorns cap had struck her attention.

“Well after I left my planet-I mean my place, Harry saw me, uh, hitchhiking in the rain. And like, I told him I was looking for a place to stay. After that he took me in right then and there no questions asked.” She half lied, feeling fortunate she’d remembered that “here” meant “here as in Texas", not "here as in Earth or for that matter the Milky Way Galaxy."

“Really?” Jerri said relaxing as she began to understanding how Tom had been acquainted with this rather ravishing looking refugee. An escapee that Jerri noted was not only was taller than herself but also a bit more "womanly." “Well, Harry is a bit goofy isn’t he?" she continued still as bright as ever. "I think that’s why Tom tries to act so serious sometimes, is that he gets embarrassed by his dad. But really everyone in Tom’s family is really nice; you really couldn’t have picked a nicer guy-I mean place to stay with. I think you’ll just love it here.” Jerri said fully welcoming this new hopefully short term guest that her best (but-not-quite-boy) friend Tom was now sharing a roof with.

Tom returned from his short quest to the Dairy Queen carrying with him a sundae filled with ice cream. He had spent his last cent and bought Meitty the largest size scoops available, and even had it messily adorned with sprinkles and splattered with hot fudge.

“Now be sure to eat it slow” Tom warned, informing Meitty of the dreaded ice-cream headache that would happen if she ate this too fast. He felt this whole scene was pretty anti-dramatic compared to the cliché heartwarming “alien’s first taste of ice-cream” scenes that had abounded in so many flicks he’d seen, but the longer Meitty took to eat the less questions Jerri would ask about her, right?

Meitty took hold of the plastic spoon Tom had provided her and took a large scoop of the cold mystic wonder, making sure it was filled with hot fudge and sprinkles. She let the mixture rest inside her mouth and then sighed as she savored her first bite. Immediately Meitty was brought to near tears of joy from the heavenly delight. Such texture such sweet taste chocolate sprinkles, her pleasure sensors were running on overload!

Tom tried to resume chatting but began to notice Jerri was distracted by the semi-chartreuse stranger and her eating, well maybe gorging was a better word. Meitty had tried to hold her self back as Tom had warned, only to begin scrapping and scooping the frozen delight as fast as she could shovel it in Apparently not possessing the sensitive nerves in her mouth as humans did leaving her free to eat as fast as she wanted. Her licking and lapping of ice cream continued as chocolate and sprinkles swirled around the inside and visible outside of her mouth.

“I guess they don’t get ice-cream headaches where she’s from either” Tom said nervously laughing off how his plan had failed.

“You got that right!” Jerri shouted more amazed than put-off at this sign of gastronomical fortitude.

Soon she had finished off every bite of the ice-cream too, and Tom believed she was finally full. He was about to find out how wrong he was, for, whether from the food already inside of it, or at the very idea of more food, Meitty’s stomach gurgled loudly. Meitnerium looked more surprised than anyone else at the table by the strange chemical reaction taking place within her stomach, but the others didn't seem to worried about it so she wasn't either, in fact it kind of tickled as it gurgled she realized.

That's when at the sound of the rumbling...
11132211121121122122221.title: Food Court Feast pt.1

choices: Jerri wants to hang out some more (and keep an eye on Meitty)
Jerri would like to come but has other obligations…
111322111211211221222212.content:
Eyes bulging Tom grimaced as he gazed into the empty pit that was his wallet. Jerri saw his face begin to twist and picked up on the sign without missing a beat.

“Wow, are you still hungry?" said Jerri in reference to the rumbling that had come from Meitnerium's stomach. "You must have been starved back home. Tom, why don't you let me get her something else?” asked Jerri head and heart not 100% full of only good intentions for this friendly female foreigner. Thinking that If she filled Meitty till she was about to explode she wouldn’t have worry about Meitty and Tom getting any ideas.

"Oh, there are so many generous people here." Meitnerium said milking as much sympathy as she could. She was begging to feel almost spoiled from being showered with such snacks and kindness; keyword: Almost. Jerri had offered and now she was going to take full advantage of it Tom was sure he saw a devious grin flash not only on Meitty’s face but in her eyes.

“Well shoot, c’mon girl!”

"Thanks Jerri, but really you don't have to…" Tom began but the two were already up. He knew that this was just the kind of nice person his friend Jerri was, always smiling and always wanting to help. He watched as Jerri led Meitty to another restaurant and moments later they returned with a double beef stuffed burrito. Mietty masticated it in mere minutes. This spectacle was too good to be true for Jerri never imaging someone of Meitty’s semi-trim build could still be scarfing so much at such a pace.

“Okay, Jerri that’s enough don’t you think?” Tom asked hoping this binge would stop before attracting other onlookers.

“No way! I want to see just how much her tank can hold!" The perky fireball replied full fascination for the green guest. Meitnerium and Jeri got up several more times, each time returning to the table with a serving of what the next restaurant had to offer. Meitty continued to eat, and Jeri was completely blown away by how much Meitty could pack away.

*Glompf *she stuffed a cony dog crammed into her face. (It was thick and meaty like the chili) Washed down with a healthy sized order of lemonade. (Meity's face immediately puckered at the strange sensation of sour.)

*Gulp* she finished the last of the bowl of fried shrimp and rice. (The shrimp were spicy but the white granules were strangely tasteless.)

*Chomp dip chomp* The cheese slathered pretzel was finished. (Salty, but the hot and bubbly cheese dip seemed to balance it out)

*Smorsh* she swallowed down the last bite of a pizza. (Which much like the hamburger used a combination of spicy meats and sauces to come together for one ultimate taste. )

*Glorp* She chewing through the last third of a cinnabun.(It was the stickiest thing she had all day, but the warm gooey center and icing made up for the mess)

She ate and she ate, all while the tomboyish Jerri was basically cheering her gluttony on. Eventually the feast was finished not for want of funds, but on the Tom's realization that the two had been to every one of the twelve restaurants that comprised the substantially sized food court, and his instance that going for more anywhere else would make them look crazy.

"Thanks again though Jerri…really you didn’t have too…" Tom said forced to do the thanking for the food, and the apologizing for Meitty’s overwhelming appetite.

“What? That was amazing! You don’t think that’s impressive Tom? I would've bet she would've popped by now!” jabbing into visibility rounded and stretched taught tummy. “Careful l-oohf, ow,ow." Meitty breathed out. Her stomach sloshed it was so full but Meitty wasn't worried about the size and weight , she knew she just had to sleep it off and it'd be gone by the time she woke up. She was so happy, and she knew that Jerri would be her newest friend here on Earth.

“Not really” Tom lied flatly. In actuality he couldn’t help but feel strangely giddy as he watched Meitty’s cheeks bulging with food and her belly that was growing ever tauter. “But I’m sure she won’t forget how nice it was that you treated her to a little bit of everything while she was here. Isn’t that right Meitty?" Meitty only lazily nodded her head.

“Yeah well don't forget you’re paying for the movies next time!” Jerri insisted. (Though it had been slightly more than she’d planned on spending, it turned out it had been worth the price of admission for the astonishing display. She was sure now that the Tom (healthy teenager as he was) had lost any wayward ideas he would have had for this green colored bombshell that had seemingly fallen out of the sky. )

“You got it Jerri!... Oh wow look at the time! Three o'clock we should be getting home…” Tom said gazing at the clock that adorned one of the food court’s walls. Tom realized that after that generous gift leaving without at least inviting Jerri over would be rude, but he wasn’t sure if he’d be able to keep this flimsy “Random foreigner from parts unknown with a skin condition” story up if Jerri followed them home. No! It would be rude to eat and then run like that, he could only hope Jerri had other plans for that after noon.

“Say, Jerri, did you want to come with?” he asked gritting through his teeth and hiding his crossed fingers.
111322111211211221222212.title: Food Court Feast pt.2

choices: Meitnerium slowly adjusts and grows into her new life on Earth...
Alternatively, something noteworthy could still happen when they get home...
1113221112112112212222122.content:
Jerri's face visibly saddened, her endless reservoir of pep taking a break for refilling. "Sorry Tom, gotta meet my brother at work." she said dryly, "He wants me to check out this new car he bought, wants to see if we can soup it up together."

Tom tried not to seem too relieved; resisting the urge to let out a content sigh and let his crossed fingers relax. "Hey, no problem." he said nonchalantly, "We can hang out another time." The two stared at each other for a time, the silence awkward and in abundance. Tom's hand slowly found its way to the back of his curly black hair, scratching an itch that wasn't quite there while Jerri teetered between her tiptoes and heels. "So... are you sure Meitnurr... Meitty's gonna be alright?" Jerri stuttered, referring to the stupefied foreigner still seated at the table. "What? Oh yeah, she'll be fine." Tom reassured her, nudging Meitnerium awake from her cataclysmic stasis, "She's just a big eater, I'm sure she'll just skip dinner or something." he ventured vaguely, assisting his stuffed-stupid house guest to her feet.

Meitnerium struggled to remain standing after her latest feat of gastronomical display. Her knees were begging to buckle under her lack of control and conciousness combined with the increased baggage that was her still far from digested meal. As Tom helped the poor hapless extraterrestrial to her feet, all she could do was groan lightly at the intense pain emanating from her midsection; suffering only heightened by Tom's clumsy jostling of her body. "Ugh..." she whimpered as the spoils of her appetite's victory took their effect, letting out a long "Ohhhh..." as she felt a sharp, sudden affliction in her taut tummy. It was Jerri, rubbing the dome-like structure that jutted from her middle.

"I'll say." the little brunette said with mild wonder detectable in her voice, "This girl nearly ate this place clean! Where does she put it all?" Deciding to retract her hand from Meitty's gut, though not due to an acknowledgement of the verdant glutton's pain, and let it wrap around Tom's slender shape for a quick goodbye hug. "We're still on for the movies, right?" she ventured, "Next Saturday?" And while Tom was more than happy to oblige, his smile was more distracted than reassuring as he balanced the wobbling alien body and attempted to wrap things up and head home. "Yeah, sure." he said quickly as he hurried Meitnerium, who was now little more than dead weight, out the door. "Call me alright?"

***


Meitnerium had never been in so much pain in her entire life.

When she was four, Meitnerium slipped and fell off of her friend Selenium's roof. Now she could only yearn to relive that laser sealing her (then open) head shut. At nine she had gotten into a fight with another girl at the mall. Meitnerium begged to have that big butchy twelve year old pounding her face in right about now. And just last year she had broken her arm in a slight fender bender. This didn't even come close to the food baby can-canning inside of her poor overfed stomach right now. The burgers, the ice cream, whatever those things drenched in chili and "cheese" were; they all seemed like such horrible ideas in retrospect. Well... maybe not all of them, but certainly a good majority of them could have been enjoyed at a later date. And yet; the intense afflictions she was experiencing seemed somehow bearable.

Though overused and certainly exercised to its limit for today, Meitnerium's slender aquavian tongue had experienced more tastes today than in a lifetime back home. Everything on Earth was just so rich and full of flavor! Even when she came across something that she didn't like (which looking back seemed to be scarce), Meitnerium's repertoire of consumed foods had expanded her once sheltered sense of appetites! She doubted her friends, no, anyone back home had ever fully experienced the wild ride that was their sense of taste! Before crashing on Earth, her tongue was simply a muscle used to talk and wriggle inside of a Metalean guy's mouth; now it was an orifice that had found its true purpose after 21 long years of deprivation! That thought alone, though assisted with others that predicated just exactly what she might experience next, got her through the intense trauma that was her little slip in self control. That and the new outfits she had suckered from Tom...

Looking around, feeling a little more cognitive now, Meitnerium noticed that she was back in Tom's car; scenery swooshing out of her field of vision, safely buckled in, comfortably slouched into a slumbering position, and ball cap still firmly rooted onto her luscious white locks. She attempted to stretch, only to find that her meal still hadn't quite digested. She would not make that mistake again. The waving pain was already horrible, but moving so suddenly pushed it to the 'unbearable' point. "Ooh... ooh..." she whined, tentatively touching the swollen mass that resided inside her stomach with her slender fingers. That... actually didn't feel too bad. With the tips of her fingers Meitnerium gingerly circled the green distortion in hopes of easing its upstarts, letting out the slightest of pleasured moans in the process. Hope fulfilled; maybe this was worth the horrible pain of such severe eating. As she massaged the rock solid dome, she felt something inside churning; something strange that seemed to travel up her esophagus and...

"BRAAAAAP!!"

Tom nearly drove off the road at the sudden interruption; "Oh shit!" he cursed as he quickly regained control of the wheel, "Oh man that scared me!" he shouted, checking his rear view mirror for any signs of any onlooking cops. Meitnerium was just as equally shocked. "What the Faith was that?" Meitnerium shouted back. "It was a burp, Meitty." Tom said matter of factly, "You've never burped before?" the addressed burp-virgin could only notice the remarkable release in pressure on her stomach. Suddenly her valve was no longer ready to explode- there seemed to be a little more wiggle room in that taut tummy of hers! "No... but I do feel a little better." she said sheepishly, still a little dazed and sleepy. "Where're we going?"

"Home, where else?" Tom answered, "We're almost there, you've been sleeping for almost a half an hour." Meitnerium found herself traveling back to the stuffed tummy she had acquired, finding it a little less pleasurable to massage now that her figurative valve had been released. "Oh..." she said, "Sorry..."

"You should be, you sound like a chainsaw when you sleep." Tom teased, only to see the questioning look on Meitnerium's face that seemed to scream, 'I don't understand your silly underdeveloped Earth speak'. "Sorry, I mean you snore really bad." he quickly corrected himself. This garnered a much more desirable effect in Meitnerium, her face twisting into one of comical disbelief. "I do not snore!" she said in a raised voice, some energy finally coming back to her. "Yeah, you do." Tom said with utmost certainty. "You burp big too... I think my ears are ringing!"

"Whatever, just drive me home Earth boy!" Meitnerium said tauntingly, "I've got a date with a shower and a warm bed!"

"What, no dinner?" Tom quipped dryly as he pulled into the driveway...

Well in fact Meitnerium did have dinner that night; it had helped dull the pain when Mr. &Mrs. Parker announced that her car had been deemed totaled. Strangely Tom hadn't mentioned the mall splurging spree to his parents and was also oddly disappointed when Meitty didn’t have seconds for dinner. Finishing the meal quickly Meitty was feeling only slightly better, but then her feelings soared when she realized all hope was not lost, for as she searched her tub of tools she'd retrieved from the wreckage, she realized she'd packed away a distress beacon. Said beacon would send out a signal and broadcast it to the outer limits of the solar system; all she had to do now, all she could do now was hope for some alien passerby to notice it and come pick her up. Activating it she felt a little more at ease, at least she’d done something to aid her rescue and if she had to hunker down somewhere; Earth with its hot showers, ludicrously soft beds, fashionable malls and wide range of food, wasn’t exactly the worst place to wait a few days.

But a few days became a few Earth weeks, and then a month; soon she couldn’t exactly remember how long she’d been here Earthling or Metalean time wise. It could not have been much longer than two or three Earthling months she was sure. But what a time it was! Slowly she adjusted to her life and she continued to eat, and devour, and gobble further, all though never reaching her Jerri funded level binge (well maybe once or twice.)

Mr. And Mrs. Parker couldn’t have been happier with their insatiable interstellar new guest, over the past month(s?) or so they had bonded with Meitnerium quite well, taking her in as one of their own. They welcomed the girl's appetite, happy to see the once rail thin visitor was packing some healthy meat on her bones. Never once did they mention Meitnerium's rapidly ballooning size and weight, never even denying her second or thirds of both dinner and dessert. No, as they saw it there was always plenty to go around, and a lot less leftovers to deal with to boot.

Meitty herself marveled at what this food was doing to her. They sensational cycle of her days now consisted of; waking (then eating a nice breakfast to start her day), watching TV (with snacks of course), maybe going out with; Tom and Jerri (to the movies) or Harry (once to the grocery store to see where food came from, and once to a crude representation of how humans saw the galaxy called a planetarium,) or Louise (who had so kindly taken her clothes shopping again when Meitnerium had complained of Earth washing machines shrinking her clothes.) and then after that it was usually her favorite three step combo of a nice hot dinner, a nice hot shower, and a nice hot bed. Faith, she even seemed to be working once or two of the occasional burps things in there too! This everyday treatment seemed to be doing absolute wonders for her body! Meitty marveled at her reflection which seemed to be growing in all the right places. She ran a finger down one of her green and thicker thighs. They had obviously grown in the weeks that passed since her crash, not only that but her hips and breasts seemingly grew at an equal rate. And yet another part had grown as well her midsection, or as she'd heard the humans so often refer to it: her belly. That seemed the best word to described the thing that she was currently spilling out of her new pajamas. Even after walking out of a steamy shower with a towel wrapped around her curvaceous middle, it was hard to keep covered. So she now found she simply didn't, neither after shower or after dressing. This wide wobbly and doughy thing before her was simply there for all the world to see. As far as she was concerned she had blended in quite well with the Earthlings here, most of which still far surpassed her in size. She probed it with a finger loving the senastion as her fingers sank deep down into the mass. She thought about the past month (or was it months) of nonstop eating and gluttony, and knew if this was the results she'd gotten out of it, than this big belly of hers was definitely a good thing.

If fact she knew she’d be the absolute envy of all her friends when she revealed this brand new look when she got back home. All of her friends would be so jealous of her new developments (in the front and the back mind you), and judging from Tom’s dumbstruck reactions she’d seen him give her, the boys back home would be giving her a lot more attention too. And tummy rubs; she absolutely loved the way her stomach felt when , after she'd stuffed it full, he fingers gently rubbed it. She hoped she could get others to do that for her on her home planet since no one (not even Tom) would do that here. Oh, she could see it now; forget tanning on Willix and trying to get that right shade of green, everyone would be heading to Earth next summer vacation to grow theme selves large and wide just as Meitnerium did. Yes, she simply loved the fact that there was now more of her to love, and for now she was perfectly content to stay here and add to her girlish figure.

Strangely the only one who did care about her feminine form’s expansion was Tom. He’d tried to explain to her that such gains shouldn’t be possible, but Meitty wouldn’t hear it.

“So you saying I should just stop?” she asked him one night after dinner.

“No...It’s... just...” Tom started as he began to sweat. “It’s just-“

“Are you saying you don’t like this? That you don’t like me?” Oh yeah Meitty knew how to flip a conversation around, having a lot of practice with her previous flirts. It took a lot but she just managed to keep from laughing as Tom bashfully began squirming about and dancing around the obvious fact that he was really starting to like Meitty.

“No Meitty, it’s just… How much did you weigh before you got here?” he said, finally asking the rather rude question he’d been holding in.

“How much did… I weigh?” She began confused. In her time here Meitty thought she had gained most of the ins and outs of odd human behavior but this one had completely confounded her. “You weigh…each other here on Earth?” Now to Meitnerium there were certain things that were weighed spaceships for example, she’d even seen food on Earth being weighed on her trip to the grocery store which also made sense, but why would you need to weigh yourself? The reason for her conundrum was that modern Metalean's had never once grown to a size of “Overweight” or “Obese” like on Earth, not only that but their mastery of Zero-G gravity would have made such measurements irrelevant.

“Meitnerium, could you just come with me for a second” Tom said sternly, going so far as to use her full name to get her attention.

“Fine” she agreed stubbornly as she followed Tom into the bathroom. She watched as he went into the bathrooms closest (full of those nice and fluffy towels she loved) and bent down towards one of the lower shelves. He pulled out a strange device and set it down on the ground before her.

“Now, if you could just step on this scale for a few seconds...” He asked her pointing to the object.

Meitty decided she play this little game though couldn’t see why Tom seemed so…interested in finding out her weight. She did as asked and stepped on the contraption but she huffed and crossed her now thicker arms across her now bigger chest as she did so, just to show Tom she wasn’t happy about it. The gizmo seemed to whirl and clack beneath her, until Meitty heard the contraption click and finally stop. Not able to see the results from where she stood (there was only more of her wonderfully sexy self in the way) and definitely not feeling like bending over, Tom was left to read the results.

Meitty was already growing disinterested with this Earth boy's fascination of weighing somebody but she did manage to give just enough attention to hear a bit of the results as Tom read them aloud.

"Whoa!" Tom dragged the word out like silly putty, elongating the 'o' sound in shock, even going so far as to let out a little whistle afterwords.

"What's it say, what's it say?" Meitnerium griped as she grew just a hair bit defensive at Tom's utter amazement in how much mass she had gained. "I-I can't really tell Meitty." Tom poked at one of her pudgy green piglets on the scale, "Your toe's in the way, all I can see is a 2 and... I think that's a three?" Meitty rolled her eyes at the silly Earth boy, taking a half-step back from the plastic part and back onto the rubber mat. Honestly, these Earthlings with their silly contraptions; weighing themselves instead of things, how ridiculous! Back home, her father shipped out exactly 9.7 tons of BMW parts all over the surrounding bit of the universe (he'd said so many times) and had never once thought to put himself on that industrial scale of his? Why? Because it was a stupid idea; that's why!

...However, just because it was a stupid idea didn't mean that Meitnerium couldn't culture herself a little.

Tom looked down at the now foot-printed plastic, realizing that he had in fact been wrong; she weighed far much more than he would have guessed! The obligatory two as the starting digit was a bit of a shocker on its own, considering just how slender Meitty was when they rescued her. The last digit was not a three, rather it being an eight. So whatever that middle digit was, at the rate Meitnerium practiced her hedonistic habits, she wouldn't be there for long. And as she moved the plumpest of all big toes Tom had ever seen, Meitnerium's weight was finally revealed with the middle digit; 4. Four! Meitnerium was just a pound or two shy of weighing two hundred and fifty pounds! Had this space woman actually gained such an astonishing amount of weight in such a short amount of time since arriving on Earth? Whether that spoke more about the habits of his new boarder or his home planet, Tom really didn't want to consider.

He gazed upwards, hesitant on delivering news that would absolutely crush most women. Feeling premonition in the unveiling of his discovery to the awaiting audience, Tom's lips curled slightly; attempting to form a friendly smile that would comfort this verona vixen should things go sour. However as his eyes traveled upwards, Tom soon found that Meitnerium's doubly chinned cherubic countenance was nowhere to be seen within his vantage point; instead getting an eyeful out of her fully exposed stomach, left to sag over the waistline of her favorite pair of (now ill fitting) cutoffs. Its soft expanse rolled seamlessly over the belt line, making a smooth curve that dipped (at its apex) to the level of her crotch and back up to the other side to form a protruding muffin top, doubling back around once more again to form a second layer on the blubbery pagoda that was her belly. Her thick legs touched each other, rubbing their patterns of scantily clad denim against one another even as she stood still; her whole guacamole-shaded body rising and falling slightly with every breath. Tom's smile became flustered, finding himself suddenly with a lack of words as his cheeks grew rosy.

"Well?" Meitnerium huffed impatiently, "How much do I frickin' weigh?"

Tom's tongue soon became his bane as he struggled to get it working, only managing to stammer and stutter stupidly. His tied tongue only came unknotted when he heard something break the silence: a sound he had grown very used to in the past few months living with Meitnerium...

"Are you eating up there?" he asked in an elevated pitch, disbelief evident in his voice as he slowly rose from his crouched position on the tiled bathroom floor. Sure enough, Meitnerium had somehow managed to get her greedy green grabbers on a bag of Lay's Barbecue Potato Chips almost as if by magic. Meitnerium seemed unperturbed by the silly question. "Yeah, what's it look like I'm doing?" she asked nonchalantly, shoving a big bite of sliced salted potatoes in her mouth at once, "Why -crunch- you want some?" Tom could only shake his head and smile lightly, taking a single obligatory chip as he headed out the bathroom door. "What?!" Meitnerium hollered as she carefully stepped off of the scale, "You're not even gonna tell me how much I weigh?!"

"Nope!"

Meitty's softened jaw dropped in astonishment, "No way!" she hollered as she headed after him, "You're the one who wanted to know so much!" However, now that he had gotten her attention, Meitnerium would like to know and then evaluate that mysterious "personal" weight the scale foretold. "No time." Tom said in an exaggeratedly hurried fashion, "We've gotta go meet Jerri at the movies." Meitnerium let her hands fall down to her thighs in exasperation, making a loud slapping sound against the pillowy pillars of leg blubber. "We just ate dinner!" she shouted back at him. "So I treated you to an early dinner, I've got finals tomorrow and this is the opening night of Battle for New Mexico." Tom delegated as he grabbed his keys, "Plus I just wanna hang this over your head for as long as I can." he spat as he started out the door.

"You jerk!" Meitnerium shouted. Normally she would hurry after him and give him what's-what with a few playful smacks on the back of the head, but she knew he didn't like for her to be outside without some kind of headgear to hide those pretty little antennae of hers. She pawed around the nightstand placed in the entryway where Tom's keys had been laid; picking up a pair of stylish-enough sunglasses and bringing out her hair band. She pulled her snow white locks back, securing them and her dangling Metalean parts underneath the thick accessory and placing the pair of sunglasses atop her head as a further deterrent. Checking herself with a quick pose in a nearby mirror, Meitnerium deemed herself acceptable and quickly hurried out the door...

***


Ten minutes late. As usual; or rather it had started becoming the norm after Meitnerium became their third wheel. She always managed to slow that boy down, leaving Jerri standing out in the parking lot like a loon while the commercials were playing. She had dressed up for this, nothing too formal but still. It seemed that Tom's eye had been revolving around Meitnerium just a little too much for her taste, they never really got to talk much anymore with that green suction nozzle around. At school things were fine, that being when they actually got to see each other, what with conflicting class schedules and whatnot. However they always managed to save at least one day a week for each other, that either being Saturday or Sunday. Her own finals weren't too far away, maybe Jerri could sneak in some face time with Tom during the summer; foreigner free?

At last Jerri heard the familiar clunking sounds of Tom's automobile approaching; she'd offered millions of times to take a look at it for him, but he'd always refused. She waved excitedly, cupping her hands together over her mouth to let out the familiar beacon: "TOOOM!!". It was no shock that four other Toms in the parking lot looked up. As he and Meitnerium emerged from his crappy sedan, Jerri couldn't quite help but notice just quite how round Tom's green-skinned squatter had allowed herself to become in the past months. She struggled to rise from her seat, even as she did so the fully-exposed curvature of her belly simply wobbled up and down along with the rest of her over swollen form. Of course she had been present for a good bit of her gorging, but only seeing Meitnerium once or twice a week wasn't really enough to take in how much the once svelt and beautiful foreigner had expanded. In a way, it made her happy to see her this large; this fat. But that was a rather nasty feeling, wasn't it? It wasn't like she and Tom were dating... what right did she have to be jealous?

"About time!" Jerri hollered, still audible across the parking lot, "I got your freakin' tickets you bums!"

“Shhh” Tom brought a finger to his lips and continued the conversation in much quieter tone. “Look Jerri I’m sorry but-Oh, see still early” He said pointing out that the theaters lights were still on and that the projector was still showing those boring god-awful pre-show slides and commercials.

“Aww you just got lucky.” Jerri said as she skipped up a few steps and placed herself in the middle of three open seats in a row, thereby guaranteeing her a seat next to Tom. Tom and Mietty followed, but Tom waited just outside the row, and let Meitnerium go ahead of him.

“Now you got the tickets Jer, so the snacks are on me, what’s your pleasure?” He asked in a half whisper.

“Large Dew for me, and a large popcorn” Meitty said, now halfway to her seat. She then plopped her near two hundred and fifty pounds into the chair beside Jerri, squeaking into it both physically and audibly. Now left alone with the green glob in the seat beside her, Jerri was given a chance to take in the size and scope of the globular girl that sat to her left.

Wow! Jerri thought privately trying not to make her stares too obvious. Simply put Meitnerium had gotten rather large, and from the sound of the order she’d given Tom, her growing wasn’t going to stop anytime soon. For what Jerri could tell though Meitnerium didn’t seem to mind, in fact she was wearing smile that was just as wide as the rest of her. Jerri recalled the mall episode, thinking that had been sort of a onetime thing for Meitty, with Jerri along just to see how much the lean and green girl could binge on. Obviously she’d taken to fast food rather well. It was nice that Tom still treated Meitty as one of his friends as Jerri knew a few boys at school who would dump a girl if she started to even grow slightly rounder. In fact Tom had never even complained about what a drain Mietty was when it came to his food and wallet. A shocking thought raced across her mind, causing her heart to skip a beat. One again Jerri snuck a peak at her distracted companion/completion, focusing this time on Meitty’s comparatively wider hips and bigger butt which filled her seat from side to side, as well as her heartier chest which had ballooned up from an attractive but average looking, to huge and almost boastful in their size. Her imagination getting the best of her,Jerri could see the two hindrances growing larger with the more Mietty ate, eventually eclipsing Jerri from Tom's life.Jerri began to feel a paltry stacked up against such stacked completion.

With this short moment alone she could tell Meitty how the fat really made her look here in America, now that would take the pep out of her step! Nicknames like "Tubby", and "Lard ass", flooded her brain, and hey she was green too maybe she caller her " a fatty frog" or something like that. Meitty even seemed to genuinely like Jerri, especially if Jerri was the one treating the group for that night. So things were set, the way Jerri saw it, if there was a thing between Tom, Meitnerium, and herself, (and she wasn’t saying that there was) but if there were ever to be something between the three of them… she’d play things fair and square, without restoring to name calling and the like. Almost instantly afterwards Tom returned from the snack counter carrying a literal armful of snacks and sodas. Handing the snacks to their respective owners, Tom settled down comfortably on the other side of Jerri, and the film began.

It was a rush of an action film, the kind were style was placed over substance, in essence the perfect “popcorn movie.” Taking her eyes away from the movie during one of the films quieter scenes, Jerri looked about her. There was Tom silent and enthralled with film as always, seemingly oblivious to anything around him, unlike Meitty who was strangely laughing throughout the intergalactic war epic.

“That’s what they call an interstellar cruiser? Fracking faith!” she chuckled to herself, sending her body wildly-a -wiggling. Soon the film (and refreshments) were finished. As the threesome exited the theater they excitedly raved over the explosive film.

“I don’t think even an SUV would blow up a space ship like that, even if you did drive it off a skyscraper” Jerri said to the group on their way out.

Tom laughed and added “No I don’t think so, but tell me that wasn’t cool when the guys found the captured alien tech in Roswell, and then they used that stuff back on the aliens?”

“Yeah,” Meitty answered who was now quite use to the fact that it seemed humans always won in these things. “But what was up with that mothership? Ha!” She scoffed as she slid her sunglasses back on perhaps a little too fast as they happened to knock off her thick headband, revealing her antenna for the world to see. Jerri hadn’t noticed them as she bent down to retrieve the headband, but certainly did as she offered the headband back.

“Here you go Mei-ieie” Jerri gaped.

“Oh thank you.” Meitnerium said unaware of her new nudity.

“Mietty what- what are…those?” she asked pointing an accusing finger at the dangly-bobs hanging from her head. The act caused a few bystanders to stop and crane their heads to see what the ruckus was about.

Jerri knew Tom Parker better than anybody on the face of the Earth, save for maybe his parents. If there was one thing Tom couldn't do, it was lie; not to her, and especially not on the spot. The diminutive gearheaded girl could spot the signs from a mile away: his cheeks got all red, his smile stretching across his face so that his dimples were set on display, and he began laughing nervously. She narrowed her eyes at the appendages dangling from atop Meitnerium's head, scrutinizing every single detail about the oblong lures that hung from the thick stalks firmly rooted in her snowy hair. Surely they were fake, there was no way on Earth a girl had been born with antennae! Of course, she would have said that three months ago about girls with green skin too. Perhaps just a little procuring squeeze to one of them? Just to reaffirm her position on where she stood with this. She boldly took a step forward, standing about three inches from the twin mountaintops of Meitnerium's cleavage, and stretched a hand out, her fingers primed for pinching...

"Woah, hey!" Meitty took an instinctive step back, her response simply grained into her Metalean way of thinking. It wasn't intentional; the last thing she wanted to do was to out herself as an alien. But as she realized her mistake Meitnerium calmed herself and came up with a quick lie; "I mean, don't yank on them!" she did her best to mimic the elevation and pitch of her previous outcry, getting moderate results, "It took so long to... uh, attach these things with... um.... stage makeup!" she stammered. Tom's urge to facepalm was overwhelming, it was only through the toughest of wills that he managed to overcome. Inwardly, he crossed his fingers and hoped for the best; from what he had learned about Meitnerium, the antennae were very sensitive; should she slip up and scream or moan, they would have to come up with another fib to feed Jerri really quick.

Jerri crossed her arms, "I just wanna see 'em!" she sounded very much like a child -her highly pitched voice not helping the allusion- and indeed looked like one as she jumped slightly to swat at Meitnerium's supposedly cosmetic features. "If they're fake, why won't you let me give 'em a good squeeze?"

She had a good point, both Tom and Meitnerium could see the logic in her statement. And while Meitnerium wasn't exactly comfortable with the idea of another girl touching her doo-dads, there wasn't much else of a choice. She looked to Tom for support, and hopefully some sly Earthling way out of this, but was only met with a simple shrug from the black headed teen. Meitty took a deep sigh and bowed slightly so that the smaller girl could adequately reach the birthrights mounted atop her head. Meitnerium had to admit that was a pretty stupid question. Not only because of the well recognized, deep gravels that only her father's voice could possibly possess, but also because looking at the screen of her telephone she could clearly see the words "Dad" written in blocky Metalean letters. It may have been a little fuzzy, but it was definitely her Daddy on the other end! She paused, leaning onto the dresser drawers for support as she waited with bells on for an answer. At this point she was really more excited to just hear her father than go home; she didn't realize just quite how much she had missed him in these long months. "Dad? H-Hello?!" she brought the phone closer to her mouth, raising her voice to overcome the approaching static, "Daddy can you hear me?!"

"Of -ourse I -an!" Her father's voice was overpowered by what sounded like grain, like he was standing at the opposite end of the ocean. Meitty managed to hold back tears as she heard him shout, "S-e's o-ay!" to somebody in the background, probably her mother and all of her friends waiting for her back home. "-oney I'm s- gla- you'- o-ay!" He said loudly into his own end, "Your M-oth- and I have m-ed you so m-ch!" In the background she could hear digitized sobbing, likely her mother weeping into the side of the phone. "I missed you guys too; oh I'm so happy I can talk to you again!"

Everything was fading, fast. She could hear it, her father's words became more and more muffled by the oppressive static between them. "-eit-erium?" she held up her phone with doughy arms and stood on her tiptoes, putting her father on speaker phone so she could get it as close to the beacon as possible; which wasn't very close at all, considering it was in orbit. But Meitnerium was desperate! "I'm here Daddy!" she shouted, struggling to hold back tears of joy. "W-re a-e you?!" she heard her mother shout into the phone, "Ple-e baby, yo- h-ve to te-l - wh-e you are!" Meitnerium nearly lost it when she heard her mother's voice. She immediately wanted to bring the phone in closer so that she could talk to everyone waiting on her at home; but should she move that receiver any closer to the ground, she could very well lose signal entirely! "I'm in the Milky Way system; Earth!" she shouted loudly

"W-re?!"

"The Milky Way System!" she parroted herself loudly; emphasizing the name of her crash site very clearly. "Please, come and get me! I want to see you guys so much!" She brought the phone down at the sound of a low beep, her phone vibrating softly in her fleshy hand. Panicking, Meitnerium tilted her head up towards her phone; worst nightmare realized in the form of a dully lit screen and a low battery signal. "Oh Faith!!" she shouted, bringing her phone back down on reflex. "No no no; this battery was supposed to have a shelf-life of six Metalean months!" Immediately she caught herself. "FAITH!!" she shouted as she looked at the screen. "Mom? Dad? Hello?!" she shouted to a non-responsive party.
...
...
"I love you..." she said softly before closing the phone. Tears slowly began to roll down her rounded cheeks and her chest began to rise; Meitnerium had lost the one and only contact she'd had with anybody from home in the last few months all because she didn't bring her charger. She tightened her grip around her phone before throwing it onto the bed in rage, giving it a quick punch before completely breaking down into a blubbering mess on top of her covers...

She didn't even get to say goodbye...

As he drove home Tom felt he’d done pretty well on his final. Even with the events of the night previous flashing in his mind, he still managed to bring out the facts he worked so hard to memorize. Now with the campus in his rear view mirror he couldn’t wait to get home and start vacationing. His heart was beating with excitement as he thought of all the fun things he’d get to do this summer with Meitnerium. As he entered the house Tom smiled when he saw Meitty had been through the box of pop tarts he’d left out, and that the TV was still on. But wait… was that… crying? Hurrying through the house he found Meitnerium in her room face down and weeping into her pillow.

“Meitty… what?” he began unsure where to start. Girl issues were something he had no clue about, with Jerri ever the tomboy concealing her more feminine issues from Tom.

“*sniff* OH TOM IT’S HORRIBLE!” Meitnerium wailed as she turned over to face him. Tom saw tears had stained her pillow and were still streaming down her face.

“What happened?” he asked confused about what could so suddenly send her into tears.

Meitty managed to explain what had happened in between her sobs and sighs, Tom understood it was up to him to soothe things over for her now. "All right Tom, big heroic speech time" he thought psyching himself up to be a film's hero for once.

“Well… Then there still are some good things….” He said sitting down on the bed next to the clover colored chick cracking up before him.

“Like, what?” she shouted, lashing out at him.

“Well for one…at least they know you’re missing.” Tom stated, now bringing his arm around Meitnerium in an attempt to soothe her.

“What?”

“Before you told me that they’d thought you’d transferred to a different school. At least you know they’re looking for you, and at least they know you're safe.”

“Yeah...well, so.” Meitty said sounding stubbornly inconsolable

“And I guess our planet’s must be pretty close, because Earth was close enough for them to reach your beacon. I bet your peoples space-ships can get here pretty fast...It's not like they'll have any trouble picking what planet your on either, everyone...well except maybe dad, thinks we're the only "livable" planet in our solar system.” Tom found the words were quickly coming to him as he stated the honest to goodness facts, not like his lies which often took long to think of .

Meitty said nothing, but had stopped her bawling.

“And hey! Till they come get you, you still have us here on Earth…You still have…me.” He leaned in and placed just the smallest kiss on the top of her snow white head.

“Oh, Tom!” Meitnerium said as she sat up and tightly embraced him, (almost sending him tumbling over and off the bed.) She rested her head against his shoulder before speaking again. “You know what your right. They’re probably doing all they can to find me right now” She added feeling a little better.

“Yeah, this is something we should celebrate!” Tom said hoping Meitty would remain positive.

“Sounds good” Meitty said giving one last final sniff. “I’m going to “wash up” and then we're going out.” she commanded now back to her semi-bossy self, as she headed into the bathroom.

“Fine” Tom said, only happy to see Meitty brighten up so quickly.

“Oh and Tom…” she added, sticking her green head out from behind the bathroom door, “Don’t think you’re getting out of telling me what happened last night” and she tossed her top towards Tom. She giggled from behind the bathroom door, and Tom knew everything was going to be okay.

What would have been minutes if it were Tom showering up, turned into an almost hour long affair as he was once again forced to wait for Meitty to get dressed. It proved to be worth the wait though as Meitty was absolutely stunning as she exited her room. Looking quite hip(py) and ready for summer in her printed cotton tank top and shorts, she was far from the blubbering blob of a being she’d been a few hours ago. Tom found himself quite pleased as he realized Meitty’s top wouldn’t be close to covering her growing green gut, and at the sight of her shorts as they were slightly sinking into her hips. The two were signs that Meitty might need to go shopping again, but maybe that was something best saved for later this summer…

One again packing into the snug car Meitranium was feeling better, even happy, now that Tom was here. Her Tom. Meitty knew he was right, her parents would be looking for her and find her any day now, even if it might take a while. For now there was no use in crying. Lost in her thoughts about her family Meitty hadn’t realized they’d apparently arrived at their unusual destination.

“You ready for something special?” Tom asked Meitty, wearing a grin that looked a mile wide.

Meitty took in her surroundings and realized they were at…
