1113221112112112212222122112111122111.content:
...a relatively unimpressive building in design. Despite its poor architecture and design, the parking lot of said building was simply flooded with cars of all kinds; ones that Meitnerium could easily identify as a "rich man"s or a "poor man"s vehicle simply by looking at the automobile in question. Granted, she was judging them by her own standards which in turn had been established by her father, but the basic principle was the same all things considered. Tom's teensy-weensy Sedan nearly rolled into the parking lot (fitting into the "Poor Man" quality quite nicely) as he started strolling around the lot looking for a parking space. As he drove, Meitnerium had to restrain herself from pressing her nose against the glass of her window to see what was so "special" about this building. Not only had it attracted apparently hundreds of patrons before her, it was obviously special enough for Tom to consider taking her here for a date -was date the right word? Nevermind...- Her golden eyes traveled to the corners of their sockets as she sought out whatever mysteries this no-doubt hot spot for Earthling dating had to hold.

Inside, from what she could make out, was a brightly lit place with amusingly tacky choice in decor. There were humans of all stature, great and small both in position and in size, seemingly going through some sort of maze bound by felt rope. Of course, it may have just been a trick of the light or something, there was no way Tom had taken her into a... club? That would be so sweet of him, taking her to a dance club! She did like to drink; and she did like to dance. Oh the thought of how long it had been since she'd been dancing, it nearly made Meitnerium shudder with delight! She longed for the panels of translucent squares of elevated solid light that supported the only the most talented, sexy, or well-recognized movers and shakers that had come in that night. She never really figured where she fit into in all of those categories; hopefully all three!

But then again, this was a club on Earth; a place that, as had been made painfully obvious during her stay on this planet, was not nearly as technologically advanced as her home on Metalement. Again still, from the images that she had absorbed in her long hours of T.V. troping Meitnerium guessed she still had plenty to be excited about. Maybe the outside was just temporary, a facade until they could get something cooler and edgier? Either way, so long as it had good booze and some killer beats Meitnerium would make the best out of her attendance tonight. The thought of rocking all of these podunk Earth hicks with her out of this world (literally!) dance moves made it all the while, and it showed in the excited smile that bunched up between her ever-rounding cheeks.

Before she knew it the car had come to a complete halt in a tiny parking space between an SUV (surprisingly enough to Meitnerium, the "S" did not stand for "Space") and an old hoopdie car that bulged a little bit over its own parking space and into Tom's. "Well, you ready?" the curly black headed teenager asked his green-skinned sweetheart. "You know it!" she squealed, bringing Tom into her embrace for a big kiss on the lips, "Oh Tommy you've made me that happiest girl in the Galaxy!" she teased him lightly, "I mean, taking me out to a club on our first date; maybe you've got just a little bit of Metalean charm in you after all!" she finished off with a quick coo and relinquished the poor suffocating boy from his squishy fate. "Wait, Meitty!" Tom called after her as she wiggled her plus-sized bum out the door; she left the SUV's door with a nasty ding as she underestimated the size of her voluptuous booty and the space it would require: thus rocketing Tom's door into its side. Tom hurried as fast as he could out his own door before he noticed the sizable dent and took priority towards insurance...

Meanwhile:

"Sup guys?!" Meitnerium shouted as she boisterously waddled her way into one of the side doors that led inside this mysterious and severely underdeveloped Earth "club". As she makes her way in, in all of her revealing glory, she catches the eyes of father mother and child; none of whom can seem to stop staring at this eccentric green girl who looked quite the part of patron to one of these institutions. "Is she green?" a daughter turned to her father, "My God, she didn't have to be so loud!" a single mother coddled her son's ears, "See Sherry, that's what you'll end up like if we sell the Bowflex." a husband nudged to his wife as he gestured towards Meitnerium's fully exposed midsection. "Where's the party?!" she continued under the false idea that this was a club, instead of a rather family-oriented chain of buffets. Oblivious to the derogatory remarks she was garnering from the guests tonight, Meitnerium sauntered up to the felt rope and squeezed herself between the aisle. "What is this, why're we all just waiting here?" A homosexual man in front of her turned back with repressed hatred in his eye, "We're waiting to get in." he said curtly before turning back to his date. "Waiting to get- what is there a bouncer or something?"

The doors opened yet again to reveal Tom, exhausted from the panic of dinging a very expensive looking car and chasing after Meitnerium. He wheezed and panted as he slowly broke in the quickly-forming line to get to his date of the evening. "Meitty..." he gasped helplessly before he was brought into another killer squeeze. "Oh and here's the man who brought me here to my first club here; here being in Texas because I'm totally from Earth!" she squealed, "Oh Tommy Tommy Tommy you sure do know how to get into a girl's heart, don'tchu?!"

"It's not a club..."

"Say what?"

"It's not a club... it's a restaurant."

Meitnerium paused for a second before dropping Tom in shock. Had she? She had, hadn't she! She'd made a total fool of herself in front of all these Earth people! She turned on her heels and faced the back of the man in front of her's head with an audible "hmph!". Tom, still trying to catch whatever breath he had left, couldn't do much more than smile and let out a little laugh as he saw Meitnerium pout, no doubt hiding an even more verdant face than usual. "It's one of those all you can eat places; the ones you've been bugging me so much about... while you're... um, in this country." At this she melted visibly, "Oh, oh Tom I..." she caught herself and turned right back around, "No way, I'm still mad at you for making me look like a fool. And not taking me to a club."

"Well, if you want we could-

"Nothisplace'sgood!"

As they patiently waited for their turn to enter this food mecca, Tom could see the meatier Meitty before him was far from mad; she was visibly trembling with excitement as she stood in line, her fingers titched anxiously at her shorts, and it seemed her golden eyes had grown to match the size of the restaurant’s dinner plates. The undeniably deprived- starved if Tom didn't know better- gleam in her eyes spoke everything Tom could possibly want to know about Meitnerium's intentions for tonight right then and there, its testimony further accentuated by the deep rumbling of her greedy gullet. And after more than their fair share of waiting, they were gloriously admitted entrance into this bounty, smorgasbord if you will, and were escorted to a booth on the far right side of the restaurant. Their booth was small enough to cause Meitnerium a little grief, but the interstellar porker managed to wriggle her way into one side of tonight's table

“Well…” Tom finally began after a few seconds of awkward positioning on Meitnerium's part, “Go ahead and help yourself.” he commanded his elliptical date for the evening. She seemed at a loss, which all things considered was quite understandable. Especially since she had just managed to heave herself in there, Meitnerium never was one for physical exertion. "Help myself?" Meitty repeated in an almost haughty sort of tone, "You mean they don't... you know, bring the food to us?" Tom smiled and rolled his eyes, "You're just so laaaazieeee!" He taunted Meitnerium with the last word, rising from his own seat so as to lead a tutorial in self-service. Meitnerium's jaw dropped, "I am not lazy!" she said in an elevated pitch as she wriggled her way out of the booth, "I just thought that these people, like, brought us whatever food we wanted!" She was actually sort of looking forward to that.

"And spoiled too." Tom said as he grabbed Meitnerium's pudgy green hand, "We've really gotta get you used to this whole 'Earth' thing pretty quick." He guided Meitnerium towards his first inclination regarding her tastes: the Meat section. Seeing that she wasn't too fond of salads, either because it was healthy or the similar pigmentation shared with her own skin creeped her out a little; Tom wasn't sure. But that didn't leave much either than fruits and, well, the already reached destination that was the Entree's. He watched with a sort of fascination as Meitnerium held back the floodgates of saliva and sheer gluttony, easily able to tell that her first instinct was to grab the biggest hunk of anything and shove it in her mouth. She rested her hands on her grumbling midsection, trying to quell its incessant growling. "Tom." she whispered, almost as if not to offend the culinary gods themselves with her ignorance "How does this work?"

Tom simply smiled and held up a single finger as if to say "just watch." as he expertly and nonchalantly walked up to the section where the roast beef was being handled and cared for. He garnered the older gentleman's attention and made the rather anticlimactic order of "Large order of roast beef, please?"

To which, in Meitnerium's astonishment, the chef smiled graciously, grabbed his knife, and began cutting up the immaculate hunk of meat in front of her to Tom's direct specifications. "No no, a little bigger." he said with confidence, "Meh, maybe with just a little more pink on it..." and when, in what seemed like eons to the onlooking Meitnerium, Tom the placeholder had completed her order; resulting in a rather large slab of roasted beef. She poked it, almost grabbing at it with her bare hands before Tom ushered them down. "There's no way you're just gonna get that one slab of beef!" he said with mild amusement, "You can get more before sitting down, you know."

That was probably the best thing Meitnerium could have heard at that point. "I can?" she asked, devilish intent made clear in her narrowed brow and greedy smile...

“So, It’s good?” Tom asked knowingly as he polished off his own servings.

“Oh yeah, absolutely" Meitnerium said through a mouthful. Tom eyed the giant stack of ribs that Meitty had devoured and contemplated over whether or not that poor pig had any ribs left to spare after Meitnerium got a hold of them.

This was already her seventh... no eighth plate; he wished he’d kept track as he was sure the number would have been in the double digits before the day was through. He was beginning to understand why Jerri had pushed more and more food on Meitty at the mall that afternoon, he was getting a little excited (in both sense of the term) as he watched the green gobbler stuff herself further. Meitnerium sure did take advantage of the all-you-can-eat experience, and for what he’d pay for Tom thought it was an awesome deal. In fact he was pretty sure that place was actually losing money on her.

“So about last night?” she asked suddenly, wiping her lips clean of any leftover rib residue.

The topic was unavoidable, she'd said several times throughout the meal that they were going to get it out of him after the next course. Fortunately for Tom, she had been pretty preoccupied in indulging herself and failed to notice that she had already gone through two more plates before noticing. "Yeah... well, you know you weren't exactly yourself; I mean you were practically... well, literally climbing all over me."

“Yeah, I guess I was a bit horny last night.” She mentioned dreamily.

“What?”

“Hor-nee” she said again a little too loud for Tom’s comfort. “You weren’t exactly taking it easy on the girls last night.” She explained pointing directly at where her antennae would be had they not been covered. "Well yeah, I guess I was kinda 'on' myself last night." he lowered his voice to avoid attracting attention, "Um we were...” His mouth was running dry as finding the right words to describe last night was becoming difficult. “And you, uh, just laid the seat back; we both were naked, and well weeeee..."

“Mmmm yes… go on!” Meitty ushered.

“And well, I’m pretty sure you know what comes next.”

"Oh I do, but tell me anyways.” Meitnerium said eagerly, almost sitting on pins and needles

“Well this is where it gets pretty funny.” Tom said happy to get to the “punch line” of the story. “It was right around that time where you started uh on top of me, but I guess you weren’t quite used to a compact car, because well, you jerked up and hit your head. Hard!” he said exploding into laughter.

“What?”

“Yeah, that’s what I said. I knew you were fine, but you were o-u-t out. That was pretty much the end of things before they could even really start. It was a good thing too that mom and dad had gone to bed too because I had to drag your 250 pound butt all the way to your bed.”

Well that certainly explained Mietty’s “morning after” headache. She was very disappointed at this lackluster ending. “Well, we’ll have to make up for it double next time.”

Tom’s faced flushed red. “Next time?”

“Oh yeah we’ll have plenty of fun till my parents come back” she said twirling a pudgy finger through her pearly locks. “But I have just one more question… Tom am I…what was that word, fat?” She pinched an inch of her stomach to highlight the topic in question.

“Oh…” Tom gulped. He had all ready accidentally let slip her weight, and now he had to diffuse this bomb of a question that now landed in his lap. Worse yet, unlike Jerri, Meitty could tell when Tom was lying; better tell her the truth then…“Uh-well I don’t know about fat…curvy maybe…” Oops. “-Which is perfectly fine!” He shouted not wanting to hurt anyone’s feelings. He leaned in closer “It’s actually common around here to be on the…plus size of things” he whispered across the table. His eyes motioned for Mietty to take a look around at some of the heavier, much much heavier patrons that obviously frequented this place.

“Yeah, Two hundred fifty pounds doesn’t sound like that much. I don’t know why you didn’t tell me. ” Tom breathed a sigh of relief as Meitty who was much used to wieght in massive tons than paltry pounds wriggled her way out of the booth. “In fact you seemed pretty fine with all this last night” she added with a golden eyed wink and a shake that sent her bulk a bouncing. Tom could only smile in response. There was something about this alien’s attitude that he loved or was it something about that big, green, jiggling ass….Now that he thought about it, Tom couldn't be sure which one he liked more.

The rest of their time there continued in the same fashion; as Tom talked Meitty ate, and ate, and ate, finding new surprises of taste with every plate; even recognizing some familiar ones. Hot plates of mashed potatoes and thick gravy, garlic bread, spaghetti, sesame shrimp, hush-puppies, pepperoni pizza! All of it enchanting to her taste buds. Tom was glad her spree wasn’t gaining any attention here (well from anyone besides him) and that each time Meitty went up for another helping she was patient as she waited in line. Time passed and eventually, Meitty had completed her trip up and down both sides of both buffet tables.

“Oh Tom, this was… *buraap* Sorry. This was absolutely perfect.” Meitty said content with letting her own hands do the tummy rubbing for now. “I want to come here every day!” she half ordered half bemoaned. The idea was tempting to Tom but he knew it would probably remain a fantasy, he could imagine the restaurant owners putting up a “Do Not Serve” sign behind their register in the dead center of which would be a picture of Meitty. In one day whether from her previous grief, or for the celebratory situation, or simply from hunger Meitnerium Perioda had nearly ate the place dry.

“No, Meitty. I don’t think so. But I do think we’re missing one thing from this being absolutely perfect…”

“What’s that?” Unable to think of anything that could make this even better.

“Dessert.” Tom said with a grin that looked like he’d been eating a certain dirty something himself.

The concept of dessert was not foreign to Meitnerium. During the long months of her endeavoring stay on Earth, more specifically the Parker Household, she had grown quite familiar with the concept of something sweet following a meal. Usually it was a simple slice of apple pie to satiate her need to fill that one small space that another whole ribeye seemed much too big to fill, though she had been known to devour an entire tray of brownies when the mood struck her; the spectrum seemed to fluctuate haphazardly. And while she was by all means a woman with food after her heart, Meitty didn't quite know just what was so exciting about a tray of brownies. Well, no more exciting than usual. "Oh, well, works for me." the taut-tummied extraterrestrial said in a slightly surly slur, trying to keep the flirtatious air about them alive, "But can I have a sec to digest? I feel like I might pop."

Tom smiled and cooled his jets, "Sure thing." he said understandingly, "You feeling alright?"

"Yeah, its just... phew, I ate so much food!" at this Tom's gaze traveled downwards to their table, where the conquest of Meitnerium's latest culinary massacre had yet to be taken away. And of course she was right, this wasn't quite her limit but Meitnerium had eaten a lot more than Tom had expected her to. In fact, she had probably eaten more than anyone else here tonight! "Yeah you did." Tom could only reaffirm her statement at this point, there was little other option other than blatant agreement. "I-I've just got this sharp pain, riiight here..." Meitnerium gestured to the ailing area in question, it being the apex of her distended stomach. Tom reached out and touched it gently, only for her to wince and recoil in pain. "Ow!" she yelped, "Knock it off you jerk!" Though as she returned to her reclining position, Tom could clearly see the problem as a small shadow formed under Meitnerium's prominent stomach...

"Hey, do me a favor?" he asked slyly

"What?"

"Put your feet up on the booth?" he pointed to her sneaker'd green little feet, "And then lay back on the side?" Meitnerium stared for a second, trying to discern the strange post-gluttony ritual of Earth before doing as Tom asked. Immediately, that being as soon as her stomach was free to drop heavily between her thighs. "Ooh!" she cooed in amazement, "Much better!" She examined the little flushed imprint the table had left on her stomach with mild amusement. "Frickin' Faith, you people should really get adjustable booths." she made the indigence in her voice very clear as she said that, "A girl wants to get her grub on and you podunk little hicks make her poor ol' tummy hurt!" at this point her intentions were clearly not meant to offend, flirtatious even as she cradled the addressed "poor ol' tummy" sensually, looking at Tom with her best 'come hither' eyes.

"Get me some dessert?" she said in a low voice as she massaged her overloaded stomach, "I don't think I can get back in this booth if I ever get out... not that I wanted to." she whimpered. Tom could only smile knowingly. The girl was good, he had to give her that. "Ice cream it is then." Tom said in an approving tone before rising, taking a second to disguise his hard-on the best he could. Meitnerium chuckled, "Oh my, happy to see me indulge myself?" she asked quietly. Tom could only smile back before retreating to the dessert section. Meitty watched as he walked away, and as soon as he was out of earshot she began howling quietly to herself. "Owowowowow!!" she whined as she held her poor overstuffed tummy close. It really hurt after so much food, but she wouldn't dare let Tom see that! "Oh... ohh..." she moaned quietly as her best attempts at soothing the raging fire inside her belly proved useless. Massages were beyond useless at this point, it looked very much like she had swallowed an Earth Basketball!

It was a heated pain that radiated outwards, not unlike burning oneself on a heater or an oven. Her plump little fingers danced around it anxiously trying to cease the pain, but the natural processes were already at work. What she was feeling was digestion; her body was trying to break down way too much food at once, and she was definitely paying the toll for her gluttony. Oh if only she had refused those last three or four plates, she wouldn't be in this mess!

However her eyes brightened when Tom came into view, ice cream cone in hand...

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
At the sight of Tom with ice-cream, Meitty resumed her everything-is-fine-with-me position bearing with the burning in her belly. As Tom handed her the single scoop cone Meitnerium noticed he’d even adorned it with a cherry on top. Not just yet ready to dig into the ice cream, Meitty moved towards the cherry which she usually saved for last and expertly grasped it between her lips. Then still with the cherry in her mouth she managed to tie the stem into a small knot, giving Tom the impression that her tongue was now probably the second most used muscle in her body, the first of course being her growing gluteus maximus.

Meitnerium swallowed the cherry with a wink, but then she cringed as the insufferable sensation within her seemed to return. You might say her body had now reached a tipping point. Chemically her body had adapted from the quick fill-me-up of nutrients of her planet’s food pills, and was now quite accustomed to digesting Earth food slowly throughout the day or while sleeping like most humans. But now the odd combination of the variety of foods within her, including the cherry, had sent her digestive system into overload. The constant inflow of food from the buffet had pooled inside of her stomachs limits, but now with so much different food stacked inside of it, her stomach’s contents had reached overspill status. One half of her strange alien body was getting the signal from the other half to digest as much as it could as fast as it could to make room for more food. This chemical reaction took place in a matter of seconds, but sent Meitty’s metabolism into a hyper “store and save” mode. Slowly as she slept Meity’s stomach stretched upwards and rose outwards growing a tiny bit larger and heavier with every breath.

This rare odd chemical reaction taking place within her would definitely end up changing Meitranium much more than a normal meal would but by how much?

" He searched for the words to explain it but simply ended up saying the blunt truth. "Both of you are just really fun to be with, and um, nice, and well people that I like. Well really really like in fact. Jer you're like the smartest person I know and-"

Jerri cut him off again, and for the first time in what felt like forever Tom watched as the curly headed girl actually smiled. "I...I believe you and I’m sorry I blew up like that..."

But, to show that this "first date" could still be salvaged somewhat she broke the tension between them by adding "That feeding stuff is still pretty weird though."

"What?" Tom said both a look of surprise and a smile coming to his face. "Who was blowing her up like a balloon at the mall?"

"Well..That-That’s because I thought she was foreign." Jerri explained. Then, her mind intrigued she asked "So how big is she going to get?" Jerri thought of an huge alien monster movie sized Meitty storming into town and downing an entire dairy farms supply of milk, with Tom cheering her on.

“Honestly..." He said sighing "I don’t know, and I can’t say when she’s going back home either. I mean I hope she does get to go back home to her family but, until then she seems to be having the time of her life being EarthboundTM here huh?”

“Tom...about that if she's leaving then I-” Jerri stopped short when she saw Meitty out on the patio of “Remember The Alamode Ice-creamery” finishing off what must have been one hell of a stacked sundae. Well if you’d call it eating. Jerri watched Meitty help herself to spoonful after gigantic spoonful of the ice-cream, looking filled with glee and without an ounce of guilt. “Wow...” Was all Jerri could muster as a strange mix of emotions washed over her as she watched Meitty go.

“Wow what?" Tom asked. "Oh look there she is Jer come on.” He slightly picked up his pace and passed Jerri. Jerri shook her head and whatever thoughts that were building within from watching Meitty tear into the towering treat. Maybe there was one more thing Tom and Jerri had in common... “Uh, race you there.” She shouted taking off after him. The two quickly pulled up some seats as Meitty was finishing. Tom's mouth was running dry and he was practically panting as he watched Meitty gulp her way through what was practically gallons of ice cream. Jerri noted Meitty had only three more scoops left of this tasty tower. Slurping and scooping Meitranium continued with nothing more than a nod to the two of them as a sign of acknowledgement. She then lifted the bowl itself to drink down the creamy caloric rich ice cream soup left at the bottom of it before licking any traces of creme from her lips and mouth.

The rather nice ice cream vendor, who had also watched Meitty defeat the dessert on this rather slow morning, ran out to congratulate her. "Your winner lady and gentlman!" she announced to the trio. "Mitran, Miter, Ms. Perioda! Announced the country girl as she raised her cucumber colored customer's flabby arm and hand in victory. “And here is your ten dollars and free t-shirt” she said cheerily handing Meitty the two before heading back to the kitchen empty bowl in hand.

“Ooh this one’s pink” Meitty noted as she unfolded the triple X-large t-shirt open. She wondered if all the clothes she’d win today would come in this same slightly stretched size...oh well they got the job done eve if thereby weren’t exactly the best designed clothes in the universe.

“Meitty...what do you mean this one?” Tom asked.

“What didn’t you notice? I already won this one” she said as she stretched her now high riding shirt downwards so both could read the logo on the front. “I wonthis one for you Tom." she said as she tossed a matching huge blue t-shirt over to Tom

“But I really like this pink one too," she noted. "I could win you one Jerri. Don't worry I still got plenty of room, do you want me to?” she asked ever so politely to the girl on her left. Tom and Jerri’s moth drooped “You didn’t...“ Tom said more giddy than angry. “Did anybody watch you?” Jerri asked now realizing that taking care of an alien with an appetite like Meitty's was indeed a pretty hard for Tom to do.

“Ha-ha" Meitty laughed nervously. "Why would anyone care if a normal big girl like me wanted an extra big sundae?"

“Because Meitty you’re..." Jerri caught herself and settled down into a lower voice “you’re an alien.”

It was Meitty's turn to freak out as she looked to Tom and looked like she might run. "Relax Meitty" He said using his hands to motion her to calm down. "I decided to let her know. Besides Jerri's cool with the fact your an alien,she's close enough to share in the secret." He put an arm around Jerri to show there were no longer any walls between the two.

Meitty caught her breath as she considered this. Jerri was practically the only other nice Earthling she knew here,other than the Parkers. Jerri just better be carefull where she put that hand on her Tom. Meitty had never tried human finger, (well other than sucking on Tom's seductively once or twice) but there was always time to take a bite out of one that ended up in a place where it shouldn't be.

"Oh, um, that’s great...Uh, surprise!” she said as she turned to Jerri.

Jerri was still flabbergasted as she re-read all of the shirts once more and did some mental calculations. “I’m more shocked you ate six foot longs plus a boat load of ice cream. How did I not notice before?" Jerri was going to say amazed rather than shocked but quickly remembered this was the girl Tom had been "seeing."

"Well want to see me win something else?" She offered to Jerri again smiling a hungry smile.

Jerri said as he waved dismissively at Tom's direction, "So what if you give a few people a show; I say you sit down on that stool and eat 'til you can't eat no more!" she said eagerly, a bright smile plastered on her thin face. "Wait right here with your friends, I'll bring it right out to you." she said with a wide smile before disappearing into the back.

Tom asked inquisitively as he eased in on Jerri through Meitnerium's thick barricade of blubber, "I never pegged you as someone who likes all this 'weird' stuffing stuff!" Tom teased as he watched Jerri visibly recoil in embarrassment as she remembered her comments from earlier. "I-I'm not into anything, Thomas!" she stammered, "It's just so cool watching Meitty eat, you know?"

"Wow, that's really creepy." Tom teased her

"Yeah, even Tom's not that much of a creeper." Meitty joined in the Earth-hazing

Jerri couldn't help but laugh, but only Tom seemed to notice that Jerri's smile got three times as wide when she caught sight of the massively robust boat of ice cream brought out in front of her very eyes. "Oh wow!" she shouted as Meitnerium began eagerly licking her lips, "Its so huge, so big!" Meitnerium snorted, "Sh'yeah, so's my butt." she said with sound confidence in her gluttonous ability, "Now watch me eat this sucker whole!"

Both Tom and Jerri couldn't deny the strange thrill that they both shared whenever they caught Meitnerium on one of her not-so-scarce incidents of indulgence. The overwhelming urge to just squeeze Meitnerium's bulging flesh was Tom's biggest urge, though he could swear that Jerri's occasional touches on Meitneirum's back led to a bit of a pinch as the green girl gobbled her glut. The wiggling in his trousers was matched only by the re-dampening of Jerri's swimsuit as they both sat, eagerly getting aroused as Meitnerium stuffed herself further and further down into the hole of obesity...

And then their eyes met over Meitty's ducked head. Both looked away instinctively, neither could quite hide just how red their faces were getting with all this excitement. But after a second or two had passed, they looked back. Their eyes shared the same sense of shame and arousal was easily recognizable to its counterpart. This was going to be a long summer after all...

Tom and Jerri were both grinning like crazy as she finished the baskets of various burgers, both watching intently as Meitty’s stomach began to bloat, filling further and further outwards with food in a water balloon like fashion. As the waiter handed the greenish glutton her free prize (a XL t-shirt spouting that she’d beaten the burger buffet battle) he gave the triumphant trio a quick snooty glare that said “Big deal, shouldn’t you be going now?” Tom seemed to be the only one who sensed this, or at least was the only one who cared, and decided it was finally time to head home. Jerri or Meitty didn’t give much of a fight this time, with Meitty finally feeling full, and Jerri full of new feelings to think about.

As they walked back to the car, Meitty leading the way and having almost no trouble walking or getting out of the booth on her ownthank-you-very-much, Tom was suddenly approached by a much happier Jerri.

“So, uh, today...was...” the curly haired girl looked for the words but couldn’t find them. How did one describe a day where you find out that you’re best friend/crush is into feederism and is in a relationship with a girl who is an alien with an almost endless appetite?

“Amazing?” Tom said helpfully.

“Yeah, amazing” she agreed.

Tom slowed his walking, and turned to Jerri looking like something was still weighing heavily on his mind. “Look...Jerri, I’m sorry for lying to you, it was kind of a weird situation you know and I-”

“Stop right there.” Jerri said cutting off his apology. “I can understand why you lied about Meitty, and I guess I can understand about the feeder kind of thing. But for what’s it worth that was one nice massage back there, sooo...let’s just call things even?"

“R-Really?!" Tom shouted.

"Sure, Meitty is probably the first alien ever on Earth, and um I don’t mind sharing you, if you uh, want to share her with me...or something”

Tom caught what Jerri was hinting at and was beginning to feel like the luckiest guy in the world universe. Jerri saw his eyebrows rise and slugged him in the arm. Hard.

“But if I ever find out you have someone else again, we’re done! You here? And I don’t care if it’s an alien a werewolf or vampi-”

“Frickin faith you two it’s getting cold!” Meitty suddenly shouted having reached the car. “I probably weigh more than the both of you and I made it here before you did!” Tom and Jerri noted that the sun had set and things were a bit colder, even if they were all clothed in two XL tee-shirts.

“So same time tomorrow at your place?” Jerri asked in the same flirtatious way one asks for a kiss.

“Sounds good to me.” Tom said and took off racing towards the car, with Jerri chasing after him.

---


And what a summer it was! After that wonderful day at the beach and much like ever summer break he’d known the days seemed to fly by for Tom. One thing he was sure of was that those days that seemed to blend together were filled with food food food! And Meitty. Now often joined by Jerri during one of her stuffing sessions with Tom, the master muncher Meitty’s weight seemed to explode with fat, while the earthlings gleefully gauging the green girls gains daily.

Tom’s parents had only brought up the heavy subject matter but once, equally astounded at how the once wafer thin girls frame had bulked into a triple stacked burger of a body. Meitty explained how she still felt completely fine and healthy-no even healthier since she’d gotten here and the issue was likely never to be brought up again. That was until the issue of clothes that fit forced the pressing issue. Desiring something more stylish than her ever growing collection of t-shirts (which now included a shirt that read 1st place at the 4th of July hotdog feast) Meitty looked for other options. Fortunately there were still plenty of cans of spray on suits with Tom getting to explore and cover all of Meitranium’s celestial body.

And Meitty couldn’t be happier. Here she was being spoiled to her hearts content like she deserved , here she had found her new love, here surrounded by food was almost perfect. That was a big almost as with every week that passed rescue seemed to be less likely. She never gave up hope though as her new family here on Earth assured her that her parents were always closing in on finding her.

All in all it was a wild, fun, amazingly weird summer for everyone, but no amount of weirdness could prepare everyone for what was about to happen next.

As soon as a metalic clicking noise could be heard, his arm fell limp to his side; causing the door to hang only partly open for almost a minute before a merciful gust of wind decided to speed things up and pushed the door the rest of the way. Standing on the porch was a brown-haired woman in her early twenties who was wearing a horribly mismatched combination of a black sport's coat on top of a gold turtle neck sweatshirt, pink short-shorts, and bright yellow flipflops that were obviously too big for the wearer's feet.

"Greetings fellow Tezan!" The woman said with an insecure smile as soon as the door "remembered" to open. "I'm apart of the new government program to insure that all households are up to date on latest anti- brainworm standards. If I could just have a nano-cylce of your time, I can get my inspection done and be out of your hair."

"Well, I-"

"Great! Thanks," the misdressed woman said as she pulled out what seemed to be a PDA or some other device with a touchscreen, which instantly began beeping in rapid succesion. "It won't take long, I promise!"

With that, the brunette began to slowly take steps towards the couch, the device sounding off ever more frequently with every step.

"Arg! Tom! What the hell is that racket! We're trying to watch tv here!"

As soon as the voice caught the attention of the "home inspector", she instantly dropped the high-tec device in her hands, which fell to the ground with a resounding clang.

"M-M-Meitnerium?"

Upon hearing her name, the bulbous green girl managed to awkwardly rise off the sofa and turned around in an attempt to track down it's source.

"Tom, who's this?" Meitty said as a look of concern flooded her rounded face.

"Meitnerium! it is you!" The woman suddenly dashed forward and hopped clear over the oft-burdened sofa and gave the green mass of flab posessing Meitty's voice a hug. "I'm so glad to see you're safe! You're probably lucky that we even managed to find you at all so far out here in such an under-developed sector".

After a moment of recieving nothing but a blank stare as a response, A look of realization suddenly hit her.

"Oh yeah, the disguise," the woman said as she released Meitty and made a visible movement with her forehead. Almost instantly, the fashion faux pass before them was replaced by what appeared to be an imperfect replica of what M had looked like before she had discovered earth food. This metalean in particular had a lighter shade of green for her skin, along with purple colored irises in the center of her eyes and hair that was almost blood red. But what was the biggest contrast between her and Meitty was that her antennae were positively ENORMOUS! Sticking out a good 10 inches compared to Meitty's-which only stood out about three or four inches- and then currling inwards at the tips slightly, causing them to resemble minature elephant trunks. The little bulbs at the ends of the antennae currently had tiny metal spheres encassing them, causing Tom to assume that they must have created the "disguise" just a few moments ago.

"Vortia!" Meitty practically screamed with delight, practically crushing the newly-arrived metalean in her oversized grip.

"So, I'm guessing you two know eachother?" Jerri suddenly chipped in.

"We were friends in high school. While I made the 'brilliant' move of trying to get a higher education, Vortia got a paid-internship at Father's shipping company." The pea-shaped alien said as she released her (late)childhood friend, who instantly began taking in deep breaths to recover from the suffocating ordeal.

"When-huff-Mr. Periodia said-huff-that he was looking for people to help-wheeze-find you after- huff-your distress beacon was picked up, I-gasp-volunteered to come look for you."

"So my message did get through?" Meitty said looking positvely elated. "When I got ahold of my dad all those weeks ago, I wasn't quite sure that he managed to get my location through all of the static- where is he by the way? is he here with you?"

"Oh. Well... he really wanted to find you, but something came up at work and he couldn't come here in person, but he let me drive his SUV so that you would recognise it if I managed to find you. Like I said earler, your signal came in rather weak, so it was pretty much by chance that I managed to get a lock on you're location." The smaller metalean said as her breathing returned to normal.

Tom breathed a sigh of relief. Atleast some alien bigwig wasn't going to vaporize him for (mostly)accidently fattening up his daughter. For now, atleast.

"So, um... anyway M," Vortia half-mumbled as she slid behind her engorged friend, as if to use her as cover against the other two lifeforms in the room. "Who are you're friends? And how did you get to be this big anyway?"

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
And thus the three hip and happening teenagers (more like hippy and fattening in Meitty's case) regaled their heaviest's newfound friend in the ballad that had started all those months ago, taking Vortia back to that fateful night when Tom and his father had been stargazing. (This minor hump in the story took quite some time you see, as on Metaelement all stars in the visible sky as well as the solar systems surrounding the little planet have been charted, commercially named, and in some places colonized with cookie-cutter solar systems of their own, you can imagine why the young alien couldn't fathom any sort of entertainment in watching stars given her situation and upbringing. Tom later expressed a similar opinion, though only on the grounds that stargazing was dull as doornails.)

Between both the "lanky" and "dwarvish" members of the "carbon-based thingies", as they had come to be known to the least earthly of the two aliens in the room, Tom and Jerri took turns filling in any pieces of the grand puzzle that was their extraordinary situation. Tom, for instance, took the duty of explaining where Meitnerium had been sleeping and that she had been treated as an earthling with a "skin condition" (it helped when Meitnerium likened this disease to the Epidermic Pox that one got after sleeping with a Transylvanian) while Jerri, who took some offense to being referred to as the "little one on the right" , did her best to explain why it was that Tom and his family had been keeping her existance a secret. Vortia did not quite understand, granted she was a little biased, but took it upon herself to fill in her own blanks.

Twisting a lock of ruby red hair around one of her long green fingers, Vortia took a deep inhalation of the barely breathable air before beginning. She explained that it was, of course, her who had crashed the strange vehicle in the midst of that camping site ("trust me, it was my Dad's. I wouldn't be caught dead in that thing if I wasn't looking for my bestie!"). This fact was relayed slowly for the coherently-challenged earth-walkers who sat before her with half-slitted gazes of what must have been utter shock, as her disguise had been just so perfect. She went on to explain the silver orbs clipped to the tips of her antennae which, now unclipped for earthling observation, created her disguise using programmed light displacement. Once freed from their metal prison, the bulbs on her stalks were revealed to be very bulbous and quite different from Meiterium's itty-bitty dibbits.

"Why don't you have any of those?" Jerri asked, having grown long accustomed to her mysterious duffle-bag of alien goodies stashed in her room, "You've got spray on clothes, but no light displacer what'chamacallits?"

"Faith no, those things hurt like a bitch!" the sensitive and swollen alien winced at the mere thought of getting her perfectly petite buds pierced, "They've gotta drive a needle through them to get the magnets in!"


"Oh, so its like getting your ears pierced?" Tom asked rationally, breaking away from the conversation at hand in hopes of understanding a bit more about alien technology (truly his father's son) "Do a lot of girls have those on your planet?"

"Only rough tricks like Erbium here!" Meitty joked as she hefted her fat body over to her skinny green friend and draped her immense weight over the seated girl's shoulders, "Always jealous of my awesome buds, so she's gotta make hers all flashy."


"Don't call me that!" Vortia whimpered, turning a darker shade of green as Meitnerium placed a big fat friendly kiss on her cheek, "You're embarassing me in front of the Earthlings!"

"Erbium?" Jerri parroted, "Sounds like that kid who used to get beat up in high school, remember him Thomas?"

"Oh Irv? Yeah, huge nerd." Tom agreed, "Nice guy though."

"Yeah, similar situation on our planet too." Meitty jeered as she looked up at Tom, still attached to her friend by the shoulder, "That's why poor little Erby-derby here goes by Vortia."

"I can see why when people call you Erby Derby." Jerri agreed

"Knock it off Meitty!" Vortia squirmed underneath the addressed alien's incredibly oversized upper half to no avail. "Faith, you're heavy! You look like a Saxxonian dipped in Guacamole!" (yes it's from space, you really shouldn't be all that surprised. And here, its read "Gwa-cah-mole")

"Mmmmm... I could really go for some guacamole right now, actually." Meitnerium purred as she relinquished her skinny-minny friend from her titanic girth in leiu of searching the kitchen cabinets for some of the aforementioned topping. Vortia looked onward at her friend, in horror, as she found a bottle of the stuff and wrapped her lips around the neck of the small plastic container and guzzled it down like it was... was... edible!

"Meitty, what have these poor country bumpkins convinced you into doing?!" Vortia gasped as her longtime friend halfed the bottle, "That's for your hair, you know that!" she grabbed the bottle from her friend and turned towards the two lesser life forms in the room (still a little entranced by seeing Meitnerium eagerly gulp down the thick green paste) "Is this what you do to visiting explorers, huh?! You tie them up with your centiropes and brainboggle them into drinking shampoo? You're both sick!" here Vortia grabbed Meitnerium's chubby hand and started tugging towards the exit portal, "Come on Meitty, let's get you back home and squeeze all that stuff out of you..."

"Oh, that's not all that's inside me." Meitnerium giggled as if she had a secret, unmoving despite being pulled on by the much lighter girl, "Chili and rice, meatballs and iced cream, hot dogs, hamburgers, ughh..." she let out a small moan as her free hand began traversing the plump green apron that was her overhanging stomach, "pixxa and france fries, soda pop and twonkies-- oh frickin' faith, Vortia you've gotta have a twonkie!"

"What in Faith are you talking about?" Vortia asked as she observed the strange behavior of her once sane friend, "Look, we've gotta get you back to Mr. Perioda, and I really don't want to know all of what's been put inside you since you've been stranded here on this little blue rock. And since I'm going to assume that a "twonkie" is Earthican slang for whatever's in the monkey-man's trousers, I'm even less inclined to be interested."

"No, Vortia, a Twonkie is food!" Meitnerium corrected her friend excitedly, "Faith Tom, Jerri, was I this deprived when I landed here?"

"More or less." Tom agreed with a smile

"I wouldn't know since someone decided to keep you a sexy little secret." Jerri purred with a chuckle

"Food?" Vortia parroted stupidly, "Like... pills?"

"No, dummie, just food." Meitnerium said with a raunchy little giggle of her own

"F-oo-d." Tom sounded out, his turn to be condescending

"What is this... food?" Vortia asked, her interest piqued in this alien custom...

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
Vortia stared at the yellow sponge like thing in front of her. Was she really expected to put that in her mouth? Meitty's pudgy hand and beaming gaze didn't waiver as she brought the expertly cradled twonkie even closer to her gal-pal. Willing to try anything once, even this very strange food concept, Vortia plucked the gross looking (it looked like a baby grub Alternian!) yellow sticky thing from her friends hand. Three sets of eyes intently watched Vortia as she brought the snack to her red lips...she opened her mouth slowly, and then took the tiniest bite.

Whoa!...What was happening in her mouth?...this...Sensation! Everyone watched as Vortias eyes widened, her first reaction to human food. Her mind was going haywire trying to process this food, it was almost like smelling something...except it was physically there...She gnashed the white sticky substance in her mouth letting her tongue bathe in the mixture, letting her tongue soak up every sugar molecule and chemical inside of this delicious object. Vortia went to speak trying to ask what was going on, but realized she had to swallow first to make room. In an instant the substance was gone leaving just a faint memory of sweetness dissolving on her tongue. Tom and Jerri watched as the stalks on Vortia's head began to rise slowly before standing tall and erect, her bulbs pulsing and throbbing in apparent delight.

"Meitty...What?...What was that? That was amazing!" Exclaimed Vortia sounding winded.

"I know right? Go on finish it." Meitty offered. "We can all kinda tell how much you’re enjoying it right now." She said smirking and pointing to the twin antenna towers. Vortia didn't seem to care as she began to finish the twonkie without another word. While Vortia was wrapped in pleasure, Meitty decided to explained her own grasp on humans and their food.

"And this is just one type of food. Here on Earth basically each of these foods tastes different. That's what your tongue is doing right now by the way it's tasting...Well each food tastes so completely different than any of the others." Said Meitty wide eyed and em(phat)ic.

"Shut. Up. No way!" said Vortia slurping up the last remnants of the twonkie from each of her fingers.

"It's true! Here, have another." said Meitty handing Vortia another and feeling like she was already catching up on all the lost time she'd missed. "Vortia there's cold foods, hot foods, sauces, sweets, chocolate!" Here Meitnerium gave herself a hug and cooed in excitement! "You're just gonna love trying them all!"

Tom and Jerri both shared a sideways glance at this remark, their faces deviously smiling, both looking just as excited to see Vortia enjoying another twonkie as Vortia herself. Three sets of hands were about to reach for another box of twonkies when...

"Hey look!" said Vortia suddenly pointing at Tom's TV. set. "That's my car!"

Tom saw that once again the oddly designed car was being featured on the news, and once again a deep sinking feeling began to enter his stomach. This time the hispanic reporter stood before a small group of people, including one sporting a pair of sunglasses and a MACK trucker’s hat.

"We're still live here covering what appears to be...some sort of viral advertising. Some here are calling it an Alien spacecraft, while others believe it to simply be a tricked out ride. One local Texan a self professed Xenophobe, Roboophobe, and...Psuedophobe. Is that even a word? Anyways he drove all the way from Arlen as soon as he saw this report, and is with me now. Tell us mister..."

"Rusty. Shackleford." Said the scrawny cigarette of a man, “And while I have no prior knowledge to the invading Martian people of the year 2972, I would very much like to welcome them with—“ here the man grabbed the microphone from the newscaster, his tone changing almost immediately to one of hostility towards the invading “Martians”, “Now you people listen and you listen good, I know you’re here to harvest our atmosphere to drop your planets temperatures and breed with our women. But I’m taking a stand! We fought you once in 1972 when Neil Armstrong actually landed on the moon, and you signed a treaty to—“

"Well that's very... interesting Mr. Shackleford. But whatever the case is, we're sure the police will have some questions for the vehicles owner for sure." Said the reporter as he wrestled the mike back from the scrawny individual.

The reporters voice faded from Tom's attention has he slowly began to panic. He'd forgotten that Vortia's landing here on Earth had been has secretive as Meitty's. He didn't doubt it wouldn't take long for the police to show up, and then the government, and then he'd have the FBI knocking on his front door asking questions. That was another nightmare scenario he had forgotten about since Meitty had blended it so well (for the most part.) He lmost preferred to deal with whatever Meitty's race would do with him, rather than deal with the cold and caustic F.B.I. Looking to Jerri, Tom saw she shared his sense of worry and dread but surprisingly it was Meitty of all people who spoke up first.

"Vortia, we've got to pick up your car, like, now!" she said getting up from the table as fast as her wide body would let her.

"What's the hurry M? I'll just go move it later after we finish this box..." said Vortia, getting up from the table and away from this new found love called food on the bottom of her to do list.

"You don't understand...The people here...Earthlings I mean, they don't really know about other planets. In fact, there kind of afraid of any outside life." said Jerri sounding on the verge of panic.

Vortia stared at Jeri in disbelief. Were there really still planets unaware of ANY outside life? She turned her surprised eyes to Meitty. Meitty gave a shrug of her miniature ham like shoulders and shook her head dismissively. "Listen, I don't get it either but from what I can tell if we get caught it's super serious business. Faith, they should be giving me a medal for like, discovering their planet and all, but noooo, it's a planet full of xenophobes. At least I was found by a family that was cool with the whole "girl from outer space thing." I mean wait till you see what they think some of us look and act like in their movies, it's crazy! Always wanting to take over their planet like it's sooo great and-"

"You can tell her later Meitty. Listen Vorita it just works out a lot better for everyone if we go get it now." Tom said trying to stay calm but sweat starting to form beneath his curly hair already.

"Fine, fine..." bemoaned Vortia getting up, "It's not even that far from here, but let's go pick it up so I don't scare all the hicks on this planet."

True to her words Vortia's car was indeed close by. It had fortunately landed in a vast nature park, hidden amongst the trees and out of the view of most of the town's population. And so after piling into Tom's car (not without a few scathing judgments from Vortia) they arrived on the outskirts of the crash site.

As for Vortia's car...

“Soooooo…” Jerri whistled as she stood next to Tom, already out of the car with a look of terrible disbelief evident on his face, “This is… bad?”

“Like you wouldn’t believe.”

True to the word of the broadcaster, as well as Vortia herself, the spacecraft had indeed crashed in the midst of a camping sight. All equipment had since been moved by man or by the vehicle, as there was a large crater than grew deeper as Vortia’s car (sorry, her father’s car) went further and further into the ground. As had been expected by the ever-pessimistic Tom Parker, there were cops everywhere. Blue suits with authoritative looks and sunglasses surrounded the vehicle, as well as some shady looking men in black suits, whose sunglasses were infinitely more terrifying and reflective. The earth man was terrified, barely able to process the simplest of thoughts that weren’t related to not relieving himself right then and there.

“Tom, what do we do?” Jerri asked, now worried as she shook her friend’s arm, “They’ve got it! There’s no way we can get Vortia’s car away from the police and… and whoever those guys are! Tom, what are we gonna do?!”

“I don’t…” Tom caught his tone, reducing it to a whisper lest one of the badged officers be brought over to the so far unnoticed quartet, “God, I don’t know Jer!” his voice came out low and raspy, “But we’ve got to do something!”

“Hey, everything alright out there?” came a voice from inside the car as the gallant vehicle began teetering over to the rear passenger’s door. A green ball was visible first as two equally verdant hands latched onto the available sides of the vehicle. With a mighty grunt from both the passenger and gallant (though primitive) vehicle, Meitty hoisted herself up uneasily and tottered over to her friends, “Can’t really see from… woah, headrush… got up too fast… Oh, hey is that the—“

“Yes.” Tom answered quickly

Meitty whistled, much like Jerri had before her, “So, that means—“

“Yep.” Jerri quipped

“Lovely.” Meitty sighed, “We’re screwed. And not in the fun way.”

The three of them stood there silently for a while, looking over the hill as the strange men and police officers took shifts keeping the crowds away and attempting to find a way inside the seemingly “normal” vehicle. Between them, the sense of dread was mutual and overwhelming. Sure enough, they would trace whatever signal Vortia had used to track down Meitty too. Soon the two of them would be sent off to some placid white room to be tested and cut open like pumpkins, while Tom and Jerri be taken in for questioning and charged with harboring extraterrestrial fugitives! It was only a matter of time before their lives were ruined. All of them…

“What the Faith is everyone looking at?” came another voice from behind them, one insensitive to their collective plight acting as an impartial onlooker, “And what are those apes doing to my Dad’s car?!” suddenly passionate, Vortia stepped up ahead of the three to get a better look at her injustice, “I swear to Faith, if they put a scratch on it—well, any more scratches on it—I’m gonna stick my boots so far up their x’hals they’ll kerbitz!”

Tom watched as Vortia fumed, stomping up and about the hilltop in her anger, when the sight of two metal balls caught his attention. Dangling from her hip, the Light Displacement Spheres were attached onto the belt-loop of her jeans!

“Don’t kerbitz yet!” Tom said with a renewed sense of hope, “Vortia, do you think you can still use those Displacer things?”

“Uhh, yeah.” Vortia answered, still a little huffy but more surprised that the monkey-man could pronounce such advanced language, “Like, why?”

“Can you put on a disguise?”

“Oooh, I get it—flirt with them a little! Maybe show some cleavage, get my car back! Just like junior prom!”

“No!” Tom corrected angrily, “Can you, I don’t know, become one of those guys down there?”

“Yeah, I just scan ‘em with my phone and—“

“Good, do that!”

“Tom, what are you getting at?” Jerri asked, a little confused by his plan

“Vortia goes down there as a cop, gets in the car; we’ll hide behind the hill when she swings by and picks us up!” Tom explained vigorously, “You’ve got a cloaking device, right? Some kind of security system like when you’re driving through a rough neighborhood?”

Vortia scoffed...

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
“The Bumpkin catches on pretty quick! I'm impressed!” said Vortia unshackling the pinball like objects from under her belt. “Dad doesn’t even know that I had a stealth generator snuck onto his ride.” “My, my impersonating an official and stealthily sneaking a car out, I hope you Earthlings aren’t getting the impression Meitty and I are a pair of trouble makers.” said Vortia giving a mischievous laugh, the sort of laugh troublemakers give right before they are about to in fact make trouble.

“Oh I know Erby-Derby, I hope I haven’t been rubbing off on them.” Agreed Meitty draping an arm around both of her Earthling associates, both slightly buckling under the sudden weight.

“No it’s just …you know, Light Displacement and all that…” said Tom suddenly feeling a bit embarrassed not just from the amours antagonizing, but also for once again displaying his geek sci-fi repertoire.

Her long fat antennae nubs re-pierced and slightly bowing under the weight of the Light Displacement Spheres, Vortia now reached into a pocket and pulled out a slim, very much Earth Smartphone looking devise.

Meitty seemed surprised by the device and hurried over to Vortia’s side. “Faith! Is that New GnusMas Universe S3 phone?”

“You know it.” said Vortia a cool smile at her lips. “I’ll show it off later, right now just stand back and let me work.” Aiming her genius-phone’s camera at the officer farther away than from the rest of the group and tasked with keeping back any onlookers, Vortia pressed the red button on the bottom of her phones screen. A green bar overlapped the man’s image, tracing over his overall outline. Suddenly a short “Ping” was heard from the device. Vortia gave small nod glad things we’re going well so far.

Tom and Jerri watched as the silver orbs began to glow and a rainbow of lights began to emanate from them. The lights began to swirl, overlapping Vortia’s body in a technicolor blur. Soon colors began to splotch and stick onto Vortia’s frame like an incomplete jigsaw puzzle. Here a blue eye, there a patch of Caucasian white skin, and now the unmistakable threads of a police officer uniform seemed to be weaving themselves together right in front of the group. A minute or so later of this spectrum spanning spectacle and rather than Vortia, a short and stumpy looking Policeman was now standing and smiling where she had been.

“Hey, how’d it work?” asked Vortia in a much huskier and manlier voice.

Once again the only member not to be left in a state of awe at the technological feat that had just taken place, Meitty spoke up first. “Perfect. Just like an Earthling.”

“Okay then, I’ll give them the old H.Q. routine then.” said Vortia voice still disguised from underneath the hologram, “Wish me luck!” and without a word in edgewise from Tom or Jerri she sauntered down the hill. Tom gawked as Vortia awkwardly tried to copy the officer’s walk; hands placed haphazardly on her sides, elbows outwards, and a long straggling gate, Tom’s brain told him just one thing: They Were Fucked.

At the bottom of the hill standing closest to the guarded car, Deputy Jones sighed to himself. He really didn’t want to be here today, days like this were meant to be enjoyed with his family, not standing in a rodent infested woods standing around some sort of tricked out car. Sure, it beat the more violent days on the force, but at least those days required his full attention, today he was outside where the day’s beauty seemed to be rubbed in his face, standing about dumbly like a bouncer at a club. Jones’ sleepy mind was shook a bit as he watched Lutienent Dan oddly stumble down the hill.

“Hey Dan, y’all right? I thought you were gonna fall there for a sec.” asked Jones taking a step away from the car.

Seeing that no one else was in the man’s immediate line of sight, Vortia decided that this human was in fact talking to her. “Oh, yeah, this hills tricky.” said lieutenant Dan XXX Vortia gruffly. Having been in this situation a few times before, she knew that the less she said the better.

“I thought you were supposed to be on “crowd management duty.” said Dept. Jones to his superior.

“Yeah... Officer Prime just called in and says we’re done here.” Not realizing that terms for higher ranking officials didn’t translate across all life forms.

“Who?” Asked Jones, eyebrows raised in confusion. Dan had always been mumbeler, that, his damn mustache, plus his old age, had forced all the men on his squad to have to really listen whenever the lieutenant had given instruction.

“Headquarters” Said Vortia quickly and vaguely before too much suspicion could arise “Take a look.” And without a second thought she reached into a pocket and displayed her car keys. The neon green sparkling device rigidly jutted towards the sky, it hooked and bent a little near the tip exactly the way a regular car key didn’t. Realizing her mistake all too late Vortia went to put the key back into her pocket when…

“Let me see that.” said Dept. Jones, taking the outstretched key before Vortia could pull it away. He eyed the key suspiciously, frowning and turning it over a few times in his hand. Vortia stood paralyzed. The “show the key as proof” trick may have worked all the times before, but she had forgotten that here on Earth, people here had never seen a key like this! Now she’d signed her own autopsy papers…

“Damn foreign cars! All that shit, just looks so stupid. I knew it wasn’t a flying saucer. I mean if it looks like a car it’s probably a-“

“Right. Well…I’ll go impound this.” said Vortia snatching the key back.

“Oh. Yeah.” said Jones, a little disappointed his rant had been cut short. Glad to have something other to do then guard a car, Jones went to join the other officers keeping any onlookers at bay.

Vortia walked and opened the car door, quickly slid inside, quickly shutting the door behind herself. She breathed a huge sigh of relief finally feeling safe inside her familiar ride. Now it was time to get out of here! Pushing the start button with the tip of her key, Vortia heard the welcoming sound of her car booting to life. Outside of the vehicle, the car engine started with a sound unlike any onlooker had heard before, the engine sounded much quieter, then a low eerie hum like the sound of a finger rubbing the outside of a glass of water. A few officers turned around as the car started to life, some a bit frightened by its sudden start. Vortia started the car slowly and carefully pulling the car back over the same steep hill she had sauntered down.

“Damn!” said Deputy Jones, the car may have looked god awful on the outside but it sure had one hell of an engine to make it back over the hill. “All right shows over people-“

***


Tom, Jerri and Meitty had been holding there breath as Vortia worked her magic. The plan looked like it had worked; Vortia had gotten control of the car. The relief was only momentary as the three realized she was not heading for the road but instead up the hill and straight for them! Getting out of the way as fast as they could they could, Vortia expertly stopped the SUV with only a minor bit of distance between the three.

“Get in!” shouted Vortia still in disguise, and popping all three doors at once. The three scrambled in, hearts and other alien organs all pounding.

“Vortia Why did you-“ began Tom.

“Relax! I got this!” assured Vortia. With a flick of a wrist and a button press another slow hum joined the sound of the engine as a change began to overtake the vehicle.

“I-It’s disappearing!” said Jerri breathlessly looking about the car. Tom looked upwards at where a “true” moon roof had been seconds ago. Now there was nothing…only the sky above them. In a matter of seconds the alien vehicle had disappeared all together before he’d even had a good look at it, leaving the quartet looking like they were floating in midair above a leaf strewn ground.

“So…we’re invisible?” asked Tom reaching for where a car door had been moments ago, he could feel that it was still there, but was still unable to see it.

“Yeah we’re good.” said Vortia slowly stepping on the accelerator. “We can see out but they can’t see in. Cool huh?”

Tom had to take her word for it. It may have been cool, but it still felt awful weird though. As she slowly reached the outskirts of the park were Tom had parked his own car; Tom once more held his breath. One lone cop car now loomed on the other side of the park exit, the officer inside probably tasked with guarding the area. Tom’s worrying mind looked for something for his hand to grip on, his stomach began to ache, and his eardrums began to pound, every ounce of his body on edge hoping that they'd be able to get Vortia's SUV out of here without attracting this last cop cars attention. “What if they had a radar gun? What about the tire tracks? What if it was FBI? Didn’t they have ways of discovering cloaked planes? Did that work for cars? What if a car tries to pass into our lane?” Tom’s mind worked a mile a minute waiting for the answer; Would they be able to escape this last car?

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
His heart pounding, and his breath held for what felt like the hundredth time today, Tom felt the car rock forward as Vortia pulled onto the main street.

"Meitty! I thought you said you were the first non-Earthling here." said Vortia deactivating her disguise and a bit of a whine in her voice. She had already pulled out onto the main road with absolutely no hesitation, and more importantly without disrupting the officer’s car.

"I am! I mean- at least I think I am. On TV here they've interview these crazy hick farmers who're always complaining that their cows are missing or that-" ranted Meitty.

"No, I'm talking about these other cars. Look! That one is a Saturn. And that one says Mercury!" said Vortia now relaxed enough to have a single hand on the steering wheel.

"Listen...we all have a lot to catch up on.” said Tom still taking short breaths as he attempted to recover from his several panic attacks. “Let’s just get home first and we’ll discuss-“

There was a mechanical *Chinging* noise, and both Tom and Jerri gasped what little air was in their lungs as the two chairs in front of them swiveled around, two green smiling faces now facing them, and not the road.

“Meit- Vortia! He-Ja-THE ROAD!” Tom gawked pointing a finger.

“Would you relax Monkey boy? I got it on auto pilot. It’s heading right for Meitty’s beacon.” said Vortia pointing behind herself with a single thumb. The words “autopilot engaged” shown red on the steering wheels imbedded screen.

“Hey, he’s right to be on edge Vortia.” Meitty said firmly. “If you knew what it’s like on this planet, how little humans know about the- the outside, you’d understand why getting caught is such a big deal.” Here Meitty’s stern face relaxed. “But it’s not like they could ever catch us with technology like this!” Meitty gloated pointing around the car’s interior.

“Oh Yeah!” Said Vortia getting a high five from her green gal pal. Her eyes blinked a bit as if she'd just remembered something...“Hey, if it’s such a big deal, let’s just leave the cloak on and go home!”

“I …thought we were?” asked Tom puzzled, but only momentarily. “…Oh No…Wait you don’t mean…”

“Our home.” Said Vortia finishing his sentence with a smile.

“Ooh Vortia that’s a great idea!” squealed Meitty. “We’ll hyper jump over there and then come back later when it’s safe! Tom you can meet my family. Oh I’ll get to see my family…”

“All right it’s settled.” Said Vortia her chair swiveling back to face the array of buttons and knobs that was her cars dashboard. “Set course for the Metalement Galaxy!” Her hands began to twitch and turn dials before pressing one large shiny red one.

“No!"

"What? We can’t!"

"Not right now!” Gabbled and babbled Tom and Jerri in a panic.

A low rumbling sound erupted from what felt like just underneath Tom. “Oh shit!” He shouted, not exactly ready to be the first Earthling to leave the galaxy. “Oh fuck, fuck fuck!” The rumbling grew louder and louder, soon the car was shaking from the vibrations. He looked about the invisible car and saw Meitty beaming at him, looking as if nothing were at all wrong, and then he noticed Jerri had fainted, slumped over and apparently leaning against an unseen car door. The rumbling now reached what had to be its peak, his eyes shook in his very head. He clenched them shut unable to concentrate on the blenderized mess the world had become. Suddenly… *Bang*

The rumbling had immediately stopped, at the sound of a car backfiring. Tom ventured to open a single eye, expecting to be gazing at a universe of lonely stars out his window. Instead, the view outside was a familiar one for any Texan: Sun, trees, dirt, and road.

“What…What happened?” he asked still feeling as if he were going to puke at any moment.

“Good question…” garbled Vortia sounding none too pleased. She pushed a few buttons again and then tried the shiny red one again. Now there was no rumbling at all.
Meitty frowned at the lack of action. “Don’t tell me…”

“Yep, it’s the ISD. Oh, I’m going to get it from my dad." Vortia grumbled. "I told you to watch for the ionosphere shield disruptor honey...." she said in a lower adult sounding tone. “ ‘I guess you’re not responsible enough to be driving on your own.’ Then he'll probably use this as a chance to take away my card.”

Tom, now busy with bringing Jerri to, spoke up. “Look let’s just go back to my place…Please!” said Tom feeling exhausted.

“Fine, I guess you can give me a jump when we get there.” griped Vortia as she pushed a few buttons.

Jerri’s eyes fluttered open and she suddenly sat up with a start. She quickly glanced out the window “Tom! What just happened? Are we?” she asked, her face still a sickly white.

“No, we’re not...” said Tom as a wave of relief washed over the both of them.

In a matter of minutes the autopilot was re-engaged and expertly steering the still invisible car back to Tom’s house.

“Wow Meitty, I didn’t know Earthlings could change colors!” Marveled Vortia, gazing at her two pale faced backseat passengers.

“Oh, I know. Cool right? Usually Tom turns red, but that’s only when we’re-” Meitty’s voice faded from Tom’s consciousness as he closed his eyes, his brain deciding to take just a short nap…

***

“Tom… we’re here.” Whispered Jerri’s voice in what felt to Tom a few seconds later. Tom opened his eyes and suddenly gave Jerri a short peck on the cheek.

“What was that for?” Asked Jerri blushing and rubbing her cheek.

“I don’t know…for all that we just went through?” Tom said unsure himself.

"Aww that's sweet you two." said Vorita seat again already reversed to face them. "But does someone want to tell my where you keep the dilithium crystal jumper cables before this turns into a smooch fest?"

"Umm, they don't exactly have those here..." said Meitty."Earth hasn't gotten the whole "Faster Than Light" thing down yet."

"You're kidding!" shouted the red head putting her hands to her head in disgust. "How the Kerbitz do-"

"I'd actually just like to talk to my parents if we could. Let them know you found me at least" said Meitty a hint of exhaustion creeping into her voice now too.

"Oh!" shouted Vortia, "Oh of course Meitty. I totally forgot babe, give me a sec. The cars got enough juice to last a while, but we won't be getting it off the planet till I can get a jump. We still have plenty of power send a signal. Tom watched from the backseat as Vortia pressed one of the hundreds of buttons on the dashboard, this one labeled *Near-a-star.

"Near-a-star, how may we help you?" Asked an omnipresent voice coming from the car's stereo.

"Connect me to Perioda family please, Metalement Galaxy." Commanded Vortia.

"Right away" came a robotic voice, which unlike call center personnel was actually a robot that was actually dead inside not a human that just felt like he was dead inside.

"Oh this must be like Onstar!" said Tom noting another of the numerous similarities between his and Meitty's cultures.

"Onstar?" asked Vortia "Who could possible operate On a star? ...Backwards Bumpkins."

"Hello...Vorita?" Came the deep voice of what Tom assumed to be Mr.Perodia.

"Guess who I fooooound?" Vorita practically sang.

"...Dad?" came Meitty's voice as soft as a whisper and then a shout "Dad! It's me!"

"Faith! Meitty it's you!" said the voice on the other side now breaking a bit in a state of emotion. "Faith above! Let me get your mother...." there was a momentary pause and then...

"Meitty?" came another voice over the speakers this one sounding a lot like Meitranium's own, except a little more older.

"MOM!" shouted Meitty her eyes welling up with whatever was the alien equivalent of tears.

"Oh Meitty! Don't worry we're coming!" shouted the voice excitedly and equally cracking with emotion.

"Vortia we have a lock on your location! Don't go anywhere!" Came the gruff voice again. "Don't worry sweetie, daddies coming!"

"Right! See you guys after the hyperspace jump." Vortia flipped a knob and a bleep was heard on the other side of the stereo. "Well..." sighed Vortia feeling as if her work was done for the day. "Now all we have to do is wait...You gonna be okay Meitty?" she said noticing the green girls...green tears.

"Yeah..." Meitty said after a moment and a sniff, "I just....really miss them."

"Hey...Don't worry..." Came Jerri's consoling voice placing a comforting hand on the tear shedders shoulder. "They're on their way right?"

"Yeah..." she agreed wiping away a tear with a chubby finger.

"And we here until they get here." said Tom joining Jerri's hand. "Uhh- How long do you think it will it be till they get here?" Tom asked turning to Vortia.

"A few seconds." she answered plainly, more interested in the well being of her friend and getting out of the car. Tom and Jerri both looked confused, and it was Meitty who once again spoke up to explain the differences across cultures.

"Vortia, no FTL travel yet..."

Vortia smacked her head with a green open palm hand. "Bumpkins! Okay, you two, you understand how time is relative and all that, you understand that much?"

"Kay..." answered both Tom and Jerri slowly sharing a basic grasp on the technical idea.

"So a few seconds for Meitty's family going at Warp speed would be...um...What does that equal in Earth time Meitty?" asked Vortia

Meitty did some number crunching (her least favorite type of crunching) as she was the only one familiar with both space time and Earth units of time before answering.

"Well, dad insists on driving that "vintage ride" of his, more like "junker" model if you ask me...Anyways, it only has Warp 1 drive rather than all the new models with Warp 2 and even 3, not a big difference if your going from one side of one galaxy to the other, but across the universe...That's a bit farther distance to cover...So that means it would take about..".
