"Three Earth months... I think?" Meitnerium said, unsure of her math skills. While she was no science major back in Steez (it was an Arts college, after all) any mathematical abilities she had retained that would have allowed her to crunch the vast amount of numbers required to jump from one corner of the universe to the next had surely gone rusty after her extended period of time on a primitive planet such as Earth.

At this point she was more asking herself than answering Vortia, whose dainty emerald-cut chin fell in shock with a furrowing of her heavy burgundy eyebrows.

"B-But I could be wrong!" Meitty was quick to smile, her chubby cheeks dimpling as she giggled nervously, "We all know how good I am at math, right Erby?"

"Don't you Erby me!" Vortia shot back distastefully as her head sunk into the steering wheel, "Three Earth months?! That's freakin' insane—please tell me that Earth is one of those planets that have, like, thirty day years?” Vortia begged of the two native earthlings in the back seat, “Faith, I’m gonna miss so much! My Dad’s never gonna let me drive his car again, I’m gonna miss Francium’s killer party—youknow how epic her parties are every time her bee-eff gets out of prison! This is total kerbitz! Lemme get out my phone and add this shit up!”

As the newly marooned member of the Metalean species reached into the front pocket of her jeans Tom, Jerri, and Meitnerium were all left to themselves, as Vortia was hardly in the mood for any discussion whilst trying to convert the difference in planetary timespace. The two earthlings simply exchanged placid glances to one another, finding this the least enjoyable (and understandable) part of their epic excursion with Meitnerium, who could barely contain herself from wearing a grin almost as big as her appetite.

“You hear that guys?” she asked excitedly to the tension-sickened humans in the back seat, “I’m going home!”

“Yeah, that’s great Meitty…” Jerri groaned, clutching at her aching head

“Super tops…” Tom concurred as his breathing hastened, “Can we just go inside?”

“Oh come on guys,” Meitnerium said with a smile as she whipped the seat around again to face her friends (rather than exert herself by attempting to twist her noncontortable bulk in the seat) “I’m going home, for real! This has got to be one of the happiest moments of my life and you two look about as green as I do—is there something you’re both not telling me?” her face fell to a frown

“It’s not that, really.” Jerri started in as best sympathy as she could manage, “We’re totally excited for you to be headin’ home— it’s just…”

“Earthlings aren’t built to handle the stress of getting chased by the cops and almost getting taken to another galaxy far far away.” Tom said with a heavy breath of fresh air, “I—er—we love you and all, Meitty, but it’s just been a… stressful day.”

“Very.” said Jerri

“You’re right, I forget you guys still don’t know that much about my planet and all our cool tech.” Meitnerium said with perceived modesty, “Warp speed’d probably flip you two of your gobbers! I’m sorry Tommy-Tom.”

With her apology, Meitnerium unbuckled her bulk from the seat; the black belt sliding across her fleshy green expanse quickly to allow her release from its confines. Her bottom half was bursting from every angle possible, namely from underneath the armrests, her gray sweats making Meitnerium’s prized bubble butt look like the blandest (but largest) balloon ever conceived. She outstretched her thick flabby arms, her wobbling green bingo wings shimmying as they adjusted to their new altitude

“For real guys, I mean it. Thank you so much for everything you’ve done for me.” She said kindly with wide eyes as she motioned for a group hug. The two obliged her, unbuckling their own seat belts and stumbling over to Meitnerium’s seat to wrap the big wad of guacamole in an even bigger hug, “I love you so much.” She said quietly (with a pinch of Tom’s tuckus.)

“FLIPPIN FAITH!” Vortia howled as her math yielded the same results as Meitnerium’s wildest of guesses, “Three months on this Faith-forsaken ball of saltwater! I’m gonna die!” she moaned as, once again, she fell into the steering wheel of her car.

“It’s not so bad… once you get used to it.” Meitnerium said with a smile, releasing her two friends from their embrace, “Besides, you’ll find out that life here isn’t so different than back home… it’s really weird.”

“Yeah, except the cars don’t fly, we can’t break the atmosphere, and oh yeah, everyone’s pink.”

“I’m more of a pale Caucasian myself.” Jerri corrected gently

“White as a sheet.” Tom added

“My point exactly.” Vortia said sadly, “Ohhhh… I’m gonna die before your pops even gets here…”

Meitnerium swiveled the chair back around to pat her friend on the shoulder, “There there, it’s gonna be fine. We’ll wait out here until my Dad gets out of warp speed- you can stay with the Parkers, on the couch maybe? Or, hey, if Jerri’s place is open—“

“My Dad won’t let me have a dog.” Jerri interjected, “I don’t think he’ll let me keep an alien college student. Even if it is only for a little while.”

“—w-well then we’ll keep you, Tom and me! You can room with me! Oh Faith it’ll be so much fun!” Meitnerium jabbered, her excitement at a piece of home making a stake in her bedroom very evident, “It’ll be just like when we were kids in my room back home!”
“Ugggggghhh!!” Vortia groaned, “Meitty, you’re such an airhead!”

“We could always stay up late, watch bad Earth movies and eat Twonkies…” Meitnerium sang as she got closer to her friend’s face at the steering wheel

Vortia’s wiggling antennae gave way to her own excitement, twitching at the mention of the delicious earthican ambrosia.

“M-Maybe it won’t be so bad…”

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
As the quartet exited the car, (now parked around the backside of Tom's house less a car accidentally crash into the re-cloaked vehicle) the two earthlings were still feeling rather green around the gills, while the other two, (who were actually green,) were now feeling rather perky about this new situation. Tom watched sluggishly, as Vorita reached into the car and pulled out a glowing white object from underneath the drivers seat, she slung the strapped object over her shoulder (very much like an earthling would a purse) and then without pushing a button somehow shut all of the doors on the vehicle. With Vortia's SUV secluded from the rest of the world, the four then headed into the house, Meitty still gushing away about the many various earthly delights.

"I can't wait for you to try foods Vortia. Yep, I can still remember one of the first I had. It was Louise's chili. It's still pretty high up there on my list of favorite's too! Tom, let's ask your mom if she can make some tonight." Meitty turned to face the curly haired boy just as he was entering the house (which was only after he had held the door open for the three girls to enter.)

"Sure." said Tom flatly putting it on the bottom of his to-do list tonight. He still had to introduce Vortia to... Tom froze in place, remembering something..."Wait, Oh no." He went to the kitchen and checked the calendar where sure enough a red line had been drawn through a number of the ubiquitous white boxes. Tom's mom and dad had just left on their yearly summer vacation, a trip to a small cabin timeshare. usually Tom would have accompanied them on this yearly trip but considering Meitty was still here it was decided that Tom was responsible enough to house sit while also keeping Meitty out of trouble company. That was why he'd been able to "join" Meitty for the night, without having to worry about sneaking out before the morning. They'd sure be surprised at what was waiting for them when they got back. He didn't think his mom would mind...too much, she understood the whole stuck alien thing, but she'd be worried more than anyone else. And dad...Dad would buy her a box of twonkies everyday for life if he could get beings the wheel of the inviso car just once. Tom smiled at that thought. Then there was another flash of pain in his temples as Tom rushed to his cellphone. He knew that if his parents had watched the news they would probably be freaking out right now...Scrolling through his texts, he saw only one had been sent by them no more than 15 minutes ago. Opening it read rather differently than he'd expected; "hey Tom mam & I r having fun time here hope your "having fun" 2. Love-Dad"

Tom thought that seemed like a normal text from dad, news of the car must not have been a big deal after the cops had pulled it away...He breathed a sigh of relief things seemed to be settling down a bit, bar a FBI agent showing up at his door, Tom felt like he could finally finally relax. Sure he still had to pick up his car tomorrow, but that wasn't a big deal, park goers did that all the time when they were camping....Yes this new green knot of a problem had been neatly tied into a bow and safety tucked away.

"Okay.." was all he said as slipped into the living rooms leather recliner. Meitty and Vortia followed suit, sharing the couch in front of the t.v. As he eased into the chair he could already feel himself on the edge of falling asleep once more.

"Um, I could stay and help, you know....If you want to take a nap or whatever..." said Jerri still standing looking both tired and worried.

"No, I'm okay Jer, just tired." he propped his head against his hand, his eyes turning to where Meitty and Vortia had plopped on the couch looking like two globs of Giacometti on a chip. If he did fall asleep who knew what sort of accidental mischief the two could cause while unsupervised. He looked back to Jerri. "You think, you could...spend the night?"

"Sure let me make a phone call." Jerri took out her cell and after a few button pushes..."Hey I'm at Tom's, we're goin' to a midnight showin'. I'll Be back by morning got a key so you can go ahead and lock up. Call me when ya get this. Okay love ya!" She clicked her phone shut. "All set. I left a message, good thing they sleep in on Saturday morning." She gave a wink towards Tom, and then turned her head to the two seated aliens "Now....I'm cooking supper tonight. What're you up for?"

Meitty looked to Vortia then to Tom looking ready to read off a shopping list of possible dishes when-

"Actually..." Tom's back groaned and the leather lay-z boy shifted as he reached into his back pocket, producing his wallet, which itself produced a neat set of twenty's. "Why don't we just order out? Dad gave me some money in case we wanted delivery, he didn't say it couldn't be all on the same night... We could get Pizza or Chinese...or both"

"You can't be serious.." said Jerri racing an eyebrow as she noticed the crooked smile worming its way across Tom's otherwise weary looking face. "You're really up for something like...THAT?"

"Sure I am! We can Give Vortia an awesome welcome to Earth party, with a little bit of everything. Sound good?"

"Yeah it does!" Meitty said emphatically the weighty task of picking her friends first meal lifted of her globular shoulder.

Vortia just shrugged "I'm not sure how anything else could top this the taste if townkies. What whit that creamy stuff inside.

"Oh I can think of a few..." said Meitty began voice dripping with innuendo.

"Okay!" Tom said suddenly reached for Jerri's cellphone. "Yeah, show time pizza? Could I get your special? Yes a large "It came from the Deep dish" extra cheese extra pepperoni. And your M E.T. lovers. Yes I know free Reece pieces bag." Tom then made a call to a local buffet China King, all the while knowing by the end of things he would be spent both financially and physically but it would so be worth it!

As Tom finished placing orders Vortia and Meitty picked up on their conversation.

"Vortia, I'm...sorry. I should have warned dad about the warp distance, everyone was just...emotional."

Vortia placed an arm on her old/now new again roomie. "Hey...it's going to be okay, I understand. There's really no point on calling someone else when your parents are all ready on the way." Vorita pulled out the silver object she had retrieved from her car..."Plus everyone is gonna be SO jealous when I start posting pics from a whole new planet? I'll be coolest girl in the galaxy!"

"You mean second coolest." said Meitty giving Vortia a hearty heavy shove. Meitty eyes suddenly widened as she realized what Vortia was holding. "Oh Vortia! Awsome!" Her greedy hands outstretched for the white object (which Tom had decided was indeed a purse) Meitty reached for the bag but Vorita pulled it away at the last moment.

Vortia dug trough her purse, and pulled out a long cylindrical object...Tom gasped, maybe he was wrong! This looked more like the barrel of a space gun! Vortia pressed a button on the bottom and suddenly a large Cherry red lump of lip stick ejected with a click. Vortia clicked it again, the red lump retracted and returned this time in the shade of purple, another click, and it turned green!

"You certainly brought more than what I got left with!" marveled Meitty. "Let's say we see how much I remember from Cosmetology classes? We could give Jerri a Metalean makeover!"

The two aliens began giggling as the turned towards Jerri. She smiled weakly before saying "Sure maybe later... Hey Meitty since I'm going to be spending the night, mind if I borrow some clothes? These ones are a little sweaty..."

"Sure!" said Meitty excitedly babbling a mile a minute. "I've got a closet full of free t-shirts and an old pair of sweat pants that might just fit you, in my room." As Jerri disappeared into the house, Tom heard an all too familiar sound...

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
As Tom finished tipping the last deliveryman who seemingly (and lets say for the sake of convenience) appeared just after the other one had left, he took in the sight behind him; two large pizzas sat on the dinner table a tiny bag of Reese's Pieces accompanying them, the long buffet table was living up to its name serving as the resting place for the parade of pints that was the groups large order of Chinese food, a box of cherry Pepsi and Mountain Dew cans had been brought in for easy access, the two green girls gabbing away on the couch, and finally Jerri, who had slipped out of her clothes wet with sweat from the day and into a gray t-shirt with the words THE BIGGEST WIENER in red hotdog letters. It was defintely Meitty's as the billowing shirt looked big enough to hold three Jerri's inside of it. Jerri's bottom half was having a similar problem, sure the drawstring on the sweat pants she was wearing helped keep the pants on, but without a belly or a badonkadonk to fill them out, the pants still looked gigantic on Jerri.

Tom brought the box in front of the two aliens, everyone in the room anxious to see Vortia's reaction to some REAL food. Tom opened the lid, a mist of steam evaporated from out of the box, a wonderful warm smell wafting up and filling the room.

"It's hot!" said Vortia picking up the oddly triangle shaped object. It certainly smelled exotic though! Unlike townkies which smelled...well like one plain sweet note, this...this was a complex orchestra! She raised the floppy triangle to her lips and then took her first delicious delicious bite.

It was perfect. Warm and bubbley, peppery, salty, cheesy,spicy, all were words Vortia wish she knew as without them she was unable to describe these tastes. She took another bite, a nice solid crunch. This-this food was like a whole new sensation! How could she...how could any Metalean live without having experienced this unreal feeling! "Mmmmpph!" Vortia moaned munched to the rooms delight. "And you said there's even more?" she asked incredulously.

"More than you could ever imagine!" said Meitty opening her chubby arms as wide as she could. Then having done enough waiting, helped herself to a slice as well no longer able to hold her hunger.

"There's sooo many different food and ways to make it!" said Meitty munching along.

"I--I don't know what to say..." said Vortia eyes wide and obviously awestricken.

"Then don't." said Meitty "Eat it while it's hot and enjoy it. Just make sure to say something nice afterwords like 'thank you."'

"Mmmm...Fantastic..." Vortia moaned again, chewing down all the way to the warm pizza's thick crust. Her antenna grew erect once more pulsing to an inaudible beat.

Wow Meitty heard Vortia say aloud...only Vortia's mouth was full of food. How? Antenna Talk! How could she have forgotten? Meitty hadn't been around a Metalean in forever that's how. Long ago the Metalean race had developed their characteristic antennae, it had provided their race with a way to communicate silently without attracting predators. Said antennae were now hardly used for conversations in the modern day. Being able to send thoughts was always exciting at first, but as a Metalean grew older usually just stopped finding speech much more enjoyable than transmitting thoughts, and so said transmissions were usually shutdown and left unused or "untuned" all together. Which isn't to say that antennae were useless, no, much of Metalean technology allowed for this wireless signal to operate and control objects. For example, unlike TV sets on Earth, a Metalean never encountered the annoying issue of a lost remote for the t.v., it was literally as easy as thinking of changing the channel. In short the modern view on Antennae talk was that it was good for a quiet conversation across a crowded room, but not too far as the signal was pretty weak, it was very god for tech, or for chores around the house. (The size,shape,and overall attractiveness of a Metalean's stalks was another rather complicated story best staved for a later chapter.)

Over the summer the trio had done some experimenting with the ability after Meitty had mentioned it. They had found that a signal did nothing for modern t.v.'s and could only blur the picture on an old 'bunny eared' TV set. Tom later found that he could pick up on some of Meitty thoughts on the highest setting of an AM radio but only if she really concentrated her thoughts; These included messages in Meitty's voice saying things like unsurprisingly " I'm hungry." or " The coast is clear now get in bed you sexy beast" (But those transmissions are again better saved for another chapter.)

Right now Jerri was also quite famished. She helped herself to a slice of the deep dish, using a napkin to cover any extra cheese under chin. She softly and slowly placed herself onto Tom's lap where he was enjoying some sweet and sour pork.

"Oohf! Might I say Jerri that your butt feels considerably less bony than I remember it?" said Tom in a stuffy British accent

"Shuf fup" she growled through a mouthful of pizza. Then after she had chewed and swallowed, and in a British accent of her own "Your felling quite BONEY yourself, for someone near exhaustion" Tom gave a short barking laugh, one that cracked from nervousness causing Jerri to smile approvingly.

They both eased into the leather lounger, warm food filling their insides, tiredness showing on each of their faces. The had almost been launched into space for three months earth time...-about three-wait that wasn't right either- Vortia had said her car had a warp two drive and from the way she was describing it the difference was like driving a big rig vs. a Porsche. It was a harrowing thought either way how close they'd almost been launched into space. Two or three weeks off of Earth without anyone knowing what happened to you...Tom could only imagine how Meitty must feel. Soon enough though her dad would be here and Tom had three long months to prepare for that long put off reunion. At least her dad would hopefully be wise enough to know to arrive at the planet with caution and avoid any other crash landings/parking jobs.

Vortia paused on her third slice of pizza, no more than fifteen or twenty of these earthling minutes into the feast when she noticed something odd about the two earthlings...

They were...

“Alright, so… can you still do the thing?” Vortia asked of her friend after her fourth slice of this “pizza” business, finding the strange triangularly shaped edible construct a bit more satisfying than the round fluffy things from earlier. “You know, the thing that… you know the thing!” Vortia giggled as she looked at Meitnerium expectantly, who sat on the other end of the couch taking large bites out of the last slice of pizza at a time.

“I don’t know…” Meitnerium said with a tauntingly unsure influx as one hand stroked her prized paunch delicately, “With how heavy I’m getting, they’ve gotten a lot heavier too.” Her hand moving from her stomach to touch the top of her fat left chesticle.

“Oh come on!” Vortia whined as she held up the harder, less saucy bit of her pizza slice that was neglected to be topped with the meat of their Earth pigs, “I’ll give you this thing this… bit of pizza here. This one.”

“You don’t like the crust?” Meitnerium guffawed, “I realize that we’re “aliens” and all but… come on! That’s like, the best part!”

Vortia crinkled her green nose (which was a bit longer and pointier than Meitnerium’s) at the piece of plain stick of baked dough in disgust, “I tried it, don’t really like it. It’s all bland and junk. Not when there’s all this—“ she said with a greedy snatch of Meitnerium’s remaining fraction of pizza, “—to enjoy!”

“Vortia, you littlerothghar!” Meitnerium said with a friendly jab at Vortia’s arm, “That was the last piece!”

“Hey, I’m a guest!” Vortia said with a greedy smile as she bit into her steal, “Besides, you’ve still gotta do the thing!”

Meitnerium sighed, though it was not one of genuine weariness. She was earnestly glad to have Vortia around, knowing that she would be spending her last three months on Earth with a friend was an enormous comfort to the expanding extraterrestrial. Her little puff of air was one of pure precociousness as she prepared to give into the unrelenting demands of the ever-mysterious “thing” that Vortia wanted her to do. For a price.

“Say what you want,” Meitnerium said as she repositioned her bulk away from the television set and towards Vortia, “but I like the crust. You’ve been saving yours?”

“The last three, yeah.” Vortia said dismissively as she leaned over to grab the Styrofoam plate (“Ha, we use this stuff for wiffle ball bats!” Vortia earlier surmised, “Who knew you could make tiny trays out of it?!”) “Why, you want ‘em?”

“Gimme your crusts and I’ll do the thing.” Meitnerium said with a sly grin dimpling her plump aguave cheeks

“Deal.” Vortia said as she handed over the plate to Meitnerium, “Now… do it!”

Meitnerium took a deep breath, causing her mighty chest to billow out even further before she released it. A long time had passed since she had even attempted to use most of her muscles, let alone these ones. In fact, the last time she could place was at Gallium Brown’s Barium-Faithsvah, where her unique “talent” garnered lots of attention from horny high school boys as well as their lecherous uncles and female relatives with butch haircuts. Back then they were pretty big, but it wasn’t much of a challenge to move them then…

"Okay...Look I lock the front door and keep it locked till you show up. I don't think either of them will be in much of a hurry to go outside anyways.... I mean, think about it. If the FBI had found us, they would have come after us as soon as possible right?"

"Well...Okay...said Jerri turning and reaching for her jingling car keys. Suddenly a small ruckus arose from beside them. "Hmm-What..." said Vorita slowly waking up. She looked shocked for few seconds quickly scanning about this foreign room. "Oh...right..." mumbled the redhead recalling her new surroundings.

"Uh. Hey. said Tom for lack of any better words.

"Hi." said Vortia remembering this life-form and the shorter one beside him. "You two leaving?" she asked, as she tried to get up and out of the recliner, (a strangely difficult task she frustratingly found.)

"Shopping!" said the Alien antenna and attitude perking upright at the word.

"What are gross-eries? That doesn't sound to fun... But if it's shopping...Can I come? Please! Please! Please!" said the green girl now out of the chair and brushing herself off. An earnest pleading look already crossing her face.

Jerri looked to Tom for assistance, but he simply shrugged. "She's going to be here for three months. We can't exactly keep her locked inside forever..."

Jerri could feel her argument swaying a bit, but still held her ground. "But it's so soon! and You don't even have a disguise! The officers getup would look out of place shopping at the store with me."

"Oh that's no problem. Look!" and in an instant Vortia had reached for her bag of holding. Reaching for her phone she aimed it at Jerri who, having just awoke, was a little slow to react at what was going to happen next.

"No! Wait!" said Tom and Jerri unanimously as the photo was snapped. Too Late! Soon a kaleidoscope of colors again began to whirl about the alien. A splotch of colors began to stick here and there, and soon the process was over. There now standing in his room were two identical looking Jerri's.

"Ooops just a second." said the cloaked Vortia. She fiddled with her phone a bit more and... Slowly the Jerri on the left grew! Inching upward bit by bit till the projected Jerri now was at the same height as Vortia "was." More button presses and a pair of mounds were soon straining the front of the Jerri #2's shirt. "There!" she said in job-well-done tone. "Why hello, younger twin Earthling sister Jerri!" said the taller clone, now looking down at her original version. Tom looked from one to the other they were almost imperceptible in any differences, well except for the pissed off look on the one's face. "I know what your thinking, and I'm flattered but it's a hell no!"

"What?!" asked Tom blushing, but not exactly shocked that Jerri had been able to read his mind.

"This is too freaky." Said Jerri looking up and down at the light manipulated version of herself.

"Just tell me I can go with you please! I want to see what Earth is like!" said the taller version of Jerri two, making the puppeteer version of Jerri bend into an uncharacteristically pleading stance.

"Fine. Fine." said Jerri mentally figuring if Vortia was going to leave the house one way or another, it might as well be under her supervision. "But it's going to be under my rules and you're going to do exactly as I say so you're not...exposed. Understand?"

"Oh I promise!" shouted Jerri#2, mischievous grin crossing her face.

"Okay..." said Jerri taking a anxious glance at her watch, knowing she didn't have long till her parents awoke. "Look we'll talk about it in the car. But first sign of trouble I'm driving you right back here. Understand?" Jerri explained as she hurriedly made her way to the front door.

"Yes, younger sister earthling Jerri." said Vortia following behind her, obediently.

"And another thing about a fake name we can't both be called Jerri so-"

Tom was unable to hear the rest of the conversation as the two were already walking out the front door and had closed it behind them. Fortunately, there appeared to be no FBI agents waiting for them directly outside of the house, and soon the two were in the car chatting away. Tom would be lying to himself if he didn't admit he was a bit nervous with the two going out together alone. Meitty, hearing Jerri's car starting, was now was aroused awake. Sitting upright and giving a full lion like yawn and stretch, she smacked her lips a bit as she looked about the room. "What'd I miss?" she asked looking a bit perplexed...

Her teeny-tiny escort was pushing around a metal box with wheels, which must have been either defective or placed in an impoverished “Buy-Low” (as Jerri had referred to it several times) because it was full of holes. If these things were so important, the Earthlings buying them were in for a shock when a Sphyxian Anacondoid Constrictor could wriggle through and pilfer their precious cargo!

“Shush!” Jerri said as she looked around, silently dismissing the confused stares that the “older” girl was garnering from the remaining Bi-Lo customers within earshot, “I told you I wasn’t going shopping for anything big, just groceries!”

“I don’t even know what they dooooooo!” Vortia yowled with a stomp of her boot, sending her artificially inflated bosom wobbling about behind her incomprehensible band t-shirt—fresh from her private collection of spray-ons from Metalement—and a ripple between her enhanced thighs stopping at the frill of her daisy dukes. “I’m so bored I think I’m gonna die!”

“Ugh, I don’t even know what that is. Is that a mall? Because that’s a really lame name for a mall.”

She complained about having to wait in the car while Jerri met up with her folks, even though she was very adamant in not letting her Mom and Dad see a taller, bustier version of their daughter hopping around in daisy dukes and a leather jacket. On the way over she insulted her taste in music, Earth’s inability to beam said music into one’s brainwaves accordingly (she had peeked into the AM frequencies around her and found herself quite disturbed), and then went on a rant about how the AC was broken. It was Texas in Summer, what did she expect?!

“Faith, don’t you Earthlings have air conditioning? Or at least controlled weather?” Vortia asked rhetorically as she tugged at the collar of her t-shirt, “Who’s head do I have to bust to get it to cool down a little in here?”

“You’re the one in a leather jacket and thigh boots.”

“Yeah but I pull them off pretty good.” Vortia said with a crinkle of Jerri’s nose and a wicked smile, “Maybe if you’d dress like this every now and again you and Monkey Boy would be able to hook up and leave my friend out of that…. that.” she shuddered at the thought

Jerri stopped in the middle of the aisle, her lips tucked in and her brow flat with anger. She flared her nostrils, taking a deep breath as an exercise in passive aggressiveness towards a foreigner, and walked it off without a word.

Vortia raised one of Jerri’s eyebrows flashed another wicked grin, “Ohh… I think I get it now.” She said coyly as Jerri went down the list in hopes of ignoring her “sister”, “You do like Monkey-Brain, and you’re just waiting for Meitty and me to hit the bricks before you make your move, right? Am I right? Tell me I’m not right!”

Another long exhale before Jerri continued, her pace quickening in an attempt to escape Vortia. To no avail, as she started after her at a matching pace, her heels clicking loudly behind her. “Hey wait, no fair! You can’t just pump me full of food and expect me to catch up with you!” Vortia called out with a laugh, “I’m lagging over here!”

“I’m not talking to you!” Jerri said, face cherry red as she fought back any justified bouts of anger that she wouldn’t exactly have been a stranger to, “You can’t just say that stuff! I don’t know how things are on your planet, but here we’ve got manners! We treat eachother with respect when we’re friends! You’ve been a total bitch this entire time, I am never going to speak to you again!”

At the other end of the aisle, “Sherri” stood with her hands on her hips, kicked out to the side as if in defiance. “I’d say that’s a pretty smart idea.” She said with a clack of her lips and a cheeky grin on not-her face, “Because if you stick around with Tom any longer, you might end up like Meitty.”

Vortia pulled out her Light Displacer and pushed a couple of buttons, more colors splashed onto her holographic disguise until “Sherri” much more resembled “Jerri” in stature and “Meitty” in girth. Jerri’s curly hair fell around an oblong face donning two soft chins, two heaping melons of flesh that fell on either side of a truly monumental stomach, supported by a bottom half that truly deserved its own zip code. The clothing around her had been stretched and even torn in some places, leaving lots of “Jerri” to be exposed to the unsuspecting public of Bi-Lo… who may or may not have been watching the strange transformation.

“You BITCH!!” Jerri roared as she got a head start, abandoning her many groceries in favor of charging her fat twin

“Faith… Faith… oh Faith, Tom…”

It was dark in Meitnerium’s room, though the soft glow of the sunlight could clearly be seen through the drawn blinds; bathing her humble abode in a soft pink light. All of her fancy toys and electronic doo-dads were silent, there was not a sound to be heard in the interstellar squatter’s chambers. Or the house, for that matter, what with the increasing absence of Mr. and Mrs. Parker. There was only the two of them.

"Faith, Faith oh fuckin’ Faith!”

All was not quiet, as anyone with an ounce of perception to them could tell. When the parents (and other star-crossed acquaintances) were away, teenaged lovers do often play. The heavy thuds of their rhythm beating against the wall echoed throughout the empty house, their love sounding a drum of passionate intercourse. It had been too long since they’d gotten to do this… like this anyway. Tom always seemed to worry about the presence of his parents, or the impending arrival of Jerri. With Vortia in the house now, neither of them was sure they were ever going to get to do this again before Meitty left… but they didn’t like to talk about that. In fact, only Meitty liked to talk right now. It was kinda her thing.

Beneath the patchwork, the two of them had stripped down to only their skin. Tom’s plaid overshirt lay over the chair at Meitty’s vanity, his pants were… somewhere, and he had the distinct recollection of throwing his graphic-tee over the plant. Meitnerium had no concerns over where the remnants of her own clothing lie, content in knowing that there would be no interruptions. Nothing to come between her and Tom, and nothing to keep either of them from holding back.

Ferocity filled the room, the temperature rising higher and higher as their collective body heat joined forces with the naturally overbearing Texas heat. Within the dark damp room time seemed to stand still, only to grow morbidly warm throughout the course of their passionate lovemaking. Had they been paying any attention at all to anything other than eachother, no doubt someone would have had something to say. But no, even the meticulous Meitty was at a loss for words—lost in a sea of passion.

“Fuck… fuck… mmmhmm… goddamn…”

Tom wasn’t exactly sure what he was doing. He had never been with another woman (?) before the big green apple of his eye came around. And while they weren’t exactly slackers in the sack, everything Tom did was by ear. All he knew was that, whatever he did, Meitty liked. And so he continued.

It took some maneuvering to wedge himself into what vaguely resembled a human vagina (its technical name is unable to be spelled out on the conventional keyboard but loosely translates into “docking bay”) but Tom, ever resourceful, managed to find a position just right for he and his super-sized lover. With her sweaty green rolls pushing him away and her thick green arms pulling him close, it was quite the difficult position. But still he pumped and thrusted his way into her, invigorated by youth but exhausted from exertion.

He pushed and pulled quite often, much to his woman’s delight. The sensation of that smooth thing going in and out, in and out, it wasn’t unlike sex with a member of Meitty’s own species. With every passionate thrust of his Earthliness, a loud clap would sound as his body slapped against her own—causing a ripple to go through her great globular gut at each round. She liked it. She loved it, Tom knew just how to push her buttons. But it was his hands, they were what made him so… good

Upon her insistence, Tom was to fondle her at all times. Somewhere on that fleshy green expanse of hers, Tom’s hands needed to be there. He would squeeze her tummy, kissing it lightly (or not so lightly) as he kneeded the doughy mass on either side of her flabby flank. He would stick his tongue in it, “French kissing” it, as it was called. Meitnerium liked that. Of course that wasn’t the only thing she liked for Tom to do with his tongue, but I digress…

Meitty often just lie there, far too entitled to contribute much to their sessions. Which was fine. Tom liked it, though he couldn’t quite explain why. It meant he had to try harder, learning more and more about this strange lover he had made for himself. Exploring more and more of her enormity, finding new ways to incorporate her overall girth into their love life. But he knew that there was always a way to speed things up.

Still pumping her full of his Lone Ranger, Tom lay across his lady like a giant agave mattress and pinned her down by the chubby wrists. She laughed, her breathing becoming more erratic. She loved this, this particular Earth Thing that she liked. Despite her knowledge of this little routine, she would always always always let him get away with it. It meant he was getting tired from working her fat ass over, which she completely understood… plus, it was probably her favorite part.

Tom opened his mouth and, the tip just barely inside as he gained leverage, began to suckle on one of Meitnerium’s antennae.

She faltered immediately, letting out a broken exhale as her amber eyes widened. She instinctively held him closer, forcing him back inside just a little more. His tongue rolled around her bud, his teeth nibbled on her stalk…

“Faith…faith, faith, Faith…Faithfaith…oh faith…”

she felt herself tighten and clench uncontrollably, her mighty cheeks brought so tightly together that they lifted her off of the bed slightly. Her buds, God she loved her buds! They were so… satisfying. Even after the many (much more than she would ever admit) suitors that had tried to do her, none had been so satisfying as Tom. And that was saying something, considering he was nothing more than a housepet to the civilized parts of the universe. She grew silent as her lower lip quivered, holding Tom tighter and tighter—eventually he let go.

As soon as she had regained her inhibitions, simply brought Tom closer in their embrace and rolled over onto her mighty side. He wrapped his skinny little arms around her, holding her as tight as he could manage.

He really did love her, y’know.

“Tommy?” Meitty asked breathily, “Y’think that… maybe, when I go home, you could… I don’t know—“

But only light snoring filled the room now. Mixed in with the purr of the overtaxed air conditioner and Meitnerium’s belabored breathing, Tom’s light snores were her only response to the question that almost was.

“Ohh…” she cooed, “Yeah… talk later, then.”

After entering the air-conditioned mall, it had only taken a few moments for Vortia to admit that the human aspect of shopping was pretty similar to most of the Saxxonian galaxy. Though the oddly beige skinned models, which were adorned with frightening doll like faces, some even sometimes faceless, were no comparison to 3D holographic displays of her home world, but she supposed a race had to start somewhere.

Vortia was feeling pretty good, (being the so called "most advanced life form on a planet" could to a woman) and had even managed to get her bulbs fixed, although much to Jerri's chagrin, the still slightly malfunctioning settings were now severely limited and could only revert back to he last saved configuration. So, Jerri was again now stuck shopping with her tubbier "twin."

The two had only browsed a single store in the mall; A Victoria's Secret. Vortia had been instantly drawn to the store on name alone, but was greatly disappointed to find it was not actually Vortia's Secret, inside however she was more than pleased with Earth's choice in risque clothing. After a few minuets of entering, Jerri was sure the two had earned a few stares, and unfortunately, Vortia could only guess her Earth side sizes, (the non "corpulent-copy" kind at least.) Also, there was to be no trying on of clothes (especially after Jerri explained the anti-theft cameras in most dressing rooms, ) but Vortia did end up talking Jerri into springing for a few of the Earth clothing chotchkies (getting other to buy things for them an ability Vortia and Meitty both seemed to share.) A shopping bags now in hand, Vortia definitely felt right at home here in an Earth mall, even if "here" was the farthest she'd ever been from her home planet, although Jerri had yet to show her what was probably the greatest difference between Earth mall and Metalean malls...

They were now settled at a table in the food court where a commingling of international food commodities had brought a scent so heavenly, it was like a miniature version of world peace. Jerri was in a better mood, although still a bit paranoid about anyway wayward glances the galactic girl was getting, and wondering what to do if the hologram projector bulbs should short out. Such worries were quickly forgotten as, after only earning a tiny bit of Vortia's admiration before, Jerri now found herself explaining the simplest of food based customs to the "superior" lifeforms.

"Shake? As in the vibrations of molecules as to..." began Vortia as Jerri placed the large semi-liquid in front of her.

"No, not like that...Well, not exactly... " Began Jerri. To start, the interview had begun over a burgers and fries meal. Vortia's tough 'tude was slowly starting to relax, as Jerri began pumping Vortia for alien life info while pumping calories into her at the same time. Jerri had brought her now well filled notebook along and was finally getting some Metalean info from a second source. (Not that Meitty didn't give good info when she felt like it, she was just often vague, and more focused on High School level gossip, and in the end,Tom, Meitty, and Jerri would eventually get...distracted.) Jerri felt like she was getting the deal of a lifetime, as the exchange of information seemed almost unfair for the "level" of factoids they were trading.

"A shake-machine huh? Well how come it looks weird? And how come there's no smell to it like the rest of the foods here?" asked Vortia, her holographic nose nearing but not entering the frozen delight.

"Foods are different. It's like...Like clothes! They're made of different materials and in different ways right? That's not really the best way to put it but..." Jerri hoped the clothing comparison would work, Vortia only seemed to be partly paying attention, nodding her head as she still studied the shake. "Um...Could you tell me again why it's taking so long for Meitty's parents to get here?"

Vortia set the shake down and instead grabbed a handful of fires, looking not to out of place in the hands of her double chinned doppelganger. *Munch.* "Simple time dilation warp. Space is 4 dimensions right? Well, time is sort of like the 5th. Now think of a sector of space where there's less traffic *Nom*...Gravity is less dense there. Now space travel through populated areas are on these instituted paths, or Highway's means that it's not necessarily the shortest way, but it is the quickest... " It was Jerri's turn to nod her head trying to keep up with the info as fast as she could write it down. "Now *munch* Meitty's parents, are going through a less dense area...Here let me show you with this emergency induction port."

"You mean a straw?"

"Staw? You mean you don't use these to...whatever. Okay so this "straw"...the first time it goes through this shake, it's thick so it's harder. But the second time it's a lot easier, and even easier the next time So with Earth being out of the way, it's going to take a while, especially since most people thought it was uninhabitable...like this shake thing. " Here she eyed frozen concoction wrapped in Styrofoam and looking as cold and lifeless as one of the Saxxon galaxies many moons.

"It's called vanilla ice cream. It's actually-. " said Jerri sounding like a mother explaining something to her child. She really had to wonder how Tom had the patience to explain everything to Meitty. opted for the shorter less scientific answer. "Just try it you'll like it. It's one of Meitty's favorites..." This had been enough to goad the green girl into opening the prototype liquid transfer machine, the white liquid slowly went up and past her lips. Jerri wasn't sure, but if she could see past through the hologram she'd bet Vortia's antenna would be sticking straight up in delight! The girl guzzled, and gulped and slurped the frosty un-choclate milkshake, barely stopping to catch her breath. Metaleans were apparently not susceptible to Ice Cream headaches...

"Listen, we can go through all the goodies I have, well any that still work, if you can get me more of these..." said Vortia breathlessly enraptured. Jerri was more than happy too, and Vortia was glad to be fawned over by the maybe not-so unintelligent life form.

"So...What do you think will happen? said Jerri, returning with another shake in hand, and a now more serious look in her eyes. "I mean after Meitty's folks take her home."

"Oh...well...servitude I guess." said Vortia suddenly looking a bit unconformable in her chair.

"What?"

"Yeah. Metaleans are a conquering race. It's in our blood." said Vortia matter of factually as she began sucking on her chocolate shake. "We find a planet, and either conquer it or enslave it, that's how we got to be such a great empire. I mean...It's not like your planet has much of a defense system anyways. And...Tom was it? He's practically already under Meitty's control. So I guess she has dibs on him. I mean if Meitty's dad doesn't put him in galactic prison first for kidnapping. He probably would have blown up a good chunk of the planet If anything had happened to her! And by the law he'd be right too."

"Uh.." said a much paler Jerri

"-He, probably still will on the grounds of theft. Don't worry though. I'll make sure you two aren't put in too harsh a prison. What is the average lifespan of a human anyway? 100 solar sweeps?"

"Listen... Vortia" said the frozen Jerri unsure of how to react to this new bit of info.

"Lady Vortia. As a first pioneer of a new planet, I and Meitty receive an honorable title from my people, and I already like the sound of it. Hey, you wouldn't mind being a servant to me would you? You seem nice enough and you take orders really well. It'd be better than prison."

"Oh,sorry. Lady Vortia. Is there anyway I could..maybe get in touch with Meitty's parents again. Maybe in a way so they don't have to enslave Earth?"

"Nope. They're in hyperspace so there signals gone. And these fries are going to be gone too. *MMph* she moaned taking one final large handful. "They were delicious!"

"Listen, I think we should go- I've got to go talk to Tom now. Like, right now." said Jerri getting up and going for her cell phone.

"What's the hurry?" said a forlorn looking Vortia. "Look, Meitty's fine, but I thought she would have explained this. It won't be so bad. I promise. A whole race of humans serving us Metaleans doing our hard labor as we eat your food and eventually grow to Meitty size.. It'll be wonderful. We'll be your bosses, but we'll treat you well. I, certainly don't think Tom would mind, and from the way you've been staring at-"

"No!" said Jerri a bit of hysteria cracking into her voice. "We have to go! NOW!"

Vortia saw the panic in the human and..

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
Jerri took a quick glance at her phone (much to the bewilderment of Vortia, who couldn’t comprehend communicating on such a bulky device unless in case of an emergency) and saw that the time; barely half past noon. And with the fifteen minute drive back to Tom’s house, which left a solid two hours to kill with her new gal-pal.

“We’ve got time.” Jerri said, simply stuffing the communications device back into her pocket, “Meitty won’t be good and hungry ‘til after her soaps anyway.”

“Soaps?” Vortia asked, prying her lips away from the tube of creamy lactose, “You mean that stuff you people bathe with?”

“Do you really think us Earth-Folk just sit around all day watching soap?”

“Hey, I’m not judging.” Vortia said plainly as her sucking came to slurping, the sweet creamy mixture in her cup tapping out. Her borrowed brown brow furrowed in frustration, she sucked harder and harder but to no avail. Vortia—erm, Jerri’s dimensionally generous twin sister Sherri—glanced up at her newfound friend with a look that one might have after their computer froze up, or their car didn’t start.

“Ugh!” she huffed, breaking away from the straw, “Jerri, I’m out.”

The teeny Texan looked up from her notebook with a very similar expression on her face, one of disbelief and some confusion as the alien across from her shook her empty cup. “And? Go get some more.”

“Just… go and get more?” Vortia said with a look of arbitrary disbelief on her supple Sherri face, as if Jerri had told her to pray to some pagan god for crops

“Yeah, you just go over there—“ here she pointed to the Chick fil a across the food court, “—and ask the guy for a refill.”

“You mean it doesn’t, like… refill?” Vortia asked quietly

Jerri let out a little laugh, forgetting that she was dealing with a tourist. Vortia had only been on Earth for a few days now, hardly the veteran in enduring Earthly customs that Meitty was. Excitedly, the curly-cued cutie smiled and placed her notebook down on the table next to Vortia’s shopping bag—making sure that it was quite closed lest peeping eyes be about.

“Come on, I’ll give you a grand tour.” She said, scooting her own self out and making her way over to her doughy doppleganger, “Wanna get another burger while you’re up?”

“Ugh. Moving.” Vortia complained, “From what I’ve observed of the heavy people of Earth—“

“By which you mean Meitty?” Jerri asked wryly

“—No, smart one, there’s a really fat guy over there too.” Vortia said, extending a pudgy white arm in said man’s direction before continuing, “As I was saying, the heavier people of your planet don’t tend to move very much. So in order to make this… physique more believable, I suggest that you be a good earth-twin-sister-Jerri and go grab your earth-twin-sister-Sherri more sustenance so that we don’t raise any eyebrows.”

There was a beat between the two twins as Jerri raised an eyebrow at “Sherri”, who happily smiled away using her simulated facial features.

“Seriously?” Jerri cracked a little smile, “I didn’t know all Metaleans were this lazy.”

“I’m playing a part, so sue me.” Vortia said as she examined the now removed suction port of her liquid container, licking the frothy residue left on the outside, “Mmm…”

“And what would y’all have in return for this little favor?” Jerri asked knowingly, tilting on her hip slightly so as to appear somewhat disinterested while accentuating her already thick Texan accent, “Y’all know it’s awful stressful for us lower life forms to handle too much without our brains fryin’ an’ such.”

“True, but I figured I’d let you hear me ramble on summore about life on my planet.” Vortia said, her eyes focused entirely on the straw in search of surviving slush, “You seem to like all that jargon, so why not? We’ve got time to kill, right?”

“All the time in the world, Lady Vortia.” Jerri said with a little curtsey before walking off, “I’ll get you this time, but I expect the whole story!”

“Hey, don’t skimp on the burgers this time!” Vortia cried out across the food court, “I’m practically an ambassador, here!”

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
Jerri would return with not one burger, not three, but five very large off-brand food-court burgers. Cheap, but filling. On the side, a mountain of thick salty French fries with two little cups of ketchup for dipping. Some cole slaw (she didn’t particularly enjoy it, but who knows? Vortia might.) Meanwhile she struggled to palm a large Styrofoam cup of soda with her only free hand. As elegantly as someone in her position might manage (read: not very) Jerri managed to heave the mighty haul back to their table with only a remarkable amount of difficulty.

Hanging out with Tom and Meitty doing nothing wasn’t exactly good for upper body strength.

“Great Faith, all I asked for was a burger!” Vortia, in the porcine projection of Sherri, gasped as she choked at the amount of food that her new friend had brought back, “Is this what constitutes a ‘refill’ on your planet?!”

Jerri smiled slyly, setting the tray down in front of Vortia with an audible clacking against the table. She sat down across from her, grinning from ear to ear, and hummed contentedly to herself

“Well you’re the one playing the role of my big ol’ sister, right Sherri?” Jerri jabbed as nudged the tray ever so closer, “And the ‘heavier population of Earth’ ‘s gotta eat a lot more than us other, regular-sized earth-folk, right? I am the last person who wants to raise any eyebrows ‘round here.”

“Oh you bitch.” Vortia grumbled, distasted in Jerri’s sudden sneakiness but very eager to substitute it with the much more pleasant sensation of a hamburger, “Can’t beleef I wush outshmarded by a monkey.”

Sherri, the earth-twin-sister of Jerri, certainly didn’t raise any eyebrows. Now if she had been the taller, leggier, significantly greener Vortia at the time then it was a distinct possibility. But no, seeing a 5’4” butterball of normal Caucasian persuasion was significantly easier for their fellow mall patrons to stomach. No, the only eyes on “Sherri” belonged to her escort for the evening, who reveled in watching her faux-fat friend indulge in every bite—even if it was as a version of her that had to be at least double her weight.

Jerri watched as Vortia began to partake in the little meal she had acquired for her. The disguised delinquent seemed a little puzzled at first, only having eaten a burger just a few minutes ago. But it seemed to come naturally to her—first she would lift one arm, grab the burger, reel it into her mouth… every bite slowly evolving from something practiced and mechanical into a more natural motion. Quicker, sloppier, more at ease.

And she was getting the hang of things, to say the least. The overload of taste on her poor deprived Metalean taste buds was to be noticed easily—a trained eye like Jerri’s had no problem picking out the little pauses of appreciation, nor the small noises she made throughout her feasting. It wasn’t odd, getting such enjoyment out of seeing a version of herself getting stuffed silly, right? Jerri had seen the green eating machine underneath the hard-light dowhatsit, hardly convinced that her tubby twin was some sort of reflection.

Before long Vortia had made her way through the burgers, their large size intimidating and their buns quite filling. The fries were a much harder matter, after having filled up on the sandwiches and such tackling such a daunting task of seemingly endless potato-chunks definitely looked impossible. She had at them with less enthusiasm, noticeably.

“How does… Meitty… do it?”

“The girl’s a pro.” Jerri said with a smile as she nudged the plate closer again to her newest subject, “Eats our Earth-food like she’s been doing it all her life, right?”

“No wonder she’s… so frickin’… so frickin’ fat.” Vortia wheezed, unable to restrain Sherri’s doughy left arm as it stuffed another handful of French fries into her mouth, “Oh Faith… It’s all just so… gooood!”
‘Sherri’ began massaging her bloated, pale dome of a paunch. Her breathing was heavy, but the hard-light construct was too damaged to accurately capture Vortia’s true expression—despite her extreme exhaustion, ‘Sherri’ appeared not to be flustered or sweaty. However beneath the simulated skin, Vortia was sweating buckets in her leather jacket. She hadn’t yet gotten accustomed to eating quite so much so fast. It was all a little… strange.

If Jerri’s eyes could have gotten any wider, which was doubtful, they would have. A small white crack in the hard-light construct flashed for half a second before disappearing, the projection of her earth-twin-sister-Sherri becoming snowy in certain parts for a moment.

“Oh faith…oh frickin’…MMMmmm…” Vortia sang as she continued stuffing handful after handful into her kraut, massaging more vigorously now on both sides of the simulated spectrum. Beneath the construct, her antennae (already quite large) began to stand erect as she passed her threshold for her appetite

“U-Uh, Sh-Sherri…” Jerri stammered, quite red in her own rights for her own reasons, “Y-You might wanna slow down, there…”

“Mmmm…” the alien ignored her friend’s warnings, “Almos…done…” Vortia managed through increasingly vigorous amounts of fries, “These things are…mm…sogood…”

“Sherri.” Jerri said sharply, “Knock. It. Off.”

But as the breaks in Vortia’s charade became more apparent and frequent, she also became increasingly engrossed in her own gorging. Her antennae slowly getting straighter and taller, and straighter and taller until…

*BEEP BEEP BEEP!*

“Oh Faith.” Vortia said suddenly, snapping back to reality

“What now?!” Jerri hissed as she watched her ‘twin’ disappear from thin air, replaced by the skinny-minny redhead with the throbbing stalks sticking out of her bright red locks

“I think I just overloaded my hard-light projectors.”

“Oh Faith.” Jerri said flatly

It wasn’t a second later that the two of them were out the door, Vortia’s jacket pulled up and over her head (a very painful attempt at hiding her antennae) running to the car like two women possessed. They had managed to be here for a whole hour and not have any kind of mishaps, but of course something like this had to happen!

“What the hell happened to your projectors?!” Jerri whispered as they ran to her sedan, clinging desperately to her notebook “What good is all your alien tech if it keeps breaking down?!”

“I-I don’t know!” Vortia puffed, having some difficulty keeping up on a full stomach and the heavy Victoria's secret bag, “I guess when they shorted out they couldn’t… and I… and those fries…”

“Nevermind!” Jerri barked as she opened the door, “Just… get in the car and keep your head down, just in case!”

“WAIT!” Vortia cried out suddenly

“What now?!”

"You never got me another milkshake!"

Drive-through purchased milkshakes in tow (six in all, ranging from strawberry to chocolate in their variety) and with the temperature outside having only increased in its oppressiveness, Jerri had only added to the sweat from earlier having nearly blown the existence of aliens.

"Faith..." murmured said alien Vortia who was presently fumbling with a encrusted pen she had found on the car floor and her pair of silver orbs. "Faith! This is hopeless!" she said again throwing the pen down in frustration. "I don't suppose that Tom has any ion heating nano sized soldiering tools?" she asked arms crossed and turning to Jerri.

"Nooo, but His Dad might have the earth equivalent-."

"Oh simian tech sure! Why don't I just get a rock and-"

"Just joking (siiip) I'm just...frustrated is all. I'd hope to be home by now.... And now these are broke...No thanks to you."

"Strike two... One more and you're walking." said Jeri shooting a heated look towards Vortia. "And need I remind you that it was thanks to me, we made it out of the mall just fine without you getting caught. "

"(Siiip) You're right, I still don't see what the big deal is..." said Vortia sighing softly as she set down her drink and tucked her silver orbs away, focusing solely on the sweet treat in front of her.
***

Minutes later, and more happy then ever to pull up to Tom's house, Jerri crab clawed the allotment of shakes and was relived to enter the peaceful air-conditioned home. Promptly re-locking the consistently locked front door behind Vortia, she found that a sleepy eyed Tom was the only one up in the oddly quiet house.

"Hey," he said quietly taking the tired looking Jerri into an embrace. "Everything go okay?" Jerri momentarily enjoying the embrace, gave Tom a quick peck on the cheek before setting the now 5 shakes into the fridge. Vortia meanwhile was now couch bound, busy reveling in her most recent new flavored shake and rummaging through her bag of mall treasures.

"Yeah... No...Well...It's a long story." whispered Jerri as she continued into the kitchen before slumping on a dinner table chair. Jerri then explained how her trip with Vortia had gone; The frequent fights, the mall meltdown... only leaving out maybe a few specific Tom centric details. "-we'll be okay now though, I think we're okay. My parents think we're at the beach again, and I decided to generously buy milkshakes after we made it out of the mall."

"Well, I wasn't too worried about you two Jer. I mean, I know you can handle just about anything, but I was mostly worried about Vortia causing a scene. " said Tom now letting his hand intertwine with hers. "I'm, just... glad you're both okay....This is-it's getting a little weird isn't it?" he asked voice choking a bit on a laugh.

"Yeah..It was beyond weird a loooong time ago" said Jerri smiling before sharing a deep lip locking kiss with Tom. There was something about the way they kissed now that was unlike any of their many previous kisses. For one thing there was a sense of urgency and yet somehow welcoming in this kiss, the subtle movement of his head to be closer to her, her arm reaching around his back to bring him in tighter, and for another, it wasn't in the shared presence of a certain olive skinned ogling onlooker....Well at least one named Meitty.

"Mmph" said Tom breaking away from the blissful kiss. "Since you hurried on over here, shouldn't we wake her royal alien-ness up?"

Jerri sighing slightly and who wouldn't have minded a little more 'alone time' with Tom, eventually agreed. "Well we'd better. Remember last time?." Tom actually needed no reminding, Meitty had missed a single episode of her favorite TV soap, and the resulting complaining and minor temper-tanturm she'd thrown was enough to give anyone who even thought of it a recurring headache. "But let's make Vortia do it. Since she seems likes joking around so much. Let her deal with a cranky Meitty." Tom nodded and they both walked towards a very satiated looking Vortia. A satisfied smile graced her lips, lips that were covered in pink ice cream residue. Vortia had apparently removed the lid off of her shake and decided to chug the dang thing in an attempt to get as much frozen goodness in her as quickly as she could.

"Jerri, *hic* tell me...What...what was this pink kind again? The one that matched my cute new Vortia's secret clothes?"

"Strawberry?"

"Yes, I think that's my new favorite..." Now finally wiping and licking the last bit of strawberry goo from her mouth.

" Great....well...Want to wake up Meitty? Her soaps are just about to come on."

"Sure..." said Vortia half moaning as she hefted herself off the couch and down to the room Jerri pointed to.

***


The room was still rather dark from earlier events, and the smell of the room while not exactly unpleasant, was unlike any Vortia had known. Making her way to the large bed-lump covered by blankets Vortia gave her gal pal a playful nudge. "Meitty. Hey! Don't tell me you and the Tom thing were in here...Oh Faith! You were weren't you!"

Meitty meanwhile remained snoring regardless of the goading. Vortia resorted to one of her favorite tactics having been stuck with Meitty in a situation like this a few times before.

"*Ahem* This is Mrs. Henderson and if you're tardy for one more of my classes I'll have no other choice than to-" It was obvious that the impression was having little to no effect. "Heeey!" she shouted again, giddy to gossip once more about all the new "Earthling" things she'd seen and done.

"Hu nuhh." said Meitty, her huge body shifting as she was finally waking up a bit. "Oh hey Erbi, *yawwwwn* Have a good time?"

"Heh, I tried to-" said Vortia with a dismissive roll of her eyes. "Oh, before I get started, those Earthlings in the next room said something about soaps?"

This seemed to grab Meitty's attention. "What? 3:00? All-ready?" She sat up, best as she could with her rolly-polly belly, and rolled off the bed. As her tender toes hit the carpet she realized what the bed sheets had kept hidden from her BFF, she was completely in the buff. Again to Vortia this was not a completely odd state for Meitty to be in, but it was one Meitty would rather change. Quickly grabbing her largest sweats she poured herself into the pair of pants.

"Wouldn't happen to have any spray-tex would you? My can's almost out." said the breathless beauty, her white hair teased and tussled in the traditional 'morning after' look.

"Meitty what's the rush?" asked Vortia moving just out of the way as Meitty hurriedly struggled to fit inside of a t-shirt. "I wanted to show you some of these cute tops from this store, and now I find you-"

"No time," said Meitty now no longer topless, but from the look of things squeezed into one of her older t-shirts. "You can tell me all about it later Erby-Derby. " and with that she disappeared out of the bedroom leaving a puzzled Vortia behind her in her haste.Vortia couldn't see what the big deal was, having never personally basked in the glow of Earthling based trashy TV telenovellas. Confused for what to be her hundredth time that day, Vortia followed her friend back into the living room.

***


Meitty's bra-less bosom wasn't unnoticed and it certainly wasn't unappreciated. Her big breasts bouncing gloriously just underneath her t-shirts stretched fabric were given appreciative glance by not one, but two sets of human eyes. Guilty grins spread across two faces as well, as Meitty took her well 'earned' spot back on the couch. Vortia meanwhile had lugged her many tools and gadgets into the living room, figuring she rather keep herself busy than watch any of this Earth life TV, well maybe a few seconds...Oooh who was that? He certainly wasn't like this Tom Earthling.

At the sight of the two aliens eying the TV set Tom and Jerri's grips increased in intensity. A look slowly began Tom's face, one that Jerri was very,very, familiar with.

"Tom. No." said Jerri, although not with much passion, more by habit than with actual passion. "You can't possibly be thinking about...that." said Jeri trying to hide a very similar look from her own blushing face.

And, much to Jerri's surprised, Tom stopped. He turned and looked Jerri right in the eyes right before saying, "Look Jerri everybody's been on edge lately, but I think things are going to be okay now. Meitty's parents are on their way, the blinds are closed, I don't have any work till next week, we've got a life time supply of twonkies in the kitchen and you even brought milkshakes. We've got nothing to do but relax and wait for Meitty's parents to show up."

"You're right." said Jerri relaxing a little more in Tom's arms. "I think we've earned a little more summer vacation. It's just to do 'that' when Vortia just got here....It feels...I don't know...You know Vortia said she's got a box of tech-tools with her. You want to take a look at some of her gadgets? Oh and that Codex! Tom! We could see what other aliens are like! Your Dad is going to die when he see this stuff!" sheepishly Jerri turned her head, at odds within herself on what she wanted to do next, and what she REALLY wanted to do with Tom,and with Meitty, all the time... Well there was plenty of time for both, but what did they want to do first?

Who do Tom and Jerri ending up sitting next to?

“Rassen frassen…”

Tom hunched over in his seat, his arms folded sharply as his head hung low between his shoulders. His brow furrowed as he looked away from the makeshift workshop that his newest houseguest had made for herself in the Parker’s spare bedroom.

”Ugh! I can’t hear the TV!”

”Tom, why don’t y’all go... somewhere else? You’ve had Meitty all day…We’ll switch!”

He mouthed the word ‘switch’ in exaggerated disdain, hardly paying attention to the little bursts of electricity that sprung from Vortia’s little light-bending balls. Whatever they were, they didn’t really seem to like it when she poked them with his dad’s soldering gun. Not that he cared. These definitely weren’t the two orbs he wanted to be watching right now. And “assisting” Vortia was definitely the last thing on his mind…

Rassen. Frassen.

Vortia sat in front of him, hunched over on the floor with various Earth tools scattered around her. She said she didn’t need a table, that the carpet would work fine, but the fact that her Hard Light transmitters were so wonky (and liable to spark) didn’t lend much faith to the promise to his parents that they wouldn’t start any house fires.

“Frickin’…”

There hadn’t been much conversation between the two of them, generally because there was little to talk about. That awkward “friend of my friend” thing on a cosmic scale. Tom had already met a beautiful alien girl, and she’d told him lots about her culture. Vortia had spent the afternoon getting acclimated to Earth and junk, and she’d taken much more to the familiar Jerri. Tom wasn’t much of a tech-head (he’d never pegged Jerri for one either) and wasn’t really interested in how Vortia’s miracle camouflage device worked, only in that it got fixed.

Any maybe wondering why Meitty hadn’t crashed with such a useful device earlier on.

“Ah!” Vortia flapped her arm and shook her hand as she recoiled from a particularly nasty shock, emphasized by a loud KZZT and a puff of smoke, “Freakin’…”

“You, uh… you got it fixed yet?” Tom inquired, craning his neck slightly as if to see over Vortia’s hunched shoulders

“Did that sound like I fixed it?” Vortia glowered back at the boy, “I mean, just statistically speaking, is that a noise that you Earth Apes like hearing your electronic devices make?”

“Jeez, sorry.” Tom rolled his eyes (apparently all Metaleans had something of an attitude about them) “Just trying to help.”

Vortia rolled her eyes and shuffled around, using her long legs and gluteal muscles to rotate while still remaining seated. The damage from her earlier binge was still very much visible, the swelling of her stomach had yet to die down as it bulged prominently between her upturned legs.

“No, you’re trying to huff and puff your way back into the living room so you don’t have to sit here with me.” She said flatly, putting her shiny silver balls down on the carpet, “I mean, I get it. Good host, trying to make sure no one feels like a third… fourth?... wheel. But really, it’s cool.”

Tom looked off to the side, which coincidentally happened to be the direction of the door. The thought appealed to him, much more than he cared to admit, but ultimately decided against it.

“Nah, it’s cool.” He said with an apologetic smile thrown Vortia’s way, “Sorry it’s just…”

“Nooope.” Vortia scooted back around, “Don’t wanna know what you and Meitty were doing in here, don’t wanna think about it, don’t wanna hear a word pertaining to it! Just… make yourself useful and grab me another milkshake, wouldja?”

A bemused smile crossed his lips as he reached over to Vortia’s hoarded cache of human milkshake, having claimed no less than three of the delicious dairy cups out of the remaining five before the two of them had been relocated to Meitty’s room. She’d already downed one while she tapped away at her image inducers, leaving one left for him to innocently sip on while she continued to fiddle with her tech.

She took it from him eagerly, placing the straw to her lips before she even turned back around. More sparks soon followed.

“So… why exactly do you have to crack them open like that?” Tom asked, attempting to make conversation, “I thought they were just abused a little. Can’t you just… reboot them? Or something?”

An audible sigh, then Vortia turned around again.

“Jerri and I got into a little catfight—contain yourself, please—and they got a little more than “abused”. I got them working long enough for us to sit down in the mall, but the construction bulbs burned out. I’m really hoping that I don’t have to jury-rig some kind of appropriated... No, I can’t reboot them.”

“So you’re… really into tech, huh?”

“What, you think I’m just a pair of long green legs? There’s a brain holding up these antennae you know.” Vortia rolled her eyes, “Not all Metalean girls are dumb enough to try and go to art school.”

There was a long awkward pause. Another one, anyway. This was… much harder than talking to Meitty.

“I’m in art school.”

“Faaaaaith.” Vortia let out a laugh, “Sorry Earthman, it’s just… I’ve got a lot on my mind. Y’know? I mean Meitty’s had plenty of time to get used to—URRRP!”

A sudden belch escaped the svelter extraterrestrial, taking the both of them off guard. One hand flew to shield the air from her sudden gastric release, her eyes widening in surprise as yet another of her body’s vestigial biological functions was revealed to her.

“What the Faith was that?!” she exclaimed, “Have I had too much of something? Oh frick, I probably have… My body’s rejecting your Earth food!”

“Relax, it’s just a burp.” Tom laughed, “We Earth folk do it all the time.”

“What a disgusting culture!”

Vortia fell back on the floor, the green dome of her stomach pooching high into the air. She hit the ground with a ‘thud’, and an awkward silence filled the room before the two of them started laughing. Eventually Vortia wriggled her way tummy-down on the floor, her head propped up by her hands. She felt more at ease with this earth man. Somehow.

“So tell me, Tom…” she asked with a smile on her face, “You and Jerri, are yooou…?”

“What? No!” Tom answered back hastily, “I mean, maybe. Kind’ve. It’s… complicated. Like really, really complicated. Literally the most complicated thing that has ever happened to me in my entire life. Ever. Not that I’m complaining, just… don’t tell Meitty.”

“Soooo… she’s single?” Vortia asked with a wry crinkle of her nose

“What? No!”

“Juuuust checking.”

Vortia kicked her legs playfully while she tinkered with her toys idly, Tom left breathing heavily on the couch. That was an armor-piercing question if there ever were one. Tom hardly liked his personal life… romantic life… coming under fire.

“Faith, don’t be such a prude. It’s not weird.” Vortia said flatly, “On our planet anyway. I don’t know how you guys deal with dating, but it’s normal to play the field a little.”

“I’m not… You… can we change the subject?”

“Frickin’ monkey…” Vortia cursed as she went back to playing, causing more sparks to fly from the opened spheres on the floor, “Do you think you could “rassle” up some kind of wiring? Why-err-ing? The little strings inside these little thingies?”

“What are you trying to do?”

“The filament in these things are busted. I need Tungsten, but just… I don’t know, get me anything you can find. I don’t know where I’m gonna get Tungsten out in the boonies of civilized society…”

CA-LICK!

“We could just break a lightbulb.” Tom shot up off the couch and reached into the lamp by Meitnerium’s bed, “How much of it do you need?”

“Not much…” she watched as Tom’s hand emerged with a fragile glass bulb, white as snow. He held it up above his head with a smile on his face (she didn’t quite catch the reference… there seemed to be one…) and promptly threw it to the ground, “What are you doing you primitive… genius!”

There, amidst the mess of pearly white glass, was just enough tungsten to act as filament!

She quickly scraped up the remains of the lightbulb while Tom applauded himself, cut herself a miniscule amount of the wire provided, and placed said clippings into their respective opened transponders. Forcing them shut, the little things hummed slightly in her hand as she placed them back over the buds of her antennae…

Tom stepped back as a mountain of simulated softness surged forward, Vortia shrinking down to just over five feet as her disguise as “Sherri” returned. The rotund little blonde took Tom by quite the surprise—the last time he’d seen “Sherri” she had been much taller and leggier. Her soft features and round face became a sheepish smile as Tom drank in every last inch of the suddenly expanded reflection of his ‘sometimes’ girl…

“Okay, I can explain…” Vortia held up Sherri’s doughy white hands, “She was being a really big bitch.”
