Meanwhile seconds later in the other room Meitraninum and Jerri were getting along much better. For one thing Meitranium was eating which always put BOTH of the girls in a happy mood. Moments when the two were without Tom were rare and at first been pretty awkward, but as time passed with Jerri learning almost everything there was to know about Meitty and her alien culture, as well as all of Meitty’s feelings towards food, Jerri had learned …a few personal thing about herself…

Take now for instance. Meitty had entrenched bulk down onto the couch with Jerri friendly lounging close by to her could watch her eat…and eat…and gorge and practically swell right before her eyes...There was just SO much of her now compared to when they’d first met. While Meitty would hardly bat one of her own olive green eyelids at the mass quantities she’d become quite accustomed with consuming. She’d pause casually to add a snarky sarcastic remark about whatever was on the TV or to answer on one of Jerri’s questions or even ask questions of her own, mostly about Earth culture, but often more like: “Any more Pizza left?” and “Could you bring me some more Pop...Please?”

Sure before all this, Jerri had been all in on TOM. ‘Her and Tom 2-gether 4-Ever as it had been scrawled in nerdish fashion along the margins of her class notebook. But then in plopped a Green Gal and non-physically booty bumped Jerri to the side. Sure Jerri was a bit dejected, but she then determined turned determined to make Tom hers! That was until a certain day at the beach…Meitty revealed she was an alien, Tom reveled he had a certain preference in the ‘shape’ of women he liked, and Jerri well Jerri had unintentionally found out the same about herself…

Now…now…Jerri was more than okay with having Meitty as a friend, occasion science project/science an unofficial encyclopedia of an entire Alien race! And…And… Jerri was also more than okay when it came to Meitty as the third pillar between her and Tom and their Love…well it wasn’t exactly a love triangle now was it...? Maybe a love stool, or tricycle? Gosh that was putting it weirdly, which oddly fit since they were in a weird…thing…

The idea had been rattling around in the back of her mind since the mall trip with Vortia; Yes. It had been an interesting summer of discover so far; watching Meitty grow larger on an almost daily basis, getting to cop a feel every week for fully “scientific purposes”… And now there were two of them! Jerri could feel her head and heart pounding…

Meitty had finished the last of her shakes, which matched perfectly with the show cutting to commercial break…“Listen Jer, I hope Vortia wasn’t too much of a hassle she can be bitchy when she’s not getting what she wants. “Said Meitty licking the leftover strawberry red remainder from her luscious lips.

“Well it’s not like I’d be happy about being stuck on a plane and almost getting captured.” Said Jerri

“Well it wouldn’t be our first time…” said Meitty almost wistfully but with a mischievous grim as she recalled a fond memory. “She is really nice if you can put up with her. Just saying…”

Jerri gave a nod of her head remembering the adventure she’d just been on, the fight in the grocery story, the hot breath steaming down Jerri’s face as the both struggled against each other. “She’s pretty much Earthbound now so she’s gonna have to grow to like it…You certainly did…” said Jerri with a playful poke of her finger.

“Faith yes I did!” Added Meitty slapping her bulk for emphasis… “Going by the way she was putting away the pizza last night I think Erby-derby might even-“

“Settle down you Simian slob!” There was a loud tumbling and then a rumbling of footsteps from the other room.

“Settle Down? Settle down!” Tom voice sounded out of place when it got angry, he was so rarely forced to get loud. “Because Jerri offers to take you around and THIS is what you do to her?”

Jerri and Meitty watched in surprise as “Sherri” the chubbier and chunkier version of Jerri tumbled from the room next door. Jerri uneasily gulped knowing what would follow. Tom came blustering in, his lank appearance looking a bit more muscled as his wiry torso puffed with anger.

“It was…only a joke…”Offered Vortia as she undid her spheres and ended the overweight illusion once more.

“That’s too far!” boomed Tom. However when he snapped his attention to Jerri, his voice was back down to his usual tone. “I should have gone with you two-“

“No Tom. Really.” Jerri cut in standing up…”It was my fault too…We bot got to tauntin’ each other and we both got a bit cranky is all …You know how stubborn I can get…Really though we patched things up…” as she spoke she’d crossed the distance from the couch to where Tom stood, meanwhile Vortia had stood up and neatly pocketed her orbs.

“Aw...Jer come here…” said Tom offering a hug with his arms wide open. Jerri embraced him, she found such comfort and so safe when he held her like this…in lean arms both their hearts thumping loudly. He leaned in close, Jerri leaned in closer and they kissed. Long and true.

“Get a room you two…” Added their impromptu audience Meitty from the couch…

“Jerri you know I…You don’t have to...- You and” Tom spluttered.

“Shhshh…” giggled the curly haired blonde placing a finger to his lips. “Tom I know…That was just her way of pissing me of and well it kinda’ worked. We toughed it out, and it’s kind of hard to explain, but we sorta have a mutual appreciation for each other now…Isn’t that right ‘Erby Derby’?”

Vortia stuck out her forked tongue and made a rude gesture featuring her fingers, before breaking into an innocent smirk.

“Yeah, sort of like us…We…don’t really have to explain it…” offered Tom before leaning in for another kiss.

“Ooh good one Mr. Suave.” Said Jerri before returning with a few kisses of her own. The kisses grew shorter apart; until they were both full on lip-locking and spit swapping. Soon their hands were on each other probing as-

“Well don’t let us stop you!” Again chimed in Meitty, much more enthralled in this mini soap opera than the one on the TV.

“…She’s probably right” said Jerri a bit breathless. “We probably should wait and do this later when we have a little more...privacy?”

Tom thought a minute before answering…

That night things felt the most normal and safe since Vortia’s arrival. Everyone had slept quite well after another large dinner this time featuring an extremely large batch of Chili, accompanied by loaves of oven baked Garlic bread. Vortia’s analytical mind was starting to grasp the fact that yes in fact ALL Earth Food was equally as delicious and yes there was sooo many new tastes she could not begin to imagine! Yes there were seconds and thirds still left! Yes, even a meal after the meal called dessert!

“Hmmm *Burrrp* was was that called again?” asked a very full and fulfilled looking Vortia.

“Cheesecake” added Jerri having begun taking notes in a separate notebook, focusing on the second foreign foodie. “Now you’re sure you don’t feel any sort of sickness? Like any sort of virus or Earth based germ wise?”

Vortia gave a slight moan…"Now that you mention it….Ohh…I’m beginning to see the slight downside of being so full…” This remark got a laugh from the whole dinner table.

***


Things had continued in much the same way the rest of that week. That was until Mr. and Mrs. Parker arrive back home. They were a bit surprised to say the least when they arrived back from their cruise only to find another green guest had arrived. The did breathe a sigh of relief however after Tom had explained how Vortia had arrived, and assured them things were fine. (Tom having left out a few FBI related details here and there.) Finally he got to the main point that Meirtty and Vorita were soon in fact going home. So soon Mr. and Mrs. Parker settled back into their normal routines. That was with another hungry mouth to feed of course. Mr. Parker awe stricken by Vorita’s orbs (you know what I mean) was more than happy to deal with another dip in his paycheck, in exchange to watch them work. And as for Mrs. Parker, well, although her time cooking in the kitchen had increased, so had the amount of help she was getting. Vorita was more interested in cooking the lazy energy efficient Meitty, and Mrs. Parker grew to appreciate the extra helping hands. The red headed space babe, had been given a tour of the kitchen by Louise who ended up explaining a few of the objects Meitranium had confusion with; thinking the fridge was some sort of cooling bay for a mainframe computer, the oven was a resonator generator device, and the microwave some sort of antennae field scrambler

“Surely you don’t scrub all the pots and plates by hand?” inquired Vortia when they’d arrived to the sink.

“Yep! Well at least since the dishwasher went out. And don’t I have the dishpan hands to prove it? Well Tom helps most of the time too but-“

“Let me take a look…” Vortia had cut of Tom’s mother in mid-sentence, but was already hard at work studying the inside of the broken washing machine. There was clinking and clanging, and Ms. Parker had gasped a few times at the sight of washing machine parts being flung across the usually spotless kitchen floor. As she worked inside of the machine tearing and unscrewing as she pleased, Vortia realized something was…distracting her. Usually the lithe alien moved with grace, but now she was fighting and fidgeting with her own paunch. Yep, it was definitely there. She realized with a bit of excitement she was on her way to starting to look like Meitty. Not that she minded, she in fact wondered what the extra weight would feel like instead of being holographically projected onto her frame…She couldn’t wait to find out. And it wasn’t like she was going to give up on food back to food pills. Oh FAITH no! She’d eat as much as she could, and enjoy the gains that came along with it. With food this good one couldn’t help but love these humans, clearly a food based tactic could bring about Galactic peace she marveled a bit as she continue to work, ignoring Tom’s offer to get a screwdriver , or the shrieks Mrs.Parker was forced to stifle as Vortia went on tearing more and more from the machine. …Eventually after some work with her trusty mini soldering iron the dishwasher was done, up and running better than it had been before!

***


And so the days of summer flew by, with each day seeming to bring a mini adventure, and almost each and every night filled with Netflix and Chili. Food, fun, and a certain other f word became the focus, as their three feeder feedee whoopee, turned into a gastronomical orgy for four. That was until...

It was as normal as normal got for a household filled with two still growing alien girls, that November day.

“Go on step on the scale Vortia” urged Jerri, now a common face at the Parker household, coming over just about every day she could. Inside of the Parker residences bathroom she held a king size candy bar with one hand just out of Vortia’s eager pre-chocolate smudged mouth’s reach. The now increasingly more voluptuous Vortia plodded and stood on the digital device, arms crossed; part of her really enjoyed the almost reverence the humans had for her now, but she was also a bit miffed she was still treated like a model they could dress and undress, she supposed she’d never fully understand this inferior simian species. The lights blinked a bit before the display finally revealed 264lbs. Jerri took a quick moment to scribble the statistic into her notebook, then did a double take as she realized Vorita had now officially just more than doubled her weight since landing her on Earth.

“*Munch* Ish that like a big deal or shomthing?” asked Vortia happily tearing open the second of many discounted Halloween surplus she’d planned on eating that day.

Halloween had been quite a fascinating night for both Extraterrestrials…Free to show off their antennae, the duo roamed about the sparse city streets Meitty and Tom watching and laughing all the while like parents watching their toddlers discover trick or treating for the first time. Fortunately ‘sexy alien babes’ seemed to be in this year, with Jerri and Tom donning alien makeup of their own, in a form of intergalactic cosplay. Meitty and Vortia were less that pleased at the sight, but had ventured out none the less. As they went about, many a household stood and lingered a bit longer than normal at their doorstep ogling the pear colored and pear shaped pair, some were even giving out a second handful of candy if it meant they stayed that much longer… That night the duo had devoured their entire humongous haul, and it was agreed that this was the best Earth custom they’d discovered yet.

Jerri awoke from her brief reminiscing, “It‘s just for science.” She said a little too quickly, and letting a smile cross her face. Jerri and Vortia’s mutual respect had grown from admiration and then straight to affection. Jerri, struck with an intensely erotic and fleshly idea, went back over both notebooks and compared statistics. Vorita had indeed enlarged with fat even faster than Meitty had, comparatively speaking. It was thanks in no small part to Meitranium’s seemingly endless hunger spilling off onto her favorite friend, along with Vortia having no concept of “normal” portions, just doing what Meitty did and continue to eat adding more portions to her plate at every meal. It wasn’t like Tom and Jerri were saying no, and neither was Vortia’s own gut. In fact she’d even taken a liking to studying the skills of food preparation; it was a relative to chemistry in the way things came together and added only at certain moments of preparation…She’d begun taking notes anytime she could; weather it was from Tom’s mother, Jerri, or quite often Tom himself. She had even started collecting them together in a notebook of her own in to her so called menu- (which was then was quickly corrected and labeled as a cookbook.) Pre-made delivered meals weren’t without their own perks though; Pizza was still an amazing creation to her.

“Somehow I doubt that science involves so much touching…” hinted Vortia as Jerri begun to bring out an overtaxed roll of measuring tape.

“Ha!” said a lush and husky voice from not too far away. Judging from the small rumbles, Jerri could tell Meitty wasn’t too far away.

However, Tom was actually next entering the bathroom. “Science is great and all Jerri, but Mom and Dad are going to be back any minute now…”

“Relax…Don’t pretend you don’t love this as much as I do…” answered Jerri now biting her lower lip as she measured the circumference of Vorita’s hips letting her hands brush up aside every inch of them.

“She has a point…” added Vortia who’d already gobbled down the candy bar. “I don’t recall you having a problem last night…” Teasing Tom like this had become a bit of a habit among the three.

“Yeah, thanks...But I’d rather Mom and Dad didn’t exactly know about this.” Tom said sweat beading upon his forehead.

“Well it’s not like you’ve been keeping it a BIG secret. I’m sure your parents know SOMETHING is up.” Noted Jerri as she finished scribbling in her notebook.

“Har-de-har-har. Good one Jerri,” said Tom sharply, “I’d rather not think about my parents thinking something like that.”

“Yeah, Tom …Why would you want to hide all this?” In marched Meitty. Well not so much marched as poured through the door way, her big green form and frame shook and jiggled with every step as she slowly trudged her way into the bathroom that was increasingly running out of free space.

How exactly BIG was she now?

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
Damn Meitty was just so wide now! Tom admired privately. Far from the lithe survivor she'd been so many months ago, now four of her former selves could probably fit inside this Meitty. So many folds to squeeze and explore to touch and feel inside and out. She was past 400lbs by now, easily, in fact Tom felt slightly warm as he readjusted his calculation Meitty had to be near halfway towards the big 500.

“I don’t think he can find clothes big enough to hide you” said Vortia sarcastically, as she began stepping off the scale.

“Well, I’ve come to appreciate so many Earthling’s all lavishing me with attention…” Meitty said with a husky chuckle, “Besides I believe you’ve gone native yourself, Erby-derby.” She added jutting a plump finger into one of Vortia’s own fat folds. Truly everyone (well apart from Mr. and Mrs. Parker) could marvel in varying degrees of awe at so much poundage smushed into so small a room.

Meitty smiled and took it all in stride as she raised a green foot and lowered it onto the waiting scale that seemed so small in comparison to her. The numbers flashed on the scale, and then an alarm sounded.

*BEEP BEEP BEEP*

“She broke it? Said Jerri breathless with a shocked look towards Tom.

“I broke it? ...Awesome!” Said an amazed Meitty, raising her chubby arms up as high as she sluggishly could.

“That scale is supposed to go up to f-five hundred p-pounds-…” Tom sputtered.

“You yammering simians!” said Vortia suddenly, (and only after giving an appreciative gaze to her big ass BFF.) “That’s not the scale, that’s the sound of my resonator going off…That must mean…”

The four of them quickly shared a glance; everyone was thinking the same thing. Slack jawed; they wordlessly understood that Meitty’s parents were now very close by! Tumbling and stumbling, they all quickly followed out the front door, so fast that they had barely noticed the sound of Tom’s parent’s car parking in the driveway at the exact same time. Looking for some sign of a space craft in the afternoon sky, they caught a flash as Meitty parent’s space car blipped from invisibility to visible. It rocked down, then seemingly stopped instantly, hovering briefly in mid-air before slowly sinking downwards and landing perfectly neat on solid Earth ground.

“Tom?...Is...that...?” asked Mr. Parker getting out of the car as fast as a missile.

Tom didn’t have to answer, as the doors to the Sedan looking spacecraft quickly opened.

“Meitrainum!” said Mr. Perioda seeing his little girl for the first time in ages! Quickly Mrs. Perioda followed out of the car, the three reuniting in a hug.

“Mom! Dad!” said Meitty tears in her eyes.

“Oh sweetie. We missed you so much. Are you all right?” asked her father as they continued to embrace.

“Yes. Oh faith yes! Especially since you two are here.” Meitty said only gave the slightest of sniffs to hold back her tears of happiness.

“Oh sweetie.” murmured Meitty’s mother. Soon the hug broke and the three were able the family was able to take each other in once more, and they realized there was a LOT LOT more of their daughter than there was before.

“Dear, take off that projector orb disguise they have you wearing, you’re safe now… “ Offered Meitty’s father thinking a disguise could be the only excuse for such a change in his little girl’s size and shape.

“Oh, um, actually, this is how I sort of how I look now….” Stated Meitty hands griping a good layer of fat to assure her parents that this was the real deal they were seeing.

“Oh!” said her mother clearly taken aback a bit by the sight of the swaying stoutness.

“Oh…well…You are still...healthy then?” her father asked, the puzzlement in his voice obvious. “I mean this isn’t some sort of planetary side effect or…“and here he lowered his voice a bit more “You aren’t …expecting...are you?”

“Dad! Ugh! No way! I’m fine, really! Never healthier!” she added with a grin from a mouth that had swallowed thousands of calories before noon that morning.

Her parents had to wonder though…What had happened to their Meitty? The once harsh and bratty teen who lashed out any chance she could when she felt her parents were being too clingy, now insisted on another hug. She’d somehow gone ‘soft’ on this planet Earth, in every sense of the word.

“So everything’s, been fine..?” Meitty’s father asked still a bit skeptical Meitty had the fortune of falling onto a friendly planet.

“Faith yes it has! These “Earthlings” here as they call themselves are great! They’ve only been nice to me, and maybe there a tiny bit underdeveloped in technology department but, they’ve found this replacement for food pills that you won’t believe-“ Meitty continued on as she explained in brevity the warm hospitality she’d received on the day of her crash, and from everyday onward.

Tom watched from afar letting Meitty and her family have their first conversation together in private as they reunited. He walked over to his own parent’s car, where he joined Jerri hand in hand. Vortia meanwhile gave a short wave towards the headed towards the Perodia family before opening the hatch of their space sedan and rummaging through it.

Meitranium pointed towards them…

"My name is…Rhodium. This is my partner Ruthenium. You’re the human who’s taken care of my daughter?” said Meitty’s father approaching Tom’s own father.

“Er? Why yes I a m, in a way I guess. My names John Parker…But I think you really want to speak with him.” Tom’s dad motioned to his son.

“Uh, oh him?” Said Mr. Perioda correcting his course of action. “Ah! So you’re theTom my daughter Meitty has talked about!”

“Y-y-es sir…It’s an honor to meet you…” Tom didn’t know why he was afraid, it wasn’t like he hadn’t met an alien before…He supposed it was the same nervousness anyone got when they were first meeting their lovers parents for the first time.

“Honor? I’m just a ship dealer!” said Mr.Perioda with a laugh, a bit taken aback by the high regard the humans seemed to have for him.

“Oh..right…Still though...We are….You know the first meeting between…”

“Yeah,”said Mr.Peroida scratching the back of his head nervously. “We’re kinda breaking a few dozen laws being here and visiting this planet before the Federation does but…you all seem like nice reasonable people.”

“Right…Well…Uh…We come in peace…and we’d sure love to join The Galactic Federation, if you’d have us.” Offered Mr. Parker breaking the ice by showing that he’d been paying very close attention any time Meitranium or Vortia would talk of their home world and its’ ways.

“Well we like Earth already! Isn’t that right darling?” Said Mr. Perodia, his own tone brightening as well.

“Sure do!" Mrs. Perioda took a second looking briefly around Earth landscape, the orange leaves, the blue sky, it was so breathtakingly different. More importantly..."Anyone that can look after our Meitty is fine by us.”

“Sooo.... what exactly is going to happen?” asked Tom sensing that things were going to get very different very fast.

“Well the way I see it, we have a few options…” Said Mr. Perodia now feeling quite casual here he slipped into his persuasive and articulate ship-salesman voice. “Once we take Vortia and Meitty back home, and we say Meitty sent a distress beacon from a planet she’d crashed on, we immediately picked her up, and she had no human interfering at all. Then we let The Galactic Federation oversee everything from there, they meet with your planets leaders, and let them sort out the negotiations from there. Then once the Feds give us the okay, we all meet together again!"

“Daddy that would take FOREVER. It took you forever just to explain it!” whined Meitty as she crossed her arms.

“Now, now, sweetie…” came the soothing tones of her mother. “The Council can be a bit sterile and drab but they eventually make the right choice.”

“Well...” offered Meitty raising her voice a bit. “I was thinking…maybe Tom could come back with us?” asked Meitty hopefully.

“The Earthling boy?” asked Mr. Perioda.

“Well sure Dad, I mean, he does know Earth better than anyone else outer space… Plus I kinda love him…” said Meitty bringing her hands together in a syrupy sweet manner.

“Oh Meitty I don’t know if-“ began her father, nervous at what possible outcomes he’d have to deal with.

“Say no more sweetie.” Meitty’s mom said cutting in and deciding for the two of them. This Tom boy might have to answer a few questions in front of The Galactic Federation but just the idea of the two of you together just makes me so happy I could...” she caught herself and tried to not sound so excited as she started speaking again. “I mean that is if Tom wants to go…”

Tom's life had already become an adventure, and his series of choices had all led him up to this moment, but this was the most important choice he might ever make...

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
All sets of present eyes turned to Tom. Tom turned first to Meitty than to his family, he was stunned. A million thoughts were racing through his head, his heart thumping, would he, could he really do it? Go to space! More than that, go farther than any Earthling’s every gone before? It was the chance of a lifetime, no, a billion lifetimes everyone on Earth who’d ever looked up in the sky and wondered if there was ever anybody else out there in the vast space above… But speaking of lifetimes and everyone on Earth…Maybe it would be better if he just stayed here on Earth with Jerri. Tom felt like he really wasn’t exactly the best example of the human race. Maybe his dad should go, or wait, nobody had to go, he could just stay here and let each of their governments work things out as Mr. Perioda had suggested.

“I’ll go with you Meitty...” Tom finally breathed as he uttered his decision.

“Well alright son!” said Tom’s father with an agreeable hand on his sons shoulder.

“Oh Tom. Your so brave, you make me so proud your my son." Added his Mother as she gave Tom a hug and a kiss.

“Love you guys too” said Tom feeling a weight lifted from his shoulders now that he'd made his descion.

“Techonlogy! Oh thank faith!” said Voirta darting towards them and away from the car. “Mind if I take these?” she asked holding two long black tablet like devices.

“Well they’re a bit outdated but why would you need to take them?” asked Mr. Perodia.

“Oh yeah I forgot to mention…” began Vortia letting a finger curl one of her curly red locks as she trailed off. “Meitty and I were talking...and...well I decided to stay here on Earth”

“What?” asked Jerri her eyes bulging a bit.

“What!” echoed Tom.

“Yeah. I mean, like, if the Parker’s are willing to have me…” Vortia turned and offered up an innocent smile toward her human house-owners.

“Well sure, you’re the best plumber and electrician in the whole state." said Mr. Parker. "You all are always welcome, but...Why? Don’t you want to go home?”

“Well, you know…It’s sort of like when two races would betroth each other’s prince and princes to ensure peace between their planets. In a way it’s the same thing with an Earthling on our planet and a Metaliaen on Earth….”

“Really Vortia?” said a skeptical sound Meitty complete with an arch of her eyebrows. “That’s what you’re going with?”

Vortia remained silent before finally blurting… “Okay! So, Really, I just want to be the most popular girl around when everyone see Earth culture!” she said with an exasperation. "When everyone else shows up, I‘m going to be soooo popular. “Human’s yeah, I know everything there is to know about them. Great race of people.” There was a shared a glance between Vortia and Jerri that thankfully Mr. and Mrs. Parker didn’t catch…. “But then I’m going to be like Earth, been there done that, got the t-shirt. No offense...” She added with a grin. “Plus, now that I have a firggen one of these babies!” she booted up one of the devices she'd retrieved from the Periodia's space sedan and took a picture of herself and nodded approvingly that the device did work. “Now that we finally have some tech that actually works beyond Earth’s plasma sphere, I’ll be set for all my cosmic communication needs. I figure won’t be too hard to switch it over to charge on Earthling’s alternating current sockets. It’ll feel just like home…”

“Home…” Meitty uttered suddenly a bit under her breath at the word. She really, really, had missed it. Just the word was enough to give her a quiver of dreamy homesickness.

“Yes, not to ruin the moment or anything but like I said before...kinda not supposed to be here.” Added Mr. Parker noticing Meitty’s melancholy.

“Well, hell son better get packing!” said Mr. Parker clapping his hands.

“Your father’s right! It’s not every day you get to go offered a trip to an alien planet. Just be sure to bring plenty of clean underwear…”said his mother giving him a swift swat on his backside.

“Mooomm seriously? School was enough but now you’re embarrassing me in front of people from another planet!” Said Tom turning red.
The teasing was enough to put everyone in a fit of laughs, a parent’s love for their child effortlessly crossing all inter-species culture barriers.

***

choices: Again, continue..
1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
Tom had packed in a rush, for what felt like hours. Jerri and Vortia explained to the Parkers that such a trip to Meitty’s home planet wouldn’t take nearly as long as the first time.

“Well…Hmm…" said Vortia as she finished counting figures in her head. "Given reflationary space time distillation along with Council hauling one of their cruisers through here, I figure it’d be the equivalent of…An Earth week?”

“That’s-that’s fantastic!” lauded Mr. and Mrs. Parker.

“Yeah, it’d been even shorter if they decide to bridge the superhighway out this way….” Said Vortia continuing on. Later, while the Parker’s were listening as the Perioda’s explaining their whole side of the events to each other, Jerri had caught a glimpse of Tom from the corner of her eye, waving for her to come back into the Parker household with him.

“Listen Jerri, I just wanted to talk to you.” Tom began immediately as the door shut behind Jerri. “Everything’s happening so fast, I just wanted to know…” he looked solemnly from his two suitcases, back to Jerri, “Do you think I made the right choice to go with Meitty?”

“Oh Tom, I think it’s awesome!” said Jerri eyes bright with sparks of energy.

“What?” Tom asked turning to her “You’re not…You’re not mad at me?” Perplexed had become quite the common look on Tom’s face today, now was no different.

“I mean, it makes sense to me. Besides…I’d be a bit pissed if you didn’t…” added Jerri with a playful punch to his arm.

“What?” asked Tom again dumbfounded.

“Well think about it!” said Jerri excitedly “I’d get to know the first Alien on Earth, AND the first human who’s ever been on an alien planet!”

Tom had to smile; he wondered how much of the beaming face Jerri was just putting on was real. They’d both talked about something like this happening before in wispy day-dreamy conversations over the summer but, now that it was actually here....Well...Jerri was putting on her damnedest to make this as painless as possible; he’d better keep his own composure “...Did you mean know in the biblical sense?”

“Shut up you jerk..hah…I’m trying to be serious here…”

“I know…I know…I’m just…kind of scared… you know…Kind of nervous but excited too? I mean who knows what’s going to happen…”

“It's all so exciting....And I can’t wait to hear all about it…”

“Yeah?”

“Yeah! I mean, it’s going to be weird having to keep things a bit of a secret for a tiny while longer, but it’s not like I’m not gonna’ stop talking to your Mom and Dad either. Vortia’s here so we’ll have a way to keep in touch. Plus this way I can go over my notes, and we’ll see has the exclusive first big exclusive on the new Metaltian species. Me! My name in lights, television interviews, by then I’ll be probably too busy swimming in big bucks to even talk to you…”

“Sure thing Jerri. Seriously though we’ll...uh…”drive” back just as soon as thing get settled on Metaltian...You know that. And I promise I’ll give you the interview of a lifetime!”

“I…know…I just don’t know what I’m going to do, or even exactly when you’ll be back. I know things have all gotten crazy...But I’m glad it’s you. I mean it’s not like I DON’T 100% trust you with the fate of the Earth and all, but I figure with Meitty on your side you can’t mess it up…too much.” They both shared another short laugh, before their eyes locked on each other once more. “I mean that’s sort of why I was attracted to you in the first place…your kind…sweet…your gentle.” Jerri could feel her eyes welling up a bit. “Fuck, why is this so hard for me…Tom, you know, we both sorta knew something like this was gonna happen.” In an expert manner she grabbed him and brought him in close. *Kiss* “You’ll do fine. I know you will.”

“Well if your big brains think I can do it. Then hey, I don’t think anything can scare me.” The two shared a few minutes in one last long embrace, savoring the moment and the passion they each had for each other. The moment could have lasted forever if not for-

“Tom-Turkey!” cried his dad from just outside.

"Well...that sounds like Meitty's parents are getting rearing to go..." said Jerri, backing up slowly before finally breaking from Tom's embrace.

"I love you Jerri...To the stars and back..." said Tom before bringing her in for one more kiss. Jerri melted, hearing those words and into his kiss one last time for who knew how long.

***
1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.title: The Inexplicably Long Conclusion...Continues

1113221112112112212222122112111122111111.content:
Carrying the largest two suitcases in the house Tom and Jerri lugged them out and placed them in the back of the Space Sedan. Rhodium Perioda was nervously checking the Metalean equivalent of a watch as he hurriedly finished talking with Tom's parents.

"I really hate to cut this moment short, but if we're going to do this we've got to go now..." he explained looking to Tom.

"It's been wonderful to meet you humans, we really must meet again the first moment we can." added Ruthenium Perioda as she thanked Tom's parents a final time before heading to the car.

"Make us proud son." said Mr. Parker giving his son a solemn nod.

“Some kids go backpacking around Europe when the reach College age. Mine gets to go to an alien planet. Somehow I blame your father for this.” added Louise Parker, tearing up a bit but keeping her smile.

“Aww, Mom…I love you too.” Said Tom taking each of them in for one last hug that would have to last him a while. Then, suddenly the entire family was embraced by a pair of fat flabby arms. Meitty, had come in for a hug for her two carbon based life form caretakers. "I...I love you too." she said choked up as they embraced. "...Thank you for putting up with me..Thank you for everything..."

Eventually even that hug eventually ended and Tom and the Perioda's climbed into the space sedan and made sure every detail was taken care of. With that the engine roared to life.

“Again, I sincerely can not thank you enough for your daughter.” Said Mr. Perioda opening the hatch door to the Space Sedan.

“And, We’ll take utmost care of your son.” added Mrs. Perioda.

“Please do.” said Mrs. Parker.

In the backseat Meitty was finishing her chat with Vorita "Hey, don't get too cool for me here on Earth. At least have time for a talk when we get back to Metalean Galaxy. I want to talk to everyone."

"Oh I will." assured Vorita. "And I might not be able to catch up with everyone else in the galaxy just yet... Well, I know I have at least one person on Earth here who likes me...well you know REALLY really likes me" added Vortia her eyes darting quick to Jerri who was saying her final goodbyes to Tom. "Besides I got to make sure the Galactic Federation doesn't do anything too crazy. Sure, I'll have to make up some story about crash landing here minutes before they got here, but that's only if they find me...Which they won't." she added with a wink and wave of her orb pierced antenna.

Meanwhile from just outside of the front driver-seat Tom’s father was searching for the right words. “We…uh…look forward to the future between our two planets.”

“As do I John Parker of Earth” sharing a father to father nod with Tom’s dad.

“And uh-well-shoot we’d love to have you over for dinner!” added Mrs. Parker.

“Hmm an interesting proposition as well.” Noted Mr. Perioda.

“Meitty will have to tell me more of this dinner and food concept.” chimed Mrs. Perioda.

“Well…until then… May you live long and prosper.” Finished Mr. Parker, patting himself mentally on the back for his quick and excellent choice of words, it took all he could to not do the traditional Star-Trek Vulcan hand salute as well.

“Hmmm” said Mr. Perioda approvingly. “An excellent phrase Earthling. May you also ‘Live long and prosper.’” Tom gave his dad thumbs up from the back seat, which his father goofily returned. The vehicles engine roared to life, and Tom felt his stomach drop a bit as he realized they were beginning to levitate.

“I love you!” Tom said over and over again. “I’ll call you when we get there!” he assured his family waving as hard he could! So the ship was higher than the roof of his house, his parents, Vortia, and Jerri smaller and smaller versions of themselves standing on his front lawn waving all the while.

“Well are you two ready?” asked Mr. Perioda, seconds from engaging the hyperspace drive. The two shared a glance then nodded. It was a perfect lift-off.

***


Meitty turned and gazed at Tom then out the window, now truly no longer stranded or earthbound. What were the chances that in all that black vastness of space she’d ended up on this blue planet, and on top of that what were the odds she’d meet such a kind and hunky Earth male?

Fricking Faith! Faith… Well, she’d certainly had a happy turn around having gone from one of her worst days ever, to now officially a planet discoverer, yep, she could live with that. She wouldn’t even brag about it to her friends…that much. She would show off her now “very very close” exotic Earthling boyfriend, oh and her new Earth transformed body too. OH! And tell of all the wonders of Earth foo-!

”Fricken faith!” said Meitty aloud suddenly.

“What is it Meitty?” asked Tom with a sense of urgency.

“We f-f-orgot food!?” said Meitty her face down-turned into the deepest pout ever. How could she go back to food pills now!?

“…Well, I certainly didn’t.” said Tom, finally his turn to put on a braggish tone in his voice. “I maybe happened to sneak in some twonkies, and of course a Tupperware of chili…You’ll have to ration it a bit but- Gezemmhn”

Meitty’s full face had met his at full force for an impactful succulent kiss. “Oh, Tom have I told you lately how much I love you?”

“Well I was going to say it’s nice you’re thinking more about your family over food…” He added, “but I just guess it means will just be heading back to Earth with more storage next time... Until then I think the both of us can make it together? What do you think?”

“Together.” Agreed Meitty firmly.

They both watched as the pale blue dot that housed the entire human race shrank and shrank behind them, till finally it was out of sight. Tom and Meitty squeezed each others hands in the backseat of the car, ready for all the excitement that awaited them, not just when they arrived on Metlanium, or returned back to Earth, but for all the rest of their lives.

The End

This is the story of a young college student from beyond the stars, Meitnerium Perioda, come crash landing to Earth. Don't worry, she's generally pretty angloid. It's okay if you think she's hot. You decide where she crashes, the kind of people she meets, and in turn the kind of person(?) she becomes. Add your own chapters, your own characters, and more importantly your own ideas to help make your own alien fat-girl fantasy come true~!!

...With a few simple rules.
1.) This is a straight-up weight gain story and I'd prefer to keep it that way.
2.) That being said, try to make our little alien heroine's gain believable? I realize its an alien story, but let's not have her gain more than a pound in a sitting okay?
3.) She's stranded. Completely and totally. This means no home planet technology. It's fine if, after a while, she stumbles across something that isn't totally destroyed in the wreckage. But she can't start off with anything more than the clothes on her back.
4.) Add. And add right. None of this two sentence garbage, really put some thought into your additions.

Other than that, I don't think there's anything much else left to say other than have fun taking our sweet little heroine crashlanding into obesity. I wish you all well and hope you enjoy this interactive~
